topics: Software Engineering
summary: The 32nd Asia-Pacific Software Engineering Conference (APSEC 2025) will be held from December 2-5, 2025, at Wynn Palace in Macao, China. APSEC is a leading regional conference that brings together researchers and practitioners to share knowledge and best practices in software engineering. The conference program includes keynote speakers, paper presentations, tool demonstrations, tutorials, and co-located workshops, with tracks such as the Technical Track, Early Research Achievements (ERA), and Software Engineering in Practices (SEIP).
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: Technical Track

The APSEC 2025 technical research track invites high-quality contributions describing original results in the discipline of software engineering. This track features the most recent and significant innovations in the field.

## Topics of Interest

Solicited topics include, but are not limited to:

### Tools and processes
*   Agile processes
*   DevOps and Container
*   Configuration Management and Deployment
*   Software Engineering Process and Standards

### Requirements and Design
*   Service-oriented Computing
*   Component-based Software Engineering
*   Cooperative, Distributed, and Global Software Engineering
*   Software Architecture, Modeling and Design
*   Middleware, Frameworks, and APIs
*   Software Product-line Engineering

### Testing and Analysis
*   Testing, Verification, and Validation
*   Program Analysis
*   Program Synthesis
*   Program Repairs

### Formal Aspects of Software Engineering
*   Formal Methods
*   Model-driven and Domain-specific Engineering

### Human Factors and Social Aspects of Software Engineering
*   Software Comprehension, Visualization, and Traceability
*   Software for Green and Sustainable Technologies

### AI and Software Engineering
*   AI for Software Engineering
*   Software Engineering for AI
*   Search-based Software Engineering

### Dependability, Safety, and Reliability
*   Reliability, availability, and safety
*   Performance
*   Vulnerability detection to enhance software security

### Software Maintenance and Evolution
*   Refactoring
*   Reverse Engineering
*   Software Reuse
*   Software Project Management
*   Debugging, Defect Prediction, and Fault Localization

### Software Repository Mining and Data Analytics

APSEC 2025 welcomes submissions addressing topics in a variety of application domains, including mobile, cloud, blockchains, embedded, and cyber-physical systems.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Length:** Technical research papers must not exceed **12 pages** (including references).
*   **Format:** Submissions must be in English and conform to the **IEEE Conference Proceedings Formatting Guidelines**. Use A4 paper size PDF format. LaTeX users must use `\documentclass[10pt,conference]{IEEEtran}`.
*   **Submission System:** Papers must be submitted electronically in PDF format before the due date via HotCRP: [https://apsec25.hotcrp.com](https://apsec25.hotcrp.com)
*   **Originality:** Submitted papers must have been neither previously accepted for publication nor concurrently submitted for review in another journal, book, conference, or workshop.
*   **Evaluation Criteria:** Submissions will be evaluated by at least three program committee members focusing on novelty, originality, importance to the field, proper use of research methods, and presentation.

## Double Blind Policy

APSEC 2025 uses a double-blind reviewing process. Submissions must **not reveal authors' identities**.

*   Omit authors’ names and institutions from the title page.
*   References to authors’ own related work must be in the third person (e.g., "We build on the work of...").
*   If a submission is a clear follow-up to previous work, references to that previous work can be anonymized (e.g., "based on previous results [10] Anonymous Authors. Omitted for double blind reviewing."). Ensure the submission is self-contained.
*   Do not include acknowledgements that would reveal identity.
*   Avoid accidental unblinding by using different project/work names for submissions if the original name is identifying.
*   Avoid mentioning specific institution affiliations or organizations; use general terms like "an introductory CS course" or "Org/Company" where appropriate.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract Deadline:** Sunday, July 6, 2025
*   **Paper Deadline:** Sunday, July 13, 2025
*   **Author Notification:** Saturday, September 13, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** Monday, October 20, 2025

## Accepted Papers

All accepted papers will be included in the IEEE Digital Library as the APSEC 2025 conference proceedings. Authors cannot change the list of authors or paper titles after acceptance without permission. The content of the camera-ready version should reflect reviewers' comments as much as possible.

## Conference Attendance Expectation

If a submission is accepted, at least one author must register for APSEC 2025 and present the paper at the conference. Papers not presented will be removed from the proceedings.

## Contact

Jacky Keung and Eunjong Choi
APSEC 2025 Program Co-Chairs

## Submission Link

[https://apsec25.hotcrp.com](https://apsec25.hotcrp.com)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: AROB 31st 2026 & ISBC 11th 2026

The **31st International Symposium on Artificial Life and Robotics (AROB 31st 2026)** and the **11th International Symposium on BioComplexity (ISBC 11th 2026)** will be held from **January 21 to January 23, 2026**, at **B-Con PLAZA, Beppu, JAPAN**. This symposium brings together researchers to discuss the development of new technologies concerning artificial life and robotics, based on computer simulations and hardware designs.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Adaptation
*   Agent-based modelling
*   Artificial brain
*   Artificial intelligence
*   Artificial life
*   Artificial living
*   Artificial mind
*   Bio-inspired robotics
*   Bio-mimetics
*   Bio-robot
*   Biocomplexity
*   Bioinformatics
*   Biological evolution
*   Biomedical database
*   Biomedical imaging
*   Brain science
*   Chaos
*   Cognitive science

*   Decentralized control
*   Disease models and mechanisms
*   Distributed system
*   DNA computing
*   Ethology
*   Evolution of cooperation
*   Evolutionary computations (Genetic algorithm)
*   Gene expression and regulation
*   Genome/Omics medicine
*   Human genome information
*   Human-machine interaction and collaboration
*   Identification and Estimation
*   In silico drug discovery
*   Intelligent control
*   Learning (Phenotypic plasticity)
*   Machine Learning
*   Manipulator
*   Medical big data
*   Medical informatics
*   Mobile robots
*   Model estimation
*   Modular robotics
*   Molecular biology
*   Molecular evolution
*   Molecular network
*   Motion planning and navigation
*   Multi-agent systems
*   Multivariate statistics
*   Nano-biology
*   Nano-robot
*   Neural networks
*   Neurocomputing technologies and its application for hardware
*   Parallel and distributed computing
*   Phase polyphenism
*   Quantum computing
*   Quorum sensing
*   Regenerative medicine
*   Robot vision and image processing
*   Robotic Mechanism
*   Security
*   Self-organization
*   Sensor and multi-sensor data fusion
*   Social insects
*   Social physiology
*   Sociometry
*   Swarm intelligence
*   Swarm robot
*   Swarm robotics
*   Tele-operation
*   Walking robot

## Organized Sessions (OS)

In addition to regular submissions, AROB-ISBC 2026 will feature Organized Sessions on focused research topics. Details will be announced on the conference page.

*   **Deadline for OS Proposals:** October 7, 2025 at 24:00 UTC

## Important Dates

*   **Deadline for Abstract Submission for review:** October 14, 2025 at 24:00 UTC
*   **Notification of acceptance:** October 30, 2025
*   **Deadline for Final Camera-Ready Papers:** December 15, 2025 at 24:00 UTC
*   **Deadline for Early Registration:** December 15, 2025 at 24:00 UTC
*   **Registration Deadline for Presenters:** December 15, 2025 at 24:00 UTC

## Journal Track Submissions

Accepted papers for the General Sessions of AROB 31st 2026 can also be submitted for the Journal Track.

*   **Overview:** Accepted papers will be published in the journal **Artificial Life and Robotics, Vol. 31, No. 1, 2026**.
*   **In-person participation and presentation at the symposium are required** if the symposium paper is accepted.
*   **Discount:** Authors of accepted Journal Track papers will receive a discount on the journal publication fee equal to the Regular Early Registration Fee at AROB-ISBC 2026.
*   **Important Dates (Journal Track):**
    *   Full Paper Submission (Max. 12 pages): **August 31, 2025**
    *   Notification of acceptance: **November 29, 2025**
    *   Final Paper Submission Deadline: **December 16, 2025**
*   **Paper Submission Requirements (Journal Track):**
    *   Length: Maximum of **12 pages**, including references and any appendices.
    *   Peer Review: All submissions will undergo a peer-review process.
    *   Templates:
        *   [Word Template (.docx)](https://isarob.org/symposium/includes/files/AROB_WordTemplate.docx)
        *   [LaTeX Template (.zip)](https://isarob.org/symposium/includes/files/AROB_TexTemplate.zip)
*   **Important Notes (Journal Track):**
    *   Initial versions of Journal Track papers will be included in the symposium proceedings if accepted by AROB 31st 2026.
    *   If the final version of an accepted journal paper is not submitted in time, it will be published in a subsequent issue.
    *   If a decision for a Journal Track paper is not made by December 16, 2025, it will still be treated as a Journal Track submission and published in a subsequent issue.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be published in the **Proceedings of the AROB**. Extended versions of selected papers will be published in the international journal: **Artificial Life and Robotics, Springer Japan**.

## Submission Guidelines

Please refer to the href="submission_guidelines" - Submission Guidelines page under the "Submission Forms" menu for detailed instructions.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 20th ACM ASIA Conference on Computer and Communications Security (ACM ASIACCS 2025) seeks paper submissions presenting novel contributions related to all real-world aspects of security and privacy. We seek articles presenting accessible and compelling results to general computer security researchers. Purely theoretical submissions (e.g., cryptography-focused, with no security/application connections) are not encouraged, nor are submissions focusing primarily on blockchains or machine learning.

Like in previous years, we will also be accepting “Systemisation of Knowledge” (SoK) papers. SoK submissions need to add the prefix **“SoK: ”** in the title. They will be accepted based on the value to the community. Survey papers without insights evaluating, systematizing, and contextualizing current knowledge will be rejected.

## Program Chairs

*   Michail Maniatakos (New York University Abu Dhabi, UAE)
*   Yinqian Zhang (Southern University of Science and Technology, China)

## Important Dates

### Cycle 1 Deadline

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** 23:59, **20 September 2024** (AoE)
*   **Early Rejection:** 25 October 2024
*   **Author Notification:** 13 December 2024
*   **Camera Ready:** 11 January 2025

### Cycle 2 Deadline

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** 23:59, **20 January 2025** (AoE)
*   **Early Rejection:** 28 February 2025
*   **Author Notification:** 19 April 2025
*   **Camera Ready:** 25 May 2025

## Submission Instructions

Please read the instructions below before submitting your paper. Please get in touch with the PC chairs at [asiaccs2025-pc-chairs@acm.org](mailto:asiaccs2025-pc-chairs@acm.org) for any questions regarding the submissions.

[SUBMIT YOUR PAPER HERE](https://asiaccs2025b.hotcrp.com/)

## Paper Formatting

*   Technical papers submitted for ASIACCS must be written in English.
*   Papers must be in PDF format and at most **12 pages** double-column. We will allow up to 10 additional pages for the bibliography and well-marked appendices, but note that reviewers are not expected to read the appendices.
*   Authors should prepare the submissions using the latest [ACM Sigconf style conference template](https://www.acm.org/conference-conference-templates).
*   All fonts, images, tables, and figures must comply with common standards and not generate problems for reviewers.
*   Titles of SoK papers must begin with “SoK:”
*   Submissions not meeting the formatting requirements risk rejection without consideration of their merits.

## Conflicts of Interest (COI)

When submitting the paper, authors must declare the conflict of interest (COI) with the Program Committee members, including the chairs. Those who are considered COI include:

*   Anyone who shares an institutional affiliation with an author of the paper at the time of submission.
*   Anyone who was the advisor or advisee of an author at any time in the past.
*   Anyone the author has collaborated with or published within the prior two years.

PC members, including chairs with a conflict of interest with a paper, will be entirely excluded from the evaluation of that paper. Failure to declare COI or declaring fake COI can lead to the paper being rejected. If a PC member with COI reviews a paper, it will be rejected.

## Anonymous Submissions

ASIACCS employs a double-blind reviewing process. All submissions should be appropriately anonymized. Author names and affiliations should not appear in the paper. The authors should avoid obvious self-references and should appropriately blind them if used. The list of authors cannot be changed (but the order can be) after the submission is made unless approved by the Program Chairs. Publishing the submission on a preprint repository, such as arXiv, is allowed, but authors should refrain from broadly advertising their results (e.g., social media, seminars, etc.) and may not contact TPC members regarding their submitted work.

## Double and Concurrent Submissions

Submissions to ASIACCS 2025 must not substantially overlap with papers that are published or simultaneously submitted to other venues with proceedings (including journals or conferences/workshops). Double submission will result in immediate rejection. We may report detected violations to other conference chairs and journal editors.

## Ethical Considerations

The authors should clarify any potential ethical and legal concerns to their results, highly critical vulnerabilities or exploits, etc. The authors should provide evidence (beyond approval of the experiment by their institution) elaborating how they have thoroughly considered such issues. The Program Committee reserves the right to reject a submission if the authors present insufficient evidence that the study appropriately addressed ethical or relevant legal concerns.

## Early Rejection and Appeals

There will be no conventional rebuttal process. Papers that receive substantially negative initial reviews will be rejected early. The authors of early-rejected papers, and only such papers, will receive a copy of their initial reviews. Authors who substantively disagree with the reviews can appeal to the PC chairs within 72 hours upon receipt of the notification email. Authors’ appeals must clearly and explicitly identify substantial disagreements with factual statements in the initial reviews that should be adjudicated by a particular arbitration reviewer who the PC chairs may recruit. Appealing a submission that was rejected early will keep it under consideration, and it cannot be withdrawn or resubmitted elsewhere until the final notification of acceptance or rejection.

## Paper Revision and Resubmission

Rejected papers in Cycle 1 cannot be resubmitted in Cycle 2. A small number of Cycle 1 submissions may receive a “Revise” decision, rather than “Accept” or “Reject,” and may be revised and resubmitted together with the response to reviewers’ comments into the same HOTCRP submission server. The revision may include running additional experiments, improving the paper’s presentation, or other improvements. Papers meeting the expectations will typically be accepted. We will request additional revisions only in exceptional circumstances.

## Camera-Ready and Conference Presentation

If a paper is accepted, the author list in the submission cannot be changed when preparing the camera-ready version. Authors of accepted papers must also guarantee that their papers will be presented at the conference. At least one author of the paper must be registered at the appropriate full conference rate.

## Contact

For any questions related to paper submissions, please contact the PC chairs at [asiaccs2025-pc-chairs@acm.org](mailto:asiaccs2025-pc-chairs@acm.org).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ASE 2025

The IEEE/ACM Automated Software Engineering (ASE) Conference series is the premier research forum for automated software engineering. Each year, it brings together researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to discuss foundations, techniques, and tools for automating the analysis, design, implementation, testing, and maintenance of large software systems. ASE 2025 invites high-quality contributions describing significant, original, and unpublished results.

## New This Year

*   **PC Self-nomination:** We are inviting self-nominations to serve on our Program Committee. To contribute as a reviewer and help shape the technical program, please complete the PC self-nomination form: [https://forms.gle/uPZCVDeH4WzwvtmF6](https://forms.gle/uPZCVDeH4WzwvtmF6). We would greatly appreciate receiving your self-nomination by **January 10**.
*   **Major Revisions:** Instead of rejecting papers outright, reviewers have the opportunity to request changes that may require up to four weeks to accommodate. If a paper receives a 'Revision' outcome, reviewers will specify concrete and actionable revision criteria, agreeing to accept the paper in principle if these criteria are met. Authors will be notified about the outcome for their revision after it is checked by the discussion lead.
*   **Auto-bidding:** Leveraging the success at other conferences like ICSE 2025 and OOPSLA 2024, we will use the Toronto Paper Matching System (TPMS) to streamline and automate the paper bidding and assignment process, reducing reviewer workload and increasing expertise per paper.
*   **Rapid Response Reviewers:** To handle unexpected unavailability of reviewers, we invite a small percentage of interested PC members to become Rapid Response Reviewers. They will initially review a smaller number of papers but commit to reviewing up to two additional papers within a shorter timeframe at the end of the reviewing period.

## tl;dr

*   **Submission link:** [https://ase25.hotcrp.com/](https://ase25.hotcrp.com/)
*   **Template:** `\documentclass[10pt,conference]{IEEEtran}`
*   **Page limit:** 10 pages (excluding references) + up to 2 additional pages containing ONLY references.
*   **Artifact:** Provide a link to an anonymous artifact or an explanation why it's not possible.
*   **Categories:** Choose a Research Area and a Paper Type (Technical/Experience).
*   **Compliance:** Ensure compliance with double-blind review, plagiarism, and human studies policies.

## Research Areas

ASE welcomes submissions across the full spectrum of Automated Software Engineering, grouped into the following nine research areas. These topics are not exhaustive. Each submission must indicate one primary and optionally a secondary area.

1.  **Requirements and Design:** Requirements elicitation and management, traceability analysis, software architecture and design, modeling and model-driven engineering, software product lines, component-based or service-oriented systems, object-oriented or aspect-oriented systems.
2.  **Testing and Analysis:** Regression, mutation, and model-based testing; system, unit, and integration testing; black-, grey-, and white-box fuzzing; automated program repair and synthesis; static and dynamic analysis; empirical program analysis.
3.  **Maintenance and Evolution:** Debugging and fault localization, refactoring and reengineering, reverse engineering, software reuse, API design and management.
4.  **Human and Social Aspects:** Software engineering processes (e.g., agile, DevOps), green and sustainable technologies, software engineering ethics and values, software economics, systematic code review and inspection, program comprehension and visualization, crowd-based and collaborative software engineering, human-computer interface.
5.  **AI and Software Engineering:** Autonomous and self-adapting systems, search-based software engineering, recommender systems, AI4SE, SE4AI.
6.  **Software Analytics:** Mining software repositories, analysis of mobile apps and app stores, data-driven user experience understanding and improvement, data-driven decision making in software engineering, software metrics (and measurements).
7.  **Formal Aspects of Software Engineering:** Formal methods and model checking, programming languages, domain-specific or specification languages, software validation and verification.
8.  **Security and Other Non-Functional Properties:** Security and privacy, dependability and safety, reliability and availability, performance.
9.  **Application Domains:** ASE welcomes submissions on topics across various application domains, including mobile, cloud, blockchains, embedded and cyber-physical systems, parallel/distributed/concurrent systems, probabilistic systems, and ubiquitous/pervasive software systems.

## Submission Categories

We solicit submissions in two categories:

*   **Technical Research Papers:** These papers should describe innovative research in automating software development or supporting users in software development. They must clearly articulate the novelty, impact, and assumptions, and be supported by rigorous research methods.
*   **Experience Papers:** These papers should describe significant experiences applying automated software engineering technology. They must clearly present a problem's context, the investigation methods, evidence for conclusions, and lessons learned for others.

## Review Criteria

*   **Technical Research Papers:** Evaluated on Significance, Novelty, and Soundness.
*   **Experience Papers:** Evaluated on Importance and Scope, Insights and Evidence, and Perspective.
*   **All Papers:** Evaluated on Verifiability (reproducibility) and Presentation quality.

## Originality

*   Papers must be original, unpublished, and not under review elsewhere. Authors must adhere to ACM and IEEE plagiarism policies.
*   The chairs may share submission lists and use plagiarism detection software.

## Double Anonymous Review Process

*   Submissions must be anonymous; authors' identities and affiliations must be omitted.
*   Prior work should be cited in the third person.
*   Authors should avoid identifying their preprints during the review period.

## Artifact Availability and Supplementary Material

*   Authors are strongly encouraged to disclose anonymized and curated data to enhance reproducibility.
*   Data can be uploaded via HotCRP or linked anonymously.
*   Ensure all supplementary material also adheres to the double-anonymous policy.

## ACM Policy on Research Involving Humans

*   If research involves human subjects, compliance with the ACM Policy on Research Involving Humans must be affirmed during submission.
*   Authors are responsible for adhering to local ethical standards and obtaining necessary approvals.

## Formatting and Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions must be made electronically via the ASE 2025 HotCRP submission site: [https://ase25.hotcrp.com/](https://ase25.hotcrp.com/).
*   All submissions must be in English.
*   **Format:** PDF.
*   **Formatting:** Conforms to IEEE Conference Proceedings Formatting Guidelines (use `\documentclass[10pt,conference]{IEEEtran}` without `compsoc` or `compsocconf` options). Main text should not exceed 10 pages; up to 2 additional pages for references only.
*   **Experience papers:** Must prominently include the phrase "experience paper" in the abstract.
*   Use the HotCRP format checker, but note its limitations.

## Accepted Papers

*   Accepted papers will have a limit of 11 pages (plus 2 pages for references) to incorporate review feedback.
*   Author lists and paper titles cannot be changed after acceptance without explicit permission.
*   Authors are strongly encouraged to archive research artifacts (code, data) with a DOI.
*   At least one author must register for ASE 2025 and present the paper.

## Questions and Comments

Please contact the PC chairs at [ase25.conf@gmail.com](mailto:ase25.conf@gmail.com).

# Call for Papers

The IEEE International Conference on Image Processing (ICIP 2025) will be held in **Anchorage, Alaska, USA, from September 14 – 17, 2025**. The conference theme is **“Imaging in the Age of GenAI”**. ICIP 2025 is recognized as the Signal Processing Society’s (SPS) largest and most comprehensive conference dedicated to image & video processing and computer vision.

## Types of Contributions Solicited

We invite submissions for various tracks and formats, including:
*   Regular Papers
*   Special Sessions Papers
*   Datasets and Benchmarks Track Papers
*   Open Journal of Signal Processing (OJSP) Track Papers
*   Journal Paper Presentations
*   Industry Demonstrations
*   Industry Expert Talks: Call for Presentations
*   Satellite Workshops

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

A call for papers invites researchers to submit their work to ASRU 2025 for presentation or publication, outlining topics, and deadlines.

The ASRU Workshop is a flagship event of IEEE Speech and Language Processing Technical Committee. It has a tradition of bringing together researchers from academia and industry to discuss problems in automatic speech recognition and understanding. The workshop will feature invited talks/keynotes, regular papers and special sessions. All papers will be presented as posters.

If you have any questions, please contact the ASRU 2025 TPC Chairs at [tpc@ieeeasru.org](mailto:tpc@ieeeasru.org).

[Download Call for Papers](https://confcats-siteplex.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/asru25/asru25_cfp_web_04_c6abea5ce7.pdf)
[Submit Paper](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IEEEASRU2025)

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but not limited to:

*   Automatic speech recognition
*   Spoken language processing
*   Speech enhancement and separation
*   Speech analysis
*   Speaker and language recognition
*   Speaker diarization
*   Text-only language processing
*   Multimodal speech processing
*   Multilingual speech processing
*   Emotion recognition and paralinguistics
*   Speech synthesis and spoken language generation
*   Resources (new corpora, toolkits, evaluation metrics, etc.)
*   Machine learning for speech application
*   Large Language Models for Speech
*   Speech Foundation Models

## Important Dates

1.  **Paper submissions open:** March 28, 2025
2.  **Regular & special session papers due:** May 28, 2025
3.  **Paper revision due:** June 4, 2025
4.  **Paper notification of acceptance:** August 6, 2025
5.  **Registration Opens:** August 13, 2025
6.  **Paper Camera-Ready Due:** August 13, 2025
7.  **Early Registration Due:** August 27, 2025
8.  **Author Registration Due:** August 27, 2025

callForPapers:
# Call for Research Papers

The International Conference on Business Process Management (BPM) is the premium forum for researchers and practitioners in the field of BPM, embracing its interdisciplinary nature and seeking to bring together the finest research contributions from computer science, information systems engineering, and information systems management.

BPM 2025 will be held in **Seville, Spain**, from **August 31 to September 5, 2025**.

## Tracks

The conference is structured into three tracks, each with specific evaluation criteria, track chair, and dedicated program committee:

### Track I: Foundations

*   **Focus:** Foundational nature (formal, mathematical, algorithmic, or conceptual). Investigating underlying principles, computational theories, formal methods, and algorithms for modeling, automating, analyzing, and optimizing business processes. Identifying novel problems, modeling languages, architectures, conceptual papers on frameworks, taxonomies, and patterns.
*   **Evaluation:** Technical quality standards, convincing argumentation, and benefits of the contribution. Empirical evaluation is not mandatory.
*   **Audience:** Engineers building solutions on formal methods and algorithms, or the broader BPM community concerning new types of contributions.

### Track II: Engineering

*   **Focus:** Engineering aspects of BPM research, focusing on the development and investigation of artifacts and systems to solve concrete problems. Covers tools and techniques for process modeling, enactment, monitoring, and analytics (including process mining), usage in particular domains, and interaction between processes and software infrastructure.
*   **Evaluation:** Rigorous and reproducible empirical evaluations demonstrating the merits of the artifact. Self-critical discussion of limitations and threats to validity is expected. Adaptations of AI techniques for BPM must be justified.
*   **Audience:** Engineers analyzing or further developing artifacts, or analysts applying them in practice.

### Track III: Management

*   **Focus:** Empirical, socio-technical, cognitive, psychological, managerial, and societal aspects of BPM. Techniques, tools, and methods for governing business processes, advancing understanding of process-oriented capabilities, and examining the impact of BPM affordances. Includes strategic alignment, governance, methods, IT, people, and culture related to BPM.
*   **Evaluation:** Appropriate motivation and framing, rigorous research method, convincing argumentation, positioning against state-of-the-art, and demonstration of findings’ applicability and efficacy. Various research methodologies are welcome.
*   **Audience:** Managers and decision-makers seeking lessons from organizational endeavors in BPM.

## Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI)

The BPM community is committed to promoting DEI in all professional activities. All participants are encouraged to consider DEI in their writing, reviews, presentations, and interactions.

## Open Science Principles

Authors are encouraged to follow principles of transparency, reproducibility, and replicability, including disclosures of anonymized and curated data. Links to repositories for research artifacts and datasets are encouraged. Papers with available research artifacts and datasets will receive an "Artifacts Available" badge.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission:** Papers must be submitted to **exactly one track**.
*   **Formatting:** According to **Springer’s LNCS formatting guidelines**.
*   **Language:** English.
*   **Length:** Maximum **16 pages** including references and appendices.
*   **Content:** Title page with abstract, problem statement, goals, results, and relation to other work.
*   **Submission Portal:** [BPM 2025 EasyChair submission site](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=bpm2025)
*   **Originality:** Must be original contributions, not published or submitted elsewhere.
*   **Presentation:** At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the conference and present the paper.
*   **Extended Versions:** Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version to the journal **Process Science**.

## Double-Blind Review

*   Reviews are double blind: neither reviewers nor authors can identify each other.
*   The first page should include the title, abstract, and keywords, but **no names or affiliations**. Acknowledgments of funding or assistance should be omitted.
*   Ensure no information (including PDF meta-data) identifies the authors or affiliations.
*   When referencing previous work, use the third person or blind references.
*   Supplementary material and code must also be anonymized.
*   Submissions with identifying information may be rejected.

## Awards

*   **Best Paper Award**
*   **Best Student Paper Award** (Student papers must be clearly marked and presented by a student author).

## BPM Forum

Papers not fully meeting the main conference criteria but making significant contributions may be presented at the BPM Forum and published in a separate post-proceedings volume (LNBIP).

## Important Dates

Deadlines correspond to Anywhere on Earth (AoE or UTC-12):

*   **Paper Abstract submission:** **March 4, 2025**
*   **Paper submission:** **March 18, 2025**
*   **Notification to authors:** **May 8, 2025**
*   **Camera-ready submission:** **June 13, 2025**

# BTW 2025: Calls for Contributions

The 21st Conference on Database Systems for Business, Technology and Web (BTW 2025) will be held in Bamberg from **March 3 — 7, 2025**.

BTW 2025 is the most important database conference in the German-speaking area, serving as a central forum for the exchange of information between scientists, practitioners, and users on topics of database and information system technology.

callForPapers:
# CADE-30: Call for Papers

The 30th International Conference on Automated Deduction (CADE-30) will take place at **DHBW Stuttgart, Germany, from July 28th to August 2nd, 2025**.

CADE is the major international forum for presenting research on all aspects of automated deduction. High-quality submissions on the general topic of automated deduction, including logical foundations, theory and principles, applications in and beyond computer science and mathematics, and implementations of automated reasoning systems are solicited. CADE-30 aims to present research that reflects the broad range of interesting and relevant topics in automated deduction.

## Publication

CADE-30 proceedings will be published in **Springer's Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence series** in Gold Open Access mode at a CADE special rate of **EUR 200 per paper**. Authors of accepted papers who cannot cover the fee can apply for funding.

## Submission Instructions

Submissions can be made in two categories:

*   **Regular papers:** Up to **15 pages** in LNCS style, excluding references. Proofs of theoretical results that do not fit in the page limit may be provided in an appendix.
*   **Short papers:** This includes system descriptions, user experiences, case studies and domain models. Up to **10 pages** in LNCS style, excluding references.

Submissions must be unpublished and not submitted for publication elsewhere. They will be judged on relevance, significance, originality, correctness, and readability. Reviewers may consider material provided in appendices, but submissions must be self-contained within the page limit. If software or data is relevant to a paper, a link that provides access to the software/data must be provided to enable reproduction of results.

The review process will include a feedback/rebuttal period, where authors will have the option to respond to reviewer comments. The Program Committee Chairs may solicit further reviews after the rebuttal period.

Selected accepted papers will be considered by the Program Committee for the **CADE Best Paper Award** or **Best Student Paper Award** (provided that at least one author is a student).

All submissions must be formatted in the **LNCS style** and must include the **ORCID id** of at least the corresponding author, and preferably of all authors.

## Submission Platform

Submissions must be made to [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cade30](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cade30) in the **Main Conference track**.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract deadline:** February 17, 2025
*   **Submission deadline:** February 24, 2025
*   **Rebuttal period:** April 14-18, 2025
*   **Notification:** April 28, 2025
*   **Final version deadline:** May 30, 2025
*   **Main conference:** July 28-31, 2025
*   **Satellite events:** August 1-2, 2025

## Organizers

*   **Program Committee Chairs:** Clark Barrett, Uwe Waldmann
*   **Conference Chair:** Stephan Schulz
*   **Publicity Chair:** Geoff Sutcliffe

## Contacts

All questions about CADE-30 paper submissions should be emailed to the Chairs: **cade30 AT easychair.org**

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - ICIAP 2025

The 23rd International Conference on Image Analysis and Processing (ICIAP 2025) is organized biennially by CVPL, the Italian Member Society of the International Association for Pattern Recognition (IAPR).

The conference will take place in **Rome, Italy**, from **15-19 September 2025**, at the **Sapienza University of Rome**.

ICIAP 2025 aims to be a stimulating discussion forum for researchers to meet, present their work, and exchange ideas through oral and poster sessions, and invited keynote talks. The conference will also include satellite workshops and tutorials.

## Topics of Interest

The conference focus is on both traditional and emerging trends in computer vision, pattern recognition, and image processing, addressing both theoretical and practical aspects. Special emphasis will be placed on the following topics:

*   Video Analysis and Understanding
*   Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
*   Deep Learning
*   Multiview Geometry and 3D Computer Vision
*   Image Analysis, Detection, and Recognition
*   Multimedia
*   Biomedical and Assistive Technology
*   Digital Forensics and Biometrics
*   Image Processing for Cultural Heritage
*   Robot and Vision
*   Brave New Ideas
*   AI and science
*   X-Realities
*   Embedded Vision

## Submission Instructions

All submissions will be handled electronically via the conference’s CMT Website: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025)

*   **Template Download:** Authors can download the template, together with the instructions, from the following link.
*   **Overleaf Template:** For authors who want to write their manuscripts on Overleaf.
*   The maximum number of pages is **12 including references**.

## Review Process

*   Papers will be selected through a **double-blind review process**, taking into account originality, significance, clarity, soundness, relevance, and technical contents.
*   Each submission will be managed by two Area Chairs and reviewed by at least three reviewers.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be included in the ICIAP 2025 Conference Proceedings, which will be published by **Springer** in the **Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series.

## Additional Author Guidelines

*   **Double blind review:** ICIAP25 reviewing is double blind. Authors must not provide information that may identify them in acknowledgments or any other part of the paper. Violation of these guidelines may lead to rejection without review.
*   **Dual submissions:** Manuscripts must not be previously published or accepted for publication in a substantially similar form. No publication substantially similar in content (20% overlap) should be submitted to other venues during the review period. Violation will lead to rejection and reporting.
*   **arXiv preprints:** arXiv preprints and university technical reports are not considered publications.

## Important Dates

*   **First round submission:** **14 February 2025**
*   **First round notification:** **31 March 2025**
*   **Second round submission:** **15 April 2025** extended to **29 April 2025** AoE
*   **Second round notification:** **15 June 2025**
*   **Workshop and Tutorials:** **15 - 16 September 2025**
*   **Main Conference:** **17 - 19 September 2025**
*   **Early Bird registration deadline:** **30 June 2025**
*   **Authors’ Registration deadline:** **30 June 2025**
*   **Camera Ready Submission:** **10 July 2025**
*   **Regular registration deadline:** **4 September 2025**

## Contact Information

For more information, please contact us at: [info@iciap.org](mailto:info@iciap.org).

callForPapers:
# ATVA 2025: Call for Papers

Welcome to ATVA 2025, the 23rd edition of the International Symposium on Automated Technology for Verification and Analysis. The conference is dedicated to the promotion of research on theoretical and practical aspects of automated analysis, verification, and synthesis, by providing a forum for interaction between international research communities and industry in the field.

ATVA 2025 will take place from **October 27 to October 31, 2025**, in **Bengaluru, India**, at the **International Institute of Information Technology, Bangalore**. This year’s conference is co-located with the [23rd Asian Symposium on Programming Languages and Systems (APLAS 2025)](https://conf.researchr.org/home/aplas-2025).

## Topics of Interest

ATVA solicits high quality submissions in the following suggestive list of topics:

*   Formalisms for modeling hardware, software and embedded systems
*   Specification and verification of finite-state, infinite-state and parameterized systems
*   Program analysis and software verification
*   Analysis and verification of hardware circuits, systems-on-chip and embedded systems
*   Analysis of real-time, hybrid, priced, weighted and probabilistic systems
*   Deductive, algorithmic, compositional, and abstraction/refinement techniques for analysis and verification
*   Analytical techniques for safety, security, and dependability
*   Testing and runtime analysis based on verification technology
*   Analysis and verification of parallel and concurrent systems
*   Verification in industrial practice
*   Synthesis for hardware and software systems
*   Applications and case studies of verification
*   Automated tool support for verification
*   Testing and verification of neural networks
*   Testing and verification of autonomous systems

## Submissions

ATVA welcomes submissions in the following two categories:

### Regular Research Papers

*   **Length:** Up to **18 pages**, excluding references and appendices. Appendices can be provided but are read at the discretion of reviewers and omitted in the final version.
*   **Anonymization:** Submissions must be anonymized, as ATVA 2025 will follow a **full double-blind review process**. Author names and affiliations must be omitted. References to prior work by authors should be in the third person. Failure to comply will result in rejection without review.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Optional submission of a relevant artifact for evaluation by the artifact evaluation committee. The deadline for this will be shortly after paper acceptance notification.
*   **Repository:** Authors are encouraged to include a URL to a repository (code, datasets, results) in their original submission, adhering to double-blind guidelines.

### Tool Papers

*   **Length:** Up to **10 pages**, excluding references.
*   **Anonymization:** Not anonymized. ATVA follows a **single-blind review process** for tool papers.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Mandatory submission of a separate artifact via EasyChair.
*   **Enhancements:** Papers describing tools that have been previously presented will only be accepted if significant and clear enhancements are reported and implemented.

## Submission Format

*   Submissions must be in **Springer’s LNCS format**. Formatting style files and guidelines can be found at [https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs).
*   Adding line numbers (LaTeX package `lineno`) is highly recommended.

## Submission System

*   Papers must be submitted through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=atva2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=atva2025)

## Publication

*   Accepted papers in both categories will be published in **Springer’s Lecture Notes in Computer Science series**.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

1.  **Abstract + Paper submission deadline:** **April 25, 2025**
2.  **Tool paper artifact submission deadline:** **May 2, 2025**
3.  **Tool paper revised artifact submission deadline:** **May 11, 2025**
4.  **Author response period:** **June 17 – 20, 2025**
5.  **Paper notification:** **July 4, 2025**
6.  **Regular paper artifact submission deadline:** **July 8, 2025**
7.  **Camera-ready deadline:** **August 1, 2025**
8.  **Tutorials and Workshops:** **October 27, 2025**
9.  **Conference Dates:** **October 27 - 31, 2025**

## Invited Talks

Information about invited talks will be available.

## Tracks

*   Research and Tool Papers
*   Artifacts
*   Workshops
*   Tutorials

## Other Information

*   A few outstanding papers will be selected for a distinguished paper award.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper is expected to register and present the paper at the conference.

callForPapers:
# CASES 2025: Call for Papers

CASES (International Conference on Compilers, Architecture, and Synthesis for Embedded Systems) is a premier forum where researchers, developers, and practitioners exchange information on the latest advances in compilers and architectures for high-performance, low-power embedded systems. The conference showcases leading-edge research in embedded processor, memory, interconnect, and storage architectures, as well as related compiler techniques targeting performance, power, predictability, security, and reliability issues for both traditional and emerging application domains. Additionally, it invites innovative papers addressing design, synthesis, and optimization challenges in heterogeneous and accelerator-rich architectures.

**Dates:** September 28 - October 3, 2025
**Location:** Taipei, Taiwan

## About CASES

CASES has a long tradition of showcasing leading-edge research in embedded processor, memory, interconnect, storage architectures and related compiler techniques targeting performance, power, predictability, security, reliability issues for both traditional and emerging application domains. In addition, we invite innovative papers that address design, synthesis, and optimization challenges in heterogeneous and accelerator-rich architectures.

## Call for Papers and Contributions

*   **CASES Specific Call for Papers:** [https://esweek.org/cases_cfp/](https://esweek.org/cases_cfp/)
*   **General ESWEEK Call for Papers:** [http://esweek.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/ESWeek2025_CFP.pdf](http://esweek.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/ESWeek2025_CFP.pdf)
*   **Call for Late Breaking / Work-in-Progress Papers (LB/WIP):** [https://esweek.org/cases-call-for-wip-papers/](https://esweek.org/cases-call-for-wip-papers/)
*   **Call for Special Session Proposals:** [https://esweek.org/call-for-special-session-proposals/](https://esweek.org/call-for-special-session-proposals/)
*   **Call for Tutorial Proposals:** [https://esweek.org/call-for-tutorial-proposals-page/](https://esweek.org/call-for-tutorial-proposals-page/)
*   **Call for Workshop Proposals:** [https://esweek.org/call-for-workshop-proposals/](https://esweek.org/call-for-workshop-proposals/)

## Submission Process

*   **Submit an Article to CASES 2025:** [https://cases25.hotcrp.com/](https://cases25.hotcrp.com/)
*   **Author Information:** [https://esweek.org/author-information/](https://esweek.org/author-information/)

## Important Dates

### Journal Track

*   **Abstract Submission:** **March 23, 2025** (AOE)
*   **Full Paper Submission (also for Special Session Proposals, Tutorial Proposals, Workshops Proposals):** **March 30, 2025** (AOE, firm)
*   **First Round Notification:** **May 18, 2025**
*   **Revised paper submission:** **June 15, 2025** (AOE, firm)

### Late Breaking Tracks

*   **Paper Submission:** **June 01, 2025** (AOE, firm)
*   **Notification:** **July 13, 2025**

### All Tracks (Full Paper, LB, Special Session)

*   **Camera ready:** **August 11, 2025**

## Other Important Deadlines

*   **Submission deadline for the Embedded System Software Competition (ESSC) and the ACM SIGBED Student Research Competition:** TBD

## Program Chairs

*   **Jeronimo Castrillon** (CASES TPC Chair, TU Dresden, DE)
*   **Christophe Dubach** (CASES TPC Co-Chair, McGill University, CA)

## Associated Events at ESWEEK 2025

CASES is part of the Embedded Systems Week (ESWEEK), which also includes:

*   CODES+ISSS
*   EMSOFT
*   Symposia (MEMOCODE)
*   Events, Competitions (Embedded Systems Software Competition - ESSC)
*   Education Classes
*   Keynotes, Panels, Tutorials, Workshops
*   TCRS: The workshop on Time-Centric Reactive Software
*   MSC: International Workshop on Memory and Storage Computing
*   RSP: International Workshop on Rapid System Prototyping

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The **2025 IEEE 21st International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE)** will be held on **August 17 – August 21, 2025**, in **Los Angeles, California, USA**. The pre-conference workshops are scheduled for **August 17, 2025**.

CASE is the flagship automation conference of the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society (RAS), serving as the primary forum for cross-industry and multidisciplinary research in automation.

## About CASE 2025

The conference theme is **Secured and Trustworthy Automation**. It addresses the increasing reliance of automation systems (e.g., collaborative robotics, smart manufacturing, smart cities) on security and trustworthiness, highlighting the need for research to overcome vulnerabilities and biases.

## Topics

The conference covers a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:

*   Foundation of Automation
*   Human-centered automation
*   Automation in life science and healthcare
*   Sustainability and green automation
*   Automation in agriculture and horticulture
*   Automation in meso, micro and nano-scale
*   Smart building and construction
*   Knowledge-based automation
*   Manufacturing automation
*   Cloud-based automation
*   Big data, data mining and machine learning
*   Privacy and security in automation

## Submission Categories

CASE 2025 invites submissions for:

*   **Regular Papers:** Up to 6 pages (plus 2 extra pages at an additional charge, max 8 pages total). Accepted papers are published in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Special Session Papers:** Similar to regular papers but grouped within specific special sessions. Up to 6 pages (plus 2 extra pages at an additional charge, max 8 pages total). Accepted papers are published in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Special Session Abstracts:** 2 pages. These will have oral presentations but will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore or be indexed.
*   **Work-in-progress and Industry Presentation-only Papers:** Up to 4 pages. For late-breaking results or industry submissions. For Industry Papers, at least one author must be from industry. These will have oral presentations but will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore or be indexed.
*   **Work-in-progress and Industry Presentation-only Papers for Special Sessions:** Up to 4 pages, tailored to special session topics. Oral presentations only, not published or indexed.
*   **T-ASE, T-RO, RA-L and RAM Presentation:** For authors who have published in eligible IEEE RAS journals. Present your published work at CASE 2025. Oral presentation only, not published or indexed.

## Key Dates

*   **Special session proposal submission:** February 8, 2025 (extended to **February 15, 2025**)
*   **Regular and special session full paper submission:** **March 15, 2025** (final deadline)
*   **Industry paper and work-in-progress paper submission:** **April 15, 2025**
*   **Workshop/tutorial proposal submission:** **April 30, 2025**
*   **T-ASE, T-RO, RA-L and RAM presentation submission:** **April 30, 2025**
*   **Paper acceptance notification:** May 30, 2025
*   **Early bird registration:** June 13, 2025
*   **Final paper submission and author registration:** June 27, 2025
*   **Call for Student Volunteers deadline:** July 6, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   All papers must be submitted in PDF format.
*   Follow the standard IEEE conference double column format using the provided [LaTeX template](https://2025.ieeecase.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/643/ieeeconf.zip) or [MS Word template](https://2025.ieeecase.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/643/Template-for-Preparation-of-Papers-for-IEEE-Sponsored-Conferences.docx).
*   Submissions are made through the [RAS Papercept submission portal](https://ras.papercept.net/).
*   Authors are required to register a PIN on the Papercept portal. Authors are responsible for submitting papers in the required format and adhering to the templates.

## Review Process

Papers submitted to CASE follow a **single-blinded review system**. Author identities are known to reviewers, but reviewer identities are not disclosed to authors.

## Publication

Accepted **regular papers and special session papers** will be published in the conference program and included in **IEEE Xplore**.

**Special session abstracts, work-in-progress papers, industry papers, and presentation-only papers** will have oral presentations but will **NOT appear in IEEE Xplore** and thus will NOT be indexed on platforms like Scopus.

## Contact Information

Official Contact Email: [case2025@usc.edu](mailto:case2025@usc.edu)

## Sponsors

See the website for a list of sponsors, including Gold and Bronze sponsors like USC Viterbi School of Engineering, GeorgiaTech, and The Hoover Institution.

callForPapers:
# CC 2025: Call for Papers

The **ACM SIGPLAN 2025 International Conference on Compiler Construction (CC 2025)** is interested in work on processing programs in the most general sense: analyzing, transforming or executing input programs that describe how a system operates, including traditional compiler construction as a special case.

CC 2025 is the **34th edition** of the conference and is an ACM SIGPLAN conference. Proceedings will be made available online in the ACM digital library from one week before to one week after the conference.

## Topics of Interest

Original contributions are solicited on the following topics, including, but not limited to:

*   Compilation and interpretation techniques, including program representation, analysis, and transformation; code generation, optimization, and synthesis; the verification thereof.
*   Run-time techniques, including memory management, virtual machines, and dynamic and just-in-time compilation.
*   Programming tools, including refactoring editors, checkers, verifiers, compilers, debuggers, and profilers.
*   Techniques, ranging from programming languages to micro-architectural support, for specific domains such as secure, parallel, distributed, embedded or mobile environments.
*   Design and implementation of novel language constructs, programming models, and domain-specific languages.
*   Implications to compiler construction from emerging or non-conventional applications (e.g., deep learning, quantum computing, DNA computing, etc.).

## Call for Tool and Practical Experience Papers

This year, CC offers a second category of papers called “Tools and Practical Experience”. Papers in this category must either give a clear account of a tool’s functionality or summarize a practical experience with realistic case studies. The successful evaluation of an artifact is mandatory for a Tool Paper.

Selection criteria include: Originality, Usability, Documentation, Benchmark Repository, Availability, Foundations, and Artifact Evaluation.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Site:** [https://cc25.hotcrp.com](https://cc25.hotcrp.com)
*   **Format:** All papers must be prepared in **ACM Conference Format** using the 2-column `acmart` format (use options `\documentclass[sigplan,10pt,review,anonymous]{acmart}` for Latex, and `interim-layout.docx` for Word, ensuring 10pt font).
*   **Length:** Maximum of **10 pages** of text (in a typeface no smaller than 10 point) or figures, **NOT INCLUDING references**. References must include the name of all authors.
*   **Supplementary Material:** Authors may submit anonymous supplementary material (e.g., proofs, source code, datasets) in PDF or ZIP format. Reviewer discretion applies.
*   **Anonymity:** CC uses a **double-blind reviewing process**. Submissions must not reveal author identity. Avoid author names/affiliations in the body and use third-person for self-references.
*   **Policies:** Authors must adhere to ACM’s Copyright Policies, SIGPLAN’s Republication Policy, and ACM’s Policy and Procedures on Plagiarism. Authors are subject to ACM’s Policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects. ORCID IDs are required.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Abstract deadline:** **Tue 5 Nov 2024**
*   **Submission deadline:** **Tue 12 Nov 2024**
*   **Author response:** **Wed 11 Dec - Fri 13 Dec 2024**
*   **Author notification:** **Sat 21 Dec 2024**
*   **Artifact Submission Deadline:** **Fri 17 Jan 2025**
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** **Fri 24 Jan 2025**

## Artifact Evaluation

Authors are encouraged to submit their artifacts for the Artifact Evaluation (AE) process, which begins after acceptance notification. The AE committee assesses how artifacts support the paper's claims.

*   **Badge Types:**
    *   **Red badge (Artifact Usable):** Awarded based on usability and robustness (Light-red or Dark-red).
    *   **Blue badge (Results Reproduced):** Awarded if main paper results can be reproduced with the artifact.
    *   **Green Artifact Available Badge:** Awarded if the artifact is publicly available.
*   **Artifact Submission Site:** [https://cc25-ae.hotcrp.com](https://cc25-ae.hotcrp.com)
*   Authors are encouraged to indicate interest in artifact submission upon paper submission.

## Organizers

*   **General Chair:** Daniel Kluss
*   **Program Co-Chairs:** Sara Achour, Jens Palsberg

## Publication

Proceedings will be made available online in the ACM digital library.

callForPapers:
# ACM CCS 2025: Call for Papers

The 32nd ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS) seeks submissions presenting novel contributions related to all real-world aspects of computer security and privacy.

CCS has **two review cycles** in 2025.

## Review Decisions

*   **Accept:** Papers will be accepted for publication and presentation, possibly after minor changes overseen by a shepherd.
*   **Minor revision:** Promising papers needing minor work (e.g., experiments, proofs) may be resubmitted with revisions for re-evaluation.
*   **Reject:** Papers declined for inclusion. Papers rejected from the first cycle may not be submitted to the second cycle.

At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the conference and present the paper in-person, if possible.

## Paper Submission Information

*   Submissions must be received by 11:59 PM AoE (UTC-12) on the day of the corresponding deadline.
*   Submitted papers must not substantially overlap with papers published or accepted elsewhere, or currently under submission to another journal or conference.
*   All submissions must be properly **anonymized**. Avoid revealing authors' identities and cite previous work by yourself in the third person, or blind the reference itself. Papers not properly anonymized may be rejected without review.
*   Authors may submit up to a maximum of 7 papers for Cycle B.
*   Papers will be evaluated based on their importance to practical aspects of computer and communications security and privacy, novelty, quality of execution, and presentation.
*   For papers raising ethical concerns, authors must convince reviewers that proper procedures have been followed.
*   Submissions may be rejected for being out of scope.
*   No modifications to the author list are allowed after submission.

## Mandatory Reviewing

Authors submitting 3 or more papers may be required to review other papers. Failure to provide requested information may lead to desk rejection.

## Withdrawing Policy

A paper can be withdrawn at any point before reviews are sent to authors. After reviews are sent, withdrawal is not permitted.

## Paper Format

*   Submissions must be a **PDF file** in double-column ACM format using the "sigconf" style.
*   Maximum length: **12 pages**, excluding bibliography, appendices, and supplementary material.
*   Reviewers are not required to read appendices or supplementary material.
*   Do not change the font or margins of the ACM format.
*   Refer to the [sample-sigconf.tex](https://www.acm.org/binaries/content/assets/authors/tex-template/sample-sigconf.tex) and [sample-sigconf.pdf](https://www.acm.org/binaries/content/assets/authors/tex-template/sample-sigconf.pdf) in the ACM package.
*   Submissions not following the required format may be rejected without review.

## Providing Artifacts at Submission Time

Submissions claiming contributions based on artifacts (code, models, data sets) should make them accessible to reviewers unless there are valid reasons not to. An anonymous web link is acceptable if the contents are also anonymized.

## Optional Artifact Evaluation (AE)

Authors of accepted papers are encouraged to submit artifacts for AE. A separate call for artifacts will follow.

## Conference Tracks

The conference features a multi-track format. Authors must select the most relevant track during submission.

*   **Program Co-Chairs:** David Lie (University of Toronto), Véronique Cortier (CNRS, Loria)
*   **Software Security:** Alexandra Dmitrienko, Yinqian Zhang
*   **Web Security:** Yinzhi Cao
*   **Network Security:** Kun Sun
*   **Security Usability and Measurement:** Emiliano De Cristofaro, Yixin Zou
*   **Machine Learning and Security:** Neil Gong, Elissa Redmiles, Ben Y. Zhao
*   **Formal Methods and Programming Languages:** Tamara Rezk
*   **Hardware, Side Channels, and Cyber Physical Systems:** Christopher Fletcher, Mengjia Yan
*   **Applied Cryptography:** Marc Fischlin, Dominique Schroeder
*   **Blockchain and Distributed Systems:** Sisi Duan
*   **Privacy and Anonymity:** Catuscia Palamidessi

## Conflicts of Interest

Authors must report any Program Committee members with whom they have a conflict of interest. Mandatory conflicts include current/former advisor/advisee, same institution, close family members, and recent co-authors (within 2 years). Further explanations may be required.

## Policy for Peer-Review Integrity

All participants must adhere to ACM policies against harassment and the ACM Code of Ethics. Violations will be penalized according to ACM policies.

## Important Dates

### First Review Cycle

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** Jan 2, 2025 (Mandatory)
*   **Full paper submission deadline:** Jan 9, 2025
*   **Notification of early-rejection papers:** Feb 10, 2025
*   **Author rebuttal period:** Mar 3—6, 2025
*   **Rebuttal deadline:** Mar 6, 2025
*   **Author notification:** Mar 28, 2025

### Second Review Cycle

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** April 7, 2025 (Mandatory)
*   **Full paper submission deadline:** April 14, 2025
*   **Notification of early-rejection papers:** May 16, 2025
*   **Author rebuttal period:** June 7—12, 2025
*   **Rebuttal deadline:** June 12, 2025
*   **Author notification:** July 1, 2025

## Submission Site

*   Cycle A: [https://ccs2025a.hotcrp.com/](https://ccs2025a.hotcrp.com/)
*   Cycle B: [https://ccs2025b.hotcrp.com/](https://ccs2025b.hotcrp.com/)

## Diversity and Inclusion

ACM CCS is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion. Suggestions, concerns, or complaints related to biases or sexual harassment can be reported to the Program Chairs. Authors are encouraged to avoid language or examples that perpetuate marginalization, stereotyping, or erasure of any group.

## Agreements

Authors agree to ACM Publications Policies, including the policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects, upon submission. Violations may lead to retraction.

Authors are required to obtain an ORCID ID for the publishing process.

callForPapers:
# CIAA 2025: Call for Papers

The 29th International Conference on Implementation and Application of Automata (CIAA) will take place from **September 22-25, 2025**, in **Palermo, Italy**.

The purpose of CIAA is to bring together members of the academic, research, and industrial community who have an interest in the theory, implementation, and application of automata and related structures. The conference concerns research on all aspects of implementation and application of automata and related structures, including theoretical aspects.

## Topics

We solicit papers on all aspects of implementation and application of automata and related structures, including theoretical aspects, including but not limited to:

*   Algorithms on automata
*   Automata and logic
*   Bioinformatics
*   Complexity of automata operations
*   Compilers
*   Computer-aided verification
*   Concurrency
*   Data structure design for automata
*   Data and image compression
*   Design and architecture of automata software
*   Digital libraries
*   DNA, molecular, and membrane computing
*   Document engineering
*   Editors, environments
*   Experimental studies and practical experiences
*   Industrial applications
*   Natural language processing
*   Networking
*   New algorithms for manipulating automata
*   Object-oriented modeling
*   Pattern-matching
*   Quantum computing
*   Speech and speaker recognition
*   Structured and semi-structured documents
*   Symbolic manipulation environments for automata
*   Teaching
*   Text processing
*   Techniques for graphical display of automata
*   VLSI
*   Viruses, related phenomena
*   World-wide-web

## Submission Guidelines

Submissions must be written in LaTeX using the LNCS LaTeX2e style and must not exceed **12 single-spaced pages**, excluding the title page and the references.

If the authors believe that more details are essential to substantiate the main claims, they may include a clearly marked appendix that will be read at the discretion of the program committee.

Simultaneous submissions of papers to journals or any other conference with published proceedings or submitting previously published papers is not allowed.

Only electronic submission of PDF documents is possible.

Authors should submit their contributions through Easychair.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission deadline:** May 16th (AoE)
*   **Notification deadline:** June 23rd
*   **Final version deadline:** June 30th
*   **Last day for early registration:** July 18th
*   **Last day for late registration:** September 8th
*   **Conference Dates:** September 22nd-25th, 2025

> Deadlines differ for special tracks. Please consult the conference home page for special tracks Call for Papers (if any).

## Publication

CIAA 2025 proceedings will be published in the **Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)**.

## Special Issue

Extended versions of selected papers from the conference will be invited for consideration in a special issue of **International Journal of Foundations of Computer Science (IJFCS)**.

## Invited Speakers

*   Marie-Pierre Béal, Université Paris-Est Marne-la-Vallée, France
*   Dirk Nowotka, University of Kiel, Germany
*   Alberto Policriti, University of Udine, Italy

## Contacts

All questions should be addressed to [ciaa2025@unipa.it](mailto:ciaa2025@unipa.it).

summary: The International Conference on Computer-Human Interaction Research and Applications (CHIRA 2025) will be held on October 20 - 21, 2025, at the Barceló Marbella hotel in Marbella, Costa del Sol. The conference aims to gather professionals, academics, and students interested in research and practical applications of interaction design and human-computer interaction. It will cover various aspects including Human Factors and Information Systems, Interactive Devices, Interaction Design, and Adaptive and Intelligent Systems. CHIRA 2025 offers both in-person and remote (hybrid) participation options and is co-located with ICINCO 2025, WEBIST 2025, icSPORTS 2025, and CoopIS 2025. Accepted papers will be published by Springer in a CCIS Series book and submitted for evaluation for indexing in major international databases.
callForPapers:
# CHIRA 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Computer-Human Interaction Research and Applications (CHIRA 2025) will take place on **October 20 - 21, 2025**, at the **Barceló Marbella hotel in Marbella, Costa del Sol**.

CHIRA aims to bring together professionals, academics, and students interested in the advancement of research and practical applications of interaction design and human-computer interaction. The conference will feature four parallel tracks, covering various aspects of Computer-Human Interaction.

### Participation Options

Although the conference is back to the normal mode (i.e., in-person), speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Keynote Lectures

*   Alice Chirico, Catholic University of Sacred Hearth, Italy

## Conference Areas (Topics)

### 1. Human Factors for Interactive Systems, Research, and Applications

*   User Preferences and Customization
*   Security and Privacy
*   User Behaviour Analysis
*   Modelling Human Factors
*   User Experience Evaluation
*   Decision Support Systems
*   Human-Centered AI
*   Collaborative Systems
*   Healthcare Applications
*   User Experience
*   Entertainment
*   Social Computing
*   Human-in-the-loop

### 2. Interactive Devices

*   Metaverse
*   Conversational Speech Interfaces
*   3D Interaction
*   Virtual, Augmented, Mixed, and Extended Reality
*   Wearable Sensors
*   Mobile Devices and Services
*   Human-Robot Interaction
*   Brain-Computer Interfaces
*   Gesture-Based Interaction
*   EEG Signal Processing

### 3. Interaction Design

*   User Experience Design
*   Accessible and Adaptive Interaction
*   Design and Evaluation
*   Interaction Design Modelling
*   Collaboration and Interaction Design
*   Mobile Computer-Human Interaction
*   User-Centered Interaction Design Patterns
*   Cognitive Interaction
*   Affective Computing
*   Multimedia and Multimodal Interaction

### 4. Adaptive and Intelligent Systems

*   Visualization Tools
*   Information Retrieval
*   Computational Interaction
*   Context-Aware Systems
*   Intelligent User Interfaces
*   Cognition, Communication and Interaction
*   Machine Learning
*   Deep Learning
*   Explainable AI (XAI)
*   Artificial Intelligence

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work in the form of a **complete paper** or an **abstract**. Accepted abstracts are presented but are **not published** in the conference proceedings.

Complete papers can be submitted as:

*   **Regular Paper**: representing completed and validated research.
*   **Position Paper**: portraying a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion about an issue discussing ideas, facts, situations, methods, procedures or results of scientific research focused on one of the conference topic areas.

### Submission Guidelines:

1.  **Language and Quality:** Papers must be submitted in English, carefully checked for correct grammar and spelling.
2.  **Content:** Each paper should clearly indicate the nature of its technical/scientific contribution, and the problems, domains or environments to which it is applicable.
3.  **Double-Blind Review:** To facilitate the double-blind paper evaluation method, authors are kindly requested to produce and provide the paper **WITHOUT any reference to any of the authors**, including personal details, acknowledgments section, and any other reference that may disclose the authors’ identity.
4.  **Originality and Plagiarism:** Only original papers should be submitted. Submissions must not substantially overlap work which has been published elsewhere or simultaneously submitted to a journal or another conference with proceedings. Papers that contain any form of plagiarism will be rejected without reviews. Authors should also avoid using an excessive number of self-citations.
5.  **Submission Platform:** All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform PRIMORIS.
6.  **Formatting:** Submissions should follow the instructions and templates found under [Guidelines and Templates](https://chira.scitevents.org/Documents.aspx).

## Publications

All accepted complete papers will be published by **Springer in the conference proceedings**, under an ISBN reference.

The proceedings will be abstracted/indexed in:

*   DBLP
*   Google Scholar
*   EI-Compendex
*   INSPEC
*   Japanese Science and Technology Agency (JST)
*   Norwegian Register for Scientific Journals and Series
*   Mathematical Reviews
*   SCImago
*   Scopus
*   zbMATH

CCIS volumes are also submitted for inclusion in ISI Proceedings (Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index).

## Important Dates

All dates refer to **AOE (Anywhere on Earth)** time.

### Regular Papers

*   Paper Submission: **June 6, 2025** (expired)
*   Authors Notification: **July 17, 2025**
*   Camera Ready and Registration: **July 31, 2025**

### Position Papers / Regular Papers (Extended Deadline)

*   Paper Submission: **July 3, 2025** (extended)
*   Authors Notification: **July 31, 2025**
*   Camera Ready and Registration: **September 5, 2025**

### Abstracts Track

*   Abstract Submission: **July 31, 2025**
*   Authors Notification: **September 8, 2025**
*   Camera Ready and Registration: **September 17, 2025**

### Other Submissions

*   Workshop Proposal: **May 27, 2025** (expired)
*   Special Session Proposal: **May 27, 2025** (expired)
*   Tutorial Proposal: **September 11, 2025**
*   Demo Proposal: **September 11, 2025**
*   Panel Proposal: **September 11, 2025**
