summary: The 20th International Symposium on Parameterized and Exact Computation (IPEC 2025) will be held from September 17-19, 2025, as part of ALGO 2025, which is planned as an in-person conference. IPEC covers all aspects of parameterized and exact algorithms and complexity.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 20th International Symposium on Parameterized and Exact Computation (IPEC 2025) invites papers presenting original research in the area of parameterized and exact algorithms and complexity.

Papers can be submitted via Easychair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ipec2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ipec2025) (please see submission and coi guidelines below).

## Topics

The topics include but are not limited to:

*   new techniques for the design and analysis of parameterized and exact algorithms;
*   fixed-parameter tractability and kernelization results;
*   parameterized complexity theory;
*   parameterized (in)approximability results;
*   relationships between parameterized complexity and traditional complexity classifications;
*   applications of parameterized and exact computation;
*   engineering and experimentation of exact, parameterized, and kernelization algorithms.

## Important Dates

*   Abstract submission / paper registration: **June 27th** (23:59 AoE)
*   Submission deadline: **June 30th** (23:59 AoE)
*   Notification: **August 7th**
*   IPEC dates: **Sept. 17—19** (Wed-Fri)
*   Camera-ready version: **October 10th** (23:59 AoE)
*   *AoE=Anywhere on Earth (UTC-12)*

## Submission Guidelines

*   Each submission is required to be in the `LIPIcs` format; no changes to font size, page margins, etc., are permitted. Line numbers must be activated.
*   We welcome submissions of the full version of the paper. Regardless, the first **12 pages** of the submission (excluding the title page) should be enough to assess the paper and contain a summary of the main results, their motivation and importance, and evidence of their correctness. In particular, PC members and potential subreviewers may treat the first 12 pages as the short version (the rest being read at their discretion).
*   Results previously published in conference proceedings or a journal (or scheduled for publication prior to IPEC) or under simultaneous submission will not be considered.
*   PC members (outside the PC chairs) are allowed to author or coauthor submissions.
*   **Double-blind reviewing:** As in previous years, IPEC 2025 employs a lightweight double-blind reviewing process. Submissions should not reveal the identity of the authors in any way. In particular, authors’ names, affiliations, and email addresses should not appear at the beginning or in the body of the submission. Authors should ensure that any references to their own related work is in the third person (e.g., not “We build on our previous work …” but rather “We build on the work of …”). The purpose of the double-blind reviewing is to help PC members and external reviewers come to an initial judgement about the paper without bias, not to make it impossible for them to discover the authors if they were to try. Nothing should be done in the name of anonymity that weakens the submission or makes the job of reviewing the paper more difficult. In particular, important references should not be omitted or anonymized. In addition, authors should feel free to disseminate their ideas or draft versions of their paper as they normally would. For example, authors may post drafts of their papers on the web, submit them to arXiv, and give talks on their research ideas. In case there exist publicly available versions of the submission online, the authors might mention this in their submission (without providing references/links), and briefly explain the differences if any. Alternatively, they might communicate the details to the chairs, who will keep them confidential unless revealing them to the PC is needed for a fair judgement. Authors with further questions on double-blind reviewing are encouraged to contact the PC chairs.

## Conflicts of Interest

IPEC takes conflicts of interest, both real and perceived, seriously. Authors are responsible for declaring conflicts of interest with any of the PC members.

You have a conflict of interest with:

*   family members and close friends;
*   Ph.D. advisor or advisee (no time limit), or postdoc or undergraduate mentor or mentee within the past 5 years;
*   people with the same affiliation;
*   involved in an alleged incident of harassment (it is not required that the incident be reported);
*   reviewer owes author a favor (e.g., recently requested a reference letter); and
*   frequent or recent collaborator whom you believe cannot objectively review your work.

## Conference and Paper Publication

Authors of accepted papers are expected to present their work at the symposium, and to incorporate the comments from the program committee.

The conference proceedings will be published in the **Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs)** series after the conference (post-proceedings).

The final submission will be made in LIPIcs format, with a higher page limit of **15 pages** plus bibliography (no appendix). More details will follow from LIPIcs upon acceptance. The submissions will be published as post-proceedings.

## Awards

A **best paper award** and a **best student paper award** may be conferred. All submissions are eligible for the best paper award, except submissions co-authored by PC members. Submissions of which all authors are students at the time of submission are also eligible for the best student paper award. Papers meeting the requirement for the best student paper award should indicate this during submission.

Besides the best paper and best student paper award, during the IPEC conference, the [IPEC Nerode Prize](https://eatcs.org/index.php/nerode-prize) will be conferred. The winner(s) will be chosen by a separate award committee; please refer to the webpage for details.

callForPapers:
# ISARC 2025: Call for Papers

The **42nd International Symposium on Automation and Robotics in Construction (ISARC)** will be held in **Montreal, Canada**, from **July 28 – 31, 2025**.

The theme for ISARC 2025 is **"Decarbonizing the Construction Industry"**.

## Important Dates

*   **Full Paper Submission Deadline:** December 26, 2024 (extended to January 15, 2025)
*   **Provisional Acceptance of Papers & Comments from Reviewers:** February 10, 2025 (extended to February 21, 2025)
*   **Rebuttal Period:** February 13 – March 14, 2025
*   **Revised Versions Due:** March 14, 2025
*   **Final Notification:** March 25, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Papers Upload:** April 15, 2025
*   **Early Bird Registration Deadline:** April 21, 2025
*   **Final Registration Deadline:** June 25, 2025
*   **ISARC 2025 Conference Dates:** July 28 – 31, 2025

## Topics Framework

ISARC seeks contributions across three main Axes:

**Axis 1: Automation tools and techniques**

*   Sensing systems & data infrastructures
*   Information modeling techniques
*   Human-machine interface, mixed realities
*   Automated/robotic devices
*   Construction management techniques
*   Services and business applications
*   Technology management, entrepreneurship, and innovation
*   Technologies and applications in developing countries

**Axis 2: Application domains in the construction value chain**

*   Developers and real estate
*   Architecture, planning, engineering
*   Construction execution management
*   Materials, components, off-site manufacturing
*   Supply chain and logistics
*   On-site construction, construction equipment
*   Building operation and maintenance
*   Renovation and circularity

**Axis 3: Sectors**

*   Building construction
*   Infrastructure and civil construction
*   Industrial construction
*   Mining, energy/oil/gas industry
*   Smart, sustainable, and resilient cities
*   Space/maritime/etc. construction
*   Smart mobility and transportation

Authors are required to classify their paper by selecting one major Axis and up to three areas.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Paper Templates:**
    *   [Microsoft Word (.DOCX)](https://www.iaarc.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/ISARC-Paper_Template_Revised-ver.-align-with-Latex-clean.docx)
    *   [LaTex (Overleaf)](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/isarc-latex-paper-template/mkbhpjzmhchc)
*   **Copyright Transfer Agreement:** All authors must accept the [Copyright Transfer Agreement Term and Licensing Policy](https://www.iaarc.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/ISARC-CopyrightTransferAgreementTermAndLicensingPolicy-2022.pdf) upon submission of the final paper.
*   **Submission System:** Submit your paper via ConfTool: [https://www.conftool.pro/isarc2025/index.php](https://www.conftool.pro/isarc2025/index.php)
*   **Publication Ethics:** All authors are required to familiarize themselves with the [ISARC Publication Ethics and Publication Malpractice Statement](https://www.iaarc.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/ISARC-Publication-Ethics-and-Publication-Malpractice-Statement.pdf).

## Co-located Conferences

ISARC 2025 participants will have free access to:

*   CSCE Construction Specialty Conference
*   Construction Research Congress
*   Modular and Offsite Construction Summit

## Contact Information

*   **About IAARC:** [About IAARC](https://www.iaarc.org/isarc-2025/about-iaarc)
*   **Publications Organizing Team:** [Publications Organizing Team](https://www.iaarc.org/isarc-2025/publications-organizing-team)
*   **ISARC Proceedings:** [ISARC Proceedings](http://www.iaarc.org/publications/search.php)

summary: The 23rd annual Industrial Simulation Conference (ISC'2025) will be held from June 3-5, 2025, at the University of Skovde in Skovde, Sweden. The conference aims to provide an overview of industrial simulation research, integrating artificial intelligence, agents, and other modeling techniques, and fostering exchange between universities and industry. ISC'2025 will cover various tracks including Discrete Event Simulation, Artificial Intelligence, Complex Systems Modelling, and Simulation in Manufacturing and Logistics.
callForPapers:
# ISC'2025: Call for Papers

The 23rd annual Industrial Simulation Conference (ISC'2025) will be held from **June 3-5, 2025**, at the **University of Skovde, Skovde, Sweden**.

The aim of ISC'2025 is to provide a comprehensive overview of current industrial simulation research and a status report on global industrial simulation research, aligning with European industrial research projects.

## Tracks

The conference will cover the following tracks:

*   **Discrete Event Simulation Methodology, Languages and Tools**
*   **Artificial Intelligence, IOT AND VR Graphics Applied to Industry**
*   **Complex Systems Modelling**
*   **Simulation in Robotics**
*   **Simulation in Engineering**
*   **Simulation in Collaborative Engineering**
*   **Simulation in Manufacturing**
*   **Simulation in Logistics and Traffic**
*   **Datamining Business Processes, Geosimulation AND Big Data**
*   **Simulation in Economics and Business**
*   **Simulation in Economics and Risk Management**
*   **Simulation in Sustainable Development**
*   **VR/AR Simulations in Education**
*   **Meta Analysis for synthesizing Data**
*   **Machine Learning Techniques for detecting Problem Gambling**

### Special Track

*   **Smart Cities' Simulation**, organized by the SUC Institute, UN Sustainable Development Goals.

Authors of accepted papers within the scope of the Smart Cities' Simulation track, after selection by the LivCom Board, will be invited to submit their unmodified ISC'2025 papers to the [2025 LivCom Awards](http://www.livcomawards.org/).

## Submission Types

*   **Extended Paper:** 8 pages (including abstract, conclusions, diagrams, references). Can be accepted as a regular 5-page paper or an extended 8-page paper based on quality.
*   **Regular Paper:** 5 pages (including abstract, conclusions, diagrams, references).
*   **Short Paper:** 3 pages (for short papers or posters).
*   **Abstracts/Papers:** 1-2 pages are NOT accepted.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submit all contributions in an ELECTRONIC FORM ONLY in Microsoft Word format or Adobe PDF (PREFERRED) format.
*   Indicate the designated track and type of submission (full paper or an extended abstract).
*   Email submissions to Philippe.Geril@eurosis.org with the subject: **ISC'2025** and the designated track, or use the online submission form.
*   Provide your name, affiliation, full mailing address, telephone/fax number, and Email address on all submissions.
*   Only original papers, which have not been published elsewhere, will be accepted for publication.

## Important Deadlines

*   **Early Bird Submission:** January 10, 2025
*   **Submission Deadline (Preferred):** February 5, 2025
*   **Late Paper Submission Deadline:** February 25, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance or Rejection:** March 20, 2025
*   **Final Paper Submission:** April 25, 2025
*   **Conference Start:** June 3, 2025
*   **Conference End:** June 5, 2025

## Registration Fees (On-Site)

*   **Author EUROSIS members:** Pre-registration before April 25, 2025: €540; After April 25, 2025: €595
*   **Other Participants:** Pre-registration before April 25, 2025: €585; After April 25, 2025: €640

**Included:** Entrance to all sessions, one printed and electronic copy of proceedings, entrance to exhibition, tutorial access (if any), coffee breaks, lunches, social event (including dinner).

## Registration Fees (Off-Site Electronic Participation)

*   **Author EUROSIS members:** Before April 25, 2025: €420; After April 25, 2025: €260
*   **Other Participants:** Before April 25, 2025: €280; After April 25, 2025: €315

**Included:** Access to all sessions, one electronic copy of proceedings, online exhibition access (if any), tutorial access (if any) in electronic format, posting of electronic presentation on EUROSIS Youtube channel.

## Student Registration Fees (On-Site)

*   **Student Author EUROSIS members:** Pre-registration before April 25, 2025: €435; After April 25, 2025: €475
*   **Other Student Participants:** Pre-registration before April 25, 2025: €445; After April 25, 2025: €500

**Included:** Same as regular on-site registration.

## Student Registration Fees (Off-Site Electronic Participation)

*   **Student Author EUROSIS members:** Before April 25, 2025: €355; After April 25, 2025: €205
*   **Other Student Participants:** Before April 25, 2025: €220; After April 25, 2025: €230

**Included:** Same as regular off-site electronic participation.

## Group Discounts

Authors from the same institution or project can qualify for a special discount as a group (at least 3 people). Contact Philippe Geril for details.

## Contact Information

Philippe Geril
EUROSIS-ETI European Simulation Office
Romestraat 19 Bus 04.02, B-8400 Ostend, Belgium
Tel: +32.473.231.297
Email: philippe.geril@eurosis.org

The conference, organized by George Mason University, will be held in-person in the greater Washington DC area. The proceedings of ISC 2024 will be published by Springer.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - Information Security Conference (ISC) 2024

The Information Security Conference (ISC) is an annual international conference covering research in theory and applications of Information Security. ISC aims to attract high-quality papers in all technical aspects of information security. This includes submissions from academia, industry, and government on traditional as well as emerging topics and new paradigms in these areas, with a clear connection to real-world problems, systems, or applications.

## Types of Submissions Solicited

Papers on all technical aspects of information security, cryptography, and privacy are solicited for submission. Areas of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   access control
*   anonymity
*   applied cryptography
*   attribute-based cryptography
*   automated security analysis
*   biometric security
*   blockchain
*   certification
*   cloud computing
*   containerization
*   critical infrastructures
*   cryptanalysis
*   cryptocurrency
*   cybercrime
*   database/system security
*   decentralized systems
*   downgrade attacks
*   embedded platforms
*   fault attacks
*   fingerprinting
*   formal methods
*   foundations
*   functional encryption
*   hardness assumptions
*   homomorphic encryption
*   identity-based cryptography
*   identity management
*   implementation
*   indistinguishability obfuscation
*   Internet security
*   intrusion detection
*   key management
*   malware
*   mathematical aspects
*   micro-architectural attacks
*   mobile/wireless/5G security
*   multilinear maps
*   multi-party computation
*   networks security
*   OS and systems security
*   post-quantum cryptography
*   privacy
*   privacy-enhancing technologies
*   protocols
*   public-key cryptography
*   real-world cryptography
*   secure messaging
*   secure voting
*   security proofs
*   side-channel attacks
*   software security
*   standardization
*   symmetric-key cryptography
*   threshold cryptography
*   trusted execution
*   unlinkability
*   usability
*   vulnerabilities
*   web security
*   zero-knowledge proofs

## Deadlines

*   **Submission Deadline:** June 13, 2024 (AoE) (Extended)
*   **Rebuttal:** July 16-19, 2024
*   **Notification:** July 30, 2024 (AoE)
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** August 15, 2024 (AoE)
*   **Conference:** October 23-25, 2024

## Best Paper Award

Accepted papers will be judged and ranked by the Program Committee. The best papers will be considered for the Best Paper Award.

## Instructions for Authors

*   Submissions must be original work and may not be under submission to another journal or conference with proceedings at the time of review.
*   Submissions must be in the Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) style, with default margins and fonts, but with the addition of page numbers.
*   Submissions are limited to 16 pages excluding bibliography and appendices, and to 20 pages including bibliography and appendices.
*   Optionally, any amount of clearly marked supplementary material may be supplied, but reviewers are not required to read this.
*   Authors should consult Springer’s authors’ guidelines and use their LaTeX proceedings template.
*   Authors should include their ORCID(s) in their papers.
*   Submitted papers must be in PDF format.
*   Submissions must be made electronically via the [ISC 2024 submission system (HotCRP)](https://isc24.hotcrp.com/).
*   The submission must be **anonymous** with no author names, affiliations, or obvious references.
*   For accepted papers, the corresponding author must complete and sign a Consent-to-Publish form, transferring the copyright to Springer.
*   Authors of accepted papers must guarantee that their paper will be presented at the conference.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - International Symposium on Combinatorial Optimisation (ISCO)

ISCO (Integer Symposium on Combinatorial Optimization) is a biannual symposium that aims to bring together researchers from various communities related to combinatorial optimization, including algorithms and complexity, mathematical programming, operations research, stochastic optimization, graphs, and combinatorics.

Quality papers on all aspects of combinatorial optimization, from mathematical foundations and theory of algorithms to computational studies and practical applications, are solicited.

## Scope of ISCO

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Approximation algorithms
*   Branch-and-bound algorithms
*   Branch-and-cut-and-price algorithms
*   Computational biology
*   Computational complexity
*   Computational geometry
*   Constraint Programming
*   Cutting plane algorithms
*   Exact and parameterized algorithms
*   Graph and network algorithms
*   Interior point methods
*   Linear and nonlinear integer programming
*   Local search algorithms
*   Metaheuristics
*   On-line algorithms
*   Polyhedral combinatorics
*   Randomized algorithms
*   Scheduling algorithms

## Spring School

Each ISCO conference is preceded or followed by a Spring School lectured by international Combinatorial Optimization researchers. This school is dedicated to PhD students, but lectures are also open to older colleagues.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The International Conference on Intelligent Systems Designs and Applications (ISDA’25) is a premier gathering that brings together leading experts, researchers, and practitioners from around the globe to explore the latest advancements and innovations in artificial intelligence and their applications in research and development. This conference aims to foster collaboration, share cutting-edge research, and discuss the future trajectory of AI in various sectors.

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** **February 24-25, 2025**
*   **Location:** Settat, Morocco
*   **Proceedings Publisher:** **Springer Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems (LNNS)**

## Conference Topics

*   **Track 1: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning**
    *   Supervised and Unsupervised Learning
    *   Deep Learning and Neural Networks
    *   Reinforcement Learning
    *   AI in Natural Language Processing
*   **Track 2: Data Science and Big Data Analytics**
    *   Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery
    *   Predictive Analytics
    *   Data Visualization
    *   Big Data Infrastructure and Management
*   **Track 3: Digital Transformation and Innovation**
    *   Digital Business Models
    *   Innovation in Digital Services
    *   Digital Strategy and Leadership
    *   Case Studies in Digital Transformation
*   **Track 4: Internet of Things (IoT) and Smart Cities**
    *   IoT Architectures and Frameworks
    *   Smart City Applications and Solutions
    *   Sensor Networks and Data Collection
    *   IoT Security and Privacy
*   **Track 5: Blockchain Technology and Applications**
    *   Blockchain for Financial Services
    *   Supply Chain and Logistics
    *   Blockchain in Healthcare
    *   Smart Contracts and DApps
*   **Track 6: Cybersecurity and Privacy**
    *   Threat Detection and Prevention
    *   Cryptography and Network Security
    *   Privacy Enhancing Technologies
    *   Cybersecurity in IoT and Cloud
*   **Track 7: Robotics and Automation**
    *   Autonomous Systems
    *   Industrial Automation and Control
    *   Human-Robot Interaction
    *   Robotics in Healthcare
*   **Track 8: Human-Computer Interaction**
    *   User Interface Design
    *   Interaction Techniques and Devices
    *   User Experience and Usability
    *   Virtual and Augmented Reality

## Submission Guidelines

*   Prospective authors are requested to submit new, unpublished manuscripts for inclusion in the upcoming event described in this call for papers.
*   Submission System: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=isda25](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=isda25)
*   For detailed instructions and templates, visit: [Springer Conference Proceedings Guidelines](https://www.springer.com/in/authors-editors/conference-proceedings/conference-proceedings-guidelines)

## Important Dates

*   Submission: **February 21, 2025**
*   Notification: **March 24, 2025**
*   Registration: **April 05, 2025**
*   Camera ready: **April 13, 2025**

## Submission Fees

*   PhD Students (Moroccan): **1000 MAD**

## Registration

## Publication

callForPapers:
# Call for Full-Paper Submission

# Call for Abstracts

*   **Opening day:** Oct 21, 2024
*   **Submission deadline:** Dec 19, 2024

*The call for abstracts is closed.*

## Overview

The International Symposium on Grids & Clouds (ISGC) 2025 will focus on the practical deployment of AI technologies, particularly how they have been successfully integrated to accelerate research and address complex challenges. From machine learning models to large language models (LLMs), AI’s transformative impact is undeniable, and the conference will showcase real-world use cases and share valuable lessons learned in deploying these technologies.

In parallel, hybrid quantum computing is emerging as a promising game changer. ISGC 2025 will explore the current state of hybrid quantum systems, discussing their deployment and the challenges in integrating these cutting-edge technologies. Together, AI and quantum computing represent the future of computational science, offering unprecedented opportunities for innovation.

ISGC 2025 will foster an environment for sharing ideas and solutions, helping participants refine their approaches and collaborate to overcome the challenges of deploying these transformative technologies.

## Deadlines

*   **Submission:** (Details not specified in provided text for full papers, but abstract deadline was Dec 19, 2024)
*   **Notification:** (Not specified)
*   **Camera Ready:** (Not specified)

## Submission Guidelines

Submissions are invited for full papers and abstracts. Authors are encouraged to share practical deployment examples, lessons learned, and insights into the integration of AI and hybrid quantum computing.

## Contact

For inquiries, please contact: [vhuang@gate.sinica.edu.tw](mailto:vhuang@gate.sinica.edu.tw)

callForPapers:
# ISMB/ECCB 2025: Call for Papers

The 33rd annual International Conference on Intelligent Systems for Molecular Biology (ISMB) and the 24th Annual European Conference on Computational Biology (ECCB) 2025, known as ISMB/ECCB 2025, will be held from **July 20–24, 2025**, in **Liverpool, United Kingdom**. This joint conference is the premier global event for bioinformatics and computational biology.

ISMB/ECCB 2025 offers both **in-person** and **virtual participation** options. The conference focuses on the development and application of advanced computational methods to address biological problems, bringing together researchers from diverse fields including computer science, bioinformatics, computational biology, molecular biology, mathematics, and statistics. The event actively involves ISCB’s Communities of Special Interest (COSIs) in program development to highlight emerging research areas.

## Topics of Interest

The conference covers a wide range of topics, with a principal focus on the development and application of advanced computational methods to address biological problems. Key areas include, but are not limited to, those covered by the various scientific program tracks and COSIs, such as:

*   AI-powered Bioinformatics
*   Bioinformatics in the UK
*   Biostatistics
*   Computational Systems Immunology
*   Data Visualization
*   DREAM Challenges
*   Machine Learning in Computational Biology
*   Microbiome
*   Natural Language Processing in Biology
*   Sequence Analysis
*   Systems Biology
*   Text Mining

## Submission Types

ISMB/ECCB 2025 invites submissions for:

*   **Abstracts:** For talks and posters.
*   **Proceedings:** Full papers for publication.
*   **Tech Track:** Proposals for technical demonstrations and presentations.
*   **Tutorials:** Proposals for educational sessions.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstracts (Talks and Posters):**
    *   Call for abstracts opens: **Monday, January 20, 2025**
    *   Abstracts submission deadline: **Thursday, April 17, 2025** (*no extensions*)
    *   Abstract acceptance notifications: **Tuesday, May 13, 2025**

*   **Late-breaking Posters:**
    *   Submissions open: **Monday, April 21, 2025**
    *   Submission deadline: **Thursday, May 15, 2025** (*no extensions*)
    *   Notifications sent: **Thursday, May 22, 2025**

*   **CAMDA Specific (part of Abstracts/Posters):**
    *   CAMDA extended abstracts submission deadline: **Thursday, May 15, 2025** (*no extensions*)
    *   CAMDA acceptance notifications sent: **Thursday, May 22, 2025**

*   **Proceedings:**
    *   Call for proceedings opens: **Thursday, December 5, 2024**
    *   Submission deadline: **Thursday, January 23, 2025** (*no extensions*)
    *   Conditional acceptance notifications: **Thursday, March 13, 2025**
    *   Revised papers deadline: **Thursday, March 27, 2025** (*no extensions*)
    *   Final acceptance notifications: **Tuesday, April 8, 2025**
    *   Publication fees due for accepted papers: **Thursday, May 1, 2025**

*   **Tech Track:**
    *   Call for tech track opens: **Wednesday, January 1, 2025**
    *   Proposals deadline: **Thursday, May 1, 2025** (*no extensions*)
    *   Acceptance notifications: **Tuesday, May 20, 2025**
    *   Payments due: **Tuesday, June 10, 2025**

*   **Tutorials:**
    *   Call for tutorials opens: **Monday, November 4, 2024**
    *   Proposals deadline: **Thursday, December 19, 2024** (*no extensions*)
    *   Acceptance notifications: **Tuesday, January 28, 2025**
    *   Last day for tutorial registration: **Thursday, July 10, 2025**

## Submission Information

Authors are invited to submit contributions through the official conference portal. Specific links for each submission type are provided below:

*   [Abstracts (Talks and Posters)](/ismbeccb2025/call-for-submissions/abstracts)
*   [Proceedings](/ismbeccb2025/call-for-submissions/proceedings)
*   [Tech Track](/ismbeccb2025/call-for-submissions/tech-track)
*   [Tutorials](/ismbeccb2025/call-for-submissions/tutorials)
*   [General Conference Information](/ismbeccb2025/home)

## Publication

Accepted contributions will be published in the conference proceedings and archived in the Open Access ISCB Nucleus platform. Selected authors may be invited to submit extended versions to ISCB journals.

summary: The International Symposium on Memory Management (ISMM 2025) is the premier forum dedicated to research in memory management. It will be held in Seoul, South Korea, on June 17, 2025, and is co-located with PLDI 2025.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## Update

**2025-03-06:** One week submission extension, submissions now due **2025-03-18 (AoE UTC-12h)**.

## Expanded Scope

Continuing from ISMM 2024, we are excited to announce the continued expanded scope of ISMM this year to encourage submissions and participation from related fields such as **computer architecture** and **computer systems** in addition to our core PL community!

## Solicitation

The 2025 ACM SIGPLAN International Symposium on Memory Management (ISMM 2025) is soliciting full-length submissions covering new work on all memory management related topics in both software and hardware (and their cooperation), as well as papers presenting confirmations or refutations of important prior results.

In addition to regular papers, traditionally submitted to ISMM, we also invite submissions of the following kinds:

*   **Surveys and comparative analyses** that shed new light on previously published techniques.
*   **Practitioner reports**, describing experience with memory management in production. Such papers are not expected to provide novel research contributions, but they should not have been previously published.
*   **Intellectual abstracts**, where researchers share designs, algorithms, or theory that may be interesting to the memory management community, but not yet evaluated.

Please indicate whether the paper is a regular paper, a survey, a practitioner report, or an intellectual abstract, by using a subtitle. For example, for a regular paper, include on of the following on the line below the title line:

`\subtitle{This submission is a regular paper},
\subtitle{This submission is a survey},
\subtitle{This submission is a practitioner report},
\subtitle{This submission is an intellectual abstract}.`

ISMM 2025 will be colocated with [PLDI 2025](https://pldi25.sigplan.org/).

## Areas of Interest

Areas of interest include but are not limited to (in no particular order):

*   Garbage collection algorithms and implementations
*   Memory allocation and de-allocation
*   Memory system design and analysis (both software and hardware)
*   Hardware support for memory management
*   Memory management for large-scale data-intensive systems
*   Memory management at datacenter and cloud scales
*   Formal analysis and verification of memory management algorithms
*   Compiler analyses to aid memory management
*   Tools to analyze memory usage and characteristics of programs
*   Empirical analysis of memory intensive programs
*   Formal analysis and verification of memory intensive programs
*   Memory management for machine learning systems
*   Programming and management of emerging or persistent memories
*   Caches, memory controllers, memory hierarchies and their management
*   Cache coherence and memory consistency
*   Processing in memory (including processing near and using memory)
*   Memory technology and architecture (SRAM, DRAM, flash, NVM, emerging technologies)
*   Security and privacy of memory systems
*   Robustness of memory systems
*   Low-latency and low-energy memory systems

The symposium welcomes industry practitioners presenting their recent practice and findings in memory management related to real-world deployments.

## Submission Link

[https://ismm25.hotcrp.com](https://ismm25.hotcrp.com)

## Formatting Instructions

*   All papers must be submitted on-line in **Portable Document Format (PDF)**.
*   Papers should be formatted according to the **two-column ACM proceedings format**. Each paper should have no more than **12 pages**, excluding bibliography, in **10pt font**.
*   There is no limit on the page count for references. Each reference must list all authors of the paper (do not use et al).
*   The citations should be in **numeric style**, e.g., `[52]`.
*   Submissions should be in PDF format and printable on US Letter and A4 sized paper.
*   Make sure that figures and tables are legible, even after the paper is printed in gray-scale.
*   Appendices should not be part of the paper, but should be submitted as supplementary material. Supplementary material should also be anonymized, as described below.
*   As explained in more detail at [http://www.sigplan.org/Resources/Author](http://www.sigplan.org/Resources/Author), authors should use the `sigplan` subformat of the `acmart` format. Please note the following:
    ```latex
    \documentclass[sigplan,10pt,review,anonymous]{acmart}
    \settopmatter{printfolios=true,printccs=false,printacmref=false}
    ```
*   The default citation style is numeric.
*   Do not mess with the class file or settings to try to sneak in additional space.
*   Do not use the PACMPL files or format; ISMM is not using them.

Papers that exceed the length requirement or deviate from the expected format will be rejected.

## Double-Blind Reviewing

ISMM uses **double-blind reviewing**. This means that author names and affiliations must be omitted from the submission. Additionally, if the submission refers to prior work done by the authors, that reference should be made in third person. These are firm submission requirements. Any supplementary material must also be anonymized.

An earlier FAQ on Double-Blind Reviewing clarifies the policy for the most common scenarios. But there are many gray areas and trade-offs – [FAQ on Double-Blind Reviewing](https://pldi23.sigplan.org/track/pldi-2023-pldi#FAQ-on-Double-Blind-Reviewing). If you have any doubts about how to interpret the double-blind rules, or any cases that are not fully covered by the FAQ, please contact the Program Chairs. In complex cases, it is better to get guidance from the Program Chairs than to risk summary rejection.

## Declaring Conflicts

When submitting the paper, you will need to declare potential conflicts. Conflicts should be declared between an adviser and an advisee (e.g., Ph.D., post-doc). Other conflicts include institutional conflicts, financial conflicts of interest, friends or relatives, or any recent co-authors on papers and proposals (last 2 years).

Please do not declare spurious conflicts: such incorrect conflicts are especially harmful if the aim is to exclude potential reviewers, so spurious conflicts can be grounds for rejection. If you are unsure about a conflict, please consult the Program Chair.

## Publication Date

AUTHORS TAKE NOTE: The official publication date is the date the proceedings are made available in the ACM Digital Library. This date may be up to two weeks prior to the first day of your conference. The official publication date affects the deadline for any patent filings related to published work.

## Author Response

The author response process will occur in **April 2025**, and will give the authors an opportunity to respond to factual errors in reviews before the Program Committee meets to make its decisions.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Paper submission:** Tue 18 Mar 2025
*   **Author response period:** Wed 23 - Fri 25 Apr 2025
*   **Author notification:** Sat 3 May 2025
*   **Camera-ready papers due:** Thu 15 May 2025
*   **Conference Day:** Tue 17 Jun 2025

# Call for Papers: ISTAS 2025

The IEEE International Symposium on Technology and Society (ISTAS) 2025 invites contributions exploring the far-reaching implications of technological advancements on our society. The conference theme is **AI EVOLUTION & REVOLUTION**, with several key sub-themes to be featured in the program.

## Submission Details

*   **Submission Portal:** [EASYCHAIR SUBMISSION PORTAL](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=istas25)
*   **Contribution Types:** Submissions are welcome for regular papers, student submissions, and volunteer opportunities.
*   **Thematic Areas of Interest:** Further details on specific thematic areas can be found [here](https://attend.ieee.org/istas-2025/thematic-areas-of-interest/).

## Important Dates

*   **Student Acceptance Notification:** July 14, 2025
*   **Student Confirmation of Acceptance & Conference Registration:** July 21, 2025
*   **Acceptance/Rejection Notices:** July 18, 2025
*   **Early Registration Deadline:** July 31, 2025
*   **Final Camera-Ready Paper Deadline:** August 1, 2025
*   **Student Video/Final Poster or Slides Submission Deadline:** August 1, 2025

## About ISTAS

ISTAS is a multi/inter/trans‐disciplinary forum for engineers, policy makers, entrepreneurs, philosophers, researchers, social scientists, technologists, and polymaths to collaborate, exchange experiences, and discuss the social implications of technology. All disciplines are welcome.

## Registration

*   **Registration Information:** [ISTAS25 Registration Information page](https://attend.ieee.org/istas-2025/registration-information/)
*   Early registration is open at discounted rates until July 31, 2025. Regular rates apply from August 1.
*   Special rates are available for IEEE and SSIT members, Santa Clara University faculty, and post-secondary students.

# IEEE International Test Conference (ITC) 2025: Call for Papers

The IEEE International Test Conference (ITC) is the world's premier conference dedicated to the electronic test of devices, boards, and systems, covering the complete cycle from design verification, test, diagnosis, failure analysis, and back to process and design improvement. ITC provides a platform for test and design professionals to confront industry challenges and learn how academia, design tool and equipment suppliers, designers, and test engineers are addressing them.

The 2025 conference will be held from **September 21-26, 2025**, at the **Hilton San Diego Bayfront in San Diego, California**.

callForPapers:
# ITS2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Intelligent Tutoring Systems (ITS2025) is the upcoming conference in the series of Intelligent Tutoring Systems Conferences focusing on Computer and Cognitive Sciences, Artificial Intelligence, and Deep Learning in Tutoring and Education. ITS2025 will be held in **Alexandroupolis, Greece, from June 02 to June 06, 2025**, and will be co-hosted by Democritus University of Thrace.

The conference will be **hybrid**, allowing participants to attend online as well.

## Conference Theme

"**Generative Systems**"

Generative Intelligence concerns AI systems, techniques, architectures, methods, or tools based on deep and machine learning which can be used to generate texts, images, solutions, and environments, able to enhance HUMAN intelligence, cognitive capacities, memory, and learning.

## Conference Tracks

*   **T1: Generative Tutoring Systems**
*   **T2: Generative Systems in Healthcare Informatics**
*   **T3: Generative Systems in Human Interaction, Games and Virtual Reality**
*   **T4: Neural Networks and Data Mining**
*   **T5: Generative Systems and Metaverse**
*   **T6: Security, Privacy, and Ethics in Generative Systems**
*   **T7: Generative Systems for Applied Natural Language Processing**
*   **T8: Generative Systems and Cognitive Robots**

## Submission Categories

*   **Full papers:** Twelve (12) pages
*   **Short papers:** Eight (8) pages
*   **Posters:** Six (6) pages
*   **Doctoral consortium papers**
*   **Workshop/Tutorial proposals**

## Submission Guidelines

*   All papers must be original and not simultaneously submitted to or published in any other journal or conference.
*   Papers should be submitted referring to a precise conference track.
*   All paper submissions should be made through the [EasyChair platform](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=its20250).
*   Paper submissions should be in PDF and in English.
*   The evaluation process of papers is **double-blind**.
*   All papers submitted for review **MUST not** contain the authors’ names, affiliations, or any information that may disclose the authors’ identity. Authors should replace names and affiliations with Xs on submitted papers and avoid explicit auto-references.

## Important Dates

*   **Call for Papers (CFP) and Submission Deadline:** March 1, 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification:** March 31, 2025

## Registration Fees and Deadlines

*   **Authors Registration:** Until April 30, 2025
*   **Online attendees’ registration:** Until May 30, 2025
*   **Onsite attendees’ registration:** Until May 15, 2025

**Fees for Authors:**

*   300 euros for each approved paper.
*   At least one author of each accepted full paper/short paper/poster must register by April 30, 2025, to appear in the Conference Proceedings.
*   Onsite attendance for authors requires an additional registration fee of 180 euros.

**Fees for Attendees:**

*   Online attendance: **Gratis**
*   Onsite attendance (authors and participants): **180 euros**
*   Onsite attendance for students: **160 euros**

**Registration Platform:** [https://iis-international.org/product-category/its2025/](https://iis-international.org/product-category/its2025/)

## Workshops

*   Workshops can be half or full-day long and take place on the day before the main ITS2025 conference (June 04, 2025).
*   Workshop proposals should include themes, goals, relevance to ITS2025, quality assurance criteria, event structure, expected participants, audience description, proposed duration, logistic constraints, and organizer contact information.
*   Workshop proposals should be submitted directly to ITS2025 via EASY CHAIR.

## Proceedings

The ITS2025 Proceedings will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series by Springer.

## Contact

*   Phone: (+30) 2105232044
*   Email: info@iis-international.org

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE-ITW’25

IEEE-ITW’25 solicits and welcomes original contributions on the frontiers of information theory, statistics, coding theory, and their applications, as well as interactions between information theory and other fields such as data science, biology, and signal processing.

We encourage interested authors to submit previously unpublished contributions from a broad range of topics related to information and coding theory as well as its connections with other areas.

## Broad Topics Include:

*   Communications Theory
*   Frontiers of coding theory and practice
*   Information theory and statistics, biology and signal processing
*   Information-theoretic security
*   Machine learning and big data analytics
*   Modern coding theory
*   Network information theory
*   Network coding and distributed storage
*   Quantum information and coding

### Specific Focus Areas for ITW 2025:

*   Information theory in Machine Learning
*   Quantum information and coding
*   Coding for 6G

## Detailed Topics:

*   Big Data Analytics
*   Coding for Communication and Storage
*   Coding for 6G
*   Coding Theory
*   Combinatorics and Information Theory
*   Communication Theory
*   Complexity and Computation Theory
*   Compressed Sensing and Sparsity
*   Cryptography and Security
*   Deep Learning for Communication
*   Networks
*   Detection and Estimation
*   Distributed Storage and Computing
*   Emerging Applications of Information Theory
*   Information Theory and Statistics
*   Information Theory for Decision and Control
*   Information Theory in Biology
*   Information Theory in Computer Science
*   Information Theory in Machine Learning
*   Machine Learning and Pattern Recognition
*   Network Coding and Applications
*   Network Data Analysis
*   Network Information Theory
*   Quantum Information and Coding Theory
*   Shannon Theory
*   Signal Processing
*   Source and Channel Modeling
*   Source Coding and Data Compression
*   Wireless Communication and Networks

## Important Dates

*   **Full Paper Submission Deadline:** April 18, 2025 AoE / April 21, 2025 AoE
*   **Acceptance Notification:** June 27, 2025 AoE
*   **Camera-Ready Submission:** July 25, 2025 AoE

## Submission Information

*   You can [Download Call for Papers](https://www.ieee-itw2025.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/ITW2025_CFP_21_April.pdf).
*   Please submit your contributions via the website.

## Contact

For any request, please contact: [info@ieee-itw2025.org](mailto:info@ieee-itw2025.org)

## Venue

The workshop will be held in Sydney, Australia from September 29 – October 3, 2025.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - IUI 2025

### Conference Overview

The ACM Conference on Intelligent User Interfaces (ACM IUI) 2025 is the 30th annual premiere venue where researchers and practitioners meet and discuss state-of-the-art advances at the intersection of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Human-Computer Interaction (HCI).

Ideal IUI submissions should address practical HCI challenges using machine intelligence and discuss both computational and human-centric aspects of such methodologies, techniques and systems.

### Conference Theme: Sustainability

The theme for IUI 2025 is **Sustainability**, covering a wide variety of topics such as:

*   Intelligent user interfaces accounting for social inclusion
*   Interactive intelligent systems for environmental sustainability
*   Human control of energy management or resource conservation
*   Behavioral change
*   Data-driven decision making for environmental monitoring

While we encourage submissions related to this theme, the scope of the conference is not limited to the theme only.

### Submission Types and Deadlines (AoE)

*   **Workshop proposals:** **September 21, 2024** (Passed)
*   **Paper Abstract:** **October 3, 2024** (Passed)
*   **Full Paper:** **October 10, 2024** (Passed)
*   **Tutorial proposals:** **December 7, 2024** (Passed)
*   **Posters and Demos:** **January 7, 2025** (Passed)
*   **Doctoral Consortium:** **January 13, 2025** (Passed)

## Contribution Guidelines

*   **Full Papers:** Submissions should be original work not previously published or under review elsewhere.
*   **Posters and Demos:** These submissions highlight ongoing research, system prototypes, or interactive demonstrations.
*   **Doctoral Consortium:** A venue for PhD students to present and discuss their research with faculty mentors.

## Registration and Attendance

IUI 2025 is intended to be an **in-person conference**. There will be no separate virtual attendance registration option; all registrations are for in-person attendance. In exceptional circumstances (such as visa denial), a pre-recorded video presentation will be allowed, however the registration fee must still be paid.

## Further Information

*   **Full Conference Schedule:** [https://programs.sigchi.org/iui/2025/](https://programs.sigchi.org/iui/2025/)
*   **Short Version Conference Schedule:** [./program_at_a_glance.html](program_at_a_glance.html)
*   **Call for Papers:** [./call_for_papers.html](call_for_papers.html)
*   **Call for Posters and Demos:** [./call_for_posters_demos.html](call_for_posters_demos.html)
*   **Call for Doctoral Consortium:** [./call_for_doctoral_consortium.html](call_for_doctoral_consortium.html)
*   **Camera Ready Instructions:** [Camera Ready Instructions](Camera_Ready_Instructions)

## Past Events

*   IUI-2024 in Greenville, USA
*   IUI-2023 in Sydney, Australia
*   IUI-2022 virtually hosted by University of Helsinki, Finland
*   IUI-2021 virtually hosted by Texas A&M University, USA
*   IUI-2020 in Cagliari, Italy
*   IUI-2019 in Los Angeles, USA
*   IUI-2018 in Tokyo, Japan
*   IUI-2017 in Limassol, Cyprus
*   IUI-2016 in Sonoma, USA

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - IV 2025

The **29th International Conference on Information Visualisation (IV)** will be held from **05-08 August 2025** at the **Darmstadt University of Applied Sciences, Germany**.

IV focuses on current hot topics in Information Visualisation, Visual Analytics, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Data Science. The conference provides opportunities for international cooperation and discussion with renowned keynote speakers.

## Submission Types and Guidelines

Your work may be submitted as:

*   **Full paper:** (6 pages) with the option for 4 additional pages subject to excess fee charges. Papers must follow the [IEEE format](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html).
*   **Short paper:** (4 pages) with the option for 4 additional pages subject to excess fee charges. Papers must follow the [IEEE format](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html).
*   **Poster presentation:** Accepted poster contributions are presented as posters and accompanied by a 4-page paper in the proceedings.

## Symposia and Tracks

The conference is articulated in various symposia, covering topics including but not limited to:

*   AI: AI-powered ACHI
*   INTER: Interfaces
*   SUSTAIN-CHI: CHI and sustainability
*   HUM-IND4.0: Human-centered industrial technologies
*   OUI: Organic user interfaces
*   HAPTIC: Haptic interfaces
*   SYSTEMS: Interactive systems
*   DEVICES: Interaction devices
*   DESIGN & EVAL: Interaction & interface design & evaluation
*   MODELS: Principles, theories, and models
*   USER: User modeling and user focus
*   CHILDREN: Children-computer interaction
*   ELDERLY: Designing for an aging population
*   PARADIGMS: Traditional and emerging paradigms
*   ACCESS: Usability and universal accessibility
*   HUMANWEB: Human-Web Interaction
*   HUM-ROBOTS: Human-robot interaction
*   HUM- AGENTS: Agents and human interaction
*   SOCIAL: Social aspects of human-computer interaction
*   GAMES: Computer games and gaming
*   EDUCATION: Human-computer interaction in education and training
*   MED APPS: Applications in medicine
*   TELECONF: Teleconferencing
*   APPLICATIONS: Other domain applications

## Important Dates

*   **Opening Date for Paper Submissions / Registration Online:** **30 September 2024**
*   **Symposium Submission Deadline:** **01 February 2025**
*   **Digital Art Gallery D-ART2024 Deadline:** **01 March 2025**
*   **Closing Date for Paper Submissions:** **15 May 2025** *(Some symposium submission deadlines extended to 8 June 2025)*
*   **Submission of Tutorials Deadline:** **15 June 2025**
*   **Submission of Posters Deadline:** **15 June 2025**
*   **Notification of Reviewing Result:** **15 June 2025** *(Revised Date)*
*   **Submission of Camera-Ready:** **25 June 2025** *(Revised Date)*
*   **Early Registration Closes:** **20 June 2025** *(Revised Date)*
*   **Closing Date for Video / Poster Display Version Submission:** **30 June 2025**
*   **Doctoral Research Workshop Abstract Submission:** **30 June 2025**
*   **Tutorial Registration Cancellation & Refund Date:** **30 June 2025**
*   **Registration Closing Dates (Pre-Registration):** **20 July 2025**
*   **Registration Close:** **20 July 2025**
*   **Conference Days:** **06 – 08 August 2025**

## Publication

Accepted and presented papers will be published in the **IV 2025 Conference Proceedings** and submitted to Conference Publishing Services. They will also be submitted to Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases such as EI Compendex, ScienceDirect, Scopus, Web of Knowledge, Thomson ISI, and IET Inspect. Extended versions of selected papers will be published as a special issue or edited books.

## Submission & Registration

Submissions and registration can be made online via: [https://www.conftool.org/IV-cgiv-2025/](https://www.conftool.org/IV-cgiv-2025/)

## Awards

*   **Best Paper Awards:** For studies selected by the committee.
*   **IV2024 Best Paper of the Year Award:** (Conditions: Presenter at the symposium)
*   **IV2024 The Young Researcher of the Year Award:** (Conditions: Presenter, age 40 and younger)
*   **Best Oral Presentation Award:** (Conditions: Presenter)
*   **Best Research Award:** (For poster presentations)

summary: The International Conference on Knowledge Engineering and Ontology Development (KEOD) is part of IC3K, the 17th International Joint Conference on Knowledge Discovery, Knowledge Engineering and Knowledge Management. KEOD 2025 will be held in Marbella, Spain, from October 22-24, 2025, and focuses on the technical, scientific, and social aspects of building, maintaining, and utilizing knowledge-based systems, with a recent expansion into LLMs and Low-code/No-code Platforms for ontology development.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: KEOD 2025

The **International Conference on Knowledge Engineering and Ontology Development (KEOD)** is a key event within **IC3K, the 17th International Joint Conference on Knowledge Discovery, Knowledge Engineering and Knowledge Management**. KEOD 2025 will be held from **October 22-24, 2025**, at the Barceló Marbella hotel in Marbella, Spain.

KEOD is sponsored by INSTICC – Institute for Systems and Technologies of Information, Control and Communication.

### Scope

**Knowledge Engineering (KE)** encompasses the technical, scientific, and social aspects of building, maintaining, and utilizing knowledge-based systems. It draws on AI, databases, expert systems, decision support systems, and software engineering, integrating insights from logic, cognitive science, and socio-cognitive engineering. Recent advancements include Large Language Models (LLMs) for automated ontology generation and Low-code/No-code Platforms for greater accessibility.

**Ontology Development (OD)** focuses on creating reusable semantic structures like vocabularies, glossaries, and formal ontologies. These are essential in applications such as knowledge graphs, digital twins, explainable AI (XAI), cybersecurity, and IoT interoperability. Ontologies are also crucial for ethical AI development, mitigating bias, and enhancing transparency.

KEOD aims to be a major meeting point for researchers and practitioners interested in methodologies and technologies related to KE and OD, encouraging the exploration of cutting-edge topics.

### Conference Topics

*   Applications and Case-Studies
*   Automated Ontology Learning and Evolution
*   Domain Analysis and Modeling
*   Domain Ontologies
*   Enterprise Engineering
*   Enterprise Ontology
*   Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) in Ontology Development
*   Integration and Interoperability
*   Knowledge Acquisition
*   Knowledge Engineering
*   Knowledge Graphs and Graph Neural Networks (GNNs)
*   Knowledge Representation
*   LLM-based Ontology Development
*   Natural Language Processing
*   Ontologies for Ethical AI and Bias Mitigation
*   Ontologies in Low-code and No-code Platforms
*   Ontology Engineering
*   Ontology Matching and Alignment
*   Ontology Sharing and Reuse
*   Ontology Tools
*   Ontology-based Cybersecurity Frameworks
*   Ontology-driven Digital Twins
*   Reference Models
*   Semantic Interoperability in IoT and Cyber-Physical Systems
*   Semantic Web
*   Sustainability and Green AI Ontologies

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** (for publication in the proceedings) or as an **abstract** (for presentation only).

*   **Complete papers** can be submitted as **Regular Papers** (completed and validated research) or **Position Papers** (work in progress or arguable opinions).
*   Papers must be in English, carefully checked for grammar and spelling.
*   Submissions must adhere to a **double-blind paper evaluation method**. Authors are requested to exclude author details, acknowledgments, and any other identifying information from their submissions.
*   Only original papers should be submitted. Plagiarism and self-plagiarism are strictly prohibited. Submissions should not overlap significantly with previously published or simultaneously submitted work.

All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS** and follow the instructions and templates found under **Guidelines and Templates**.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, under an ISBN reference, on paper and digital support.
*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef, and every paper in the digital library is given a DOI.
*   The proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the **Springer Nature Computer Science Journal**.
*   It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with Springer in a **CCIS Series book**.

## Important Dates

**Conference Date: October 22-24, 2025**

*   **Regular Papers:**
    *   Paper Submission: ~~June 6, 2025~~
    *   Authors Notification: July 17, 2025
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: July 31, 2025
*   **Position Papers:**
    *   Paper Submission: ~~July 3, 2025~~
    *   Authors Notification: July 31, 2025
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: September 5, 2025
*   **Abstracts Track:**
    *   Abstract Submission: July 31, 2025
    *   Authors Notification: September 8, 2025
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: September 17, 2025
*   **Workshops & Special Sessions:**
    *   Proposal Deadline: ~~May 27, 2025~~
*   **Tutorials, Demos, Panels:**
    *   Proposal Deadline: September 11, 2025

*Note: All dates refer to AOE time (Anywhere on Earth).* 

## Special Sessions

*   **Ontologies for Digital Twin - DTO (IC3K)**
    *   Chairs: Fatma Chamekh and Romain Chassagne
    *   Submission: July 31, 2025

## Venue

The conference will take place at the **Barceló Marbella hotel**, located in Marbella, Spain.

## Secretariat

*   KEOD Secretariat
*   Address: Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
*   Tel.: +351 265 520 185
*   Fax: +351 265 520 186
*   e-mail: [keod.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:keod.secretariat@insticc.org)
*   Web: [https://keod.scitevents.org](https://keod.scitevents.org)

callForPapers:
# KES-2025: Call for Papers

We invite papers for KES2025 on topics within the scope of the conference. All contributions must be of high quality, original, and must not have been previously published or intended for publication elsewhere.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions must be made as **complete papers** (no abstract submission stage) submitted as PDF documents through the [EasyChair online submission and review system](easychair.php).
*   Full papers should be detailed academic articles in conventional format.
*   The guide length for full papers is **8 to 10 pages** (maximum).
*   Guidance notes for the preparation of Full Papers are available [here](https://www.elsevier.com/journals/procedia-computer-science/1877-0509/guide-for-authors).
*   An MS Word template is available [here](PROCS_KES2025_DOC_Template.zip).
*   A LaTeX template is available [here](PROCS_KES2025_LATEX_Template.zip).
*   The paper format as a PDF document is available [here](https://www.elsevier.com/journals/procedia-computer-science/1877-0509/guide-for-authors).
*   Please consult important FAQs about document preparation [here](http://www.kesinternational.org/cmsFAQdisplay.php).

### Procedia Publication Requirements:

*   No changes may be made to the Procedia template, and instructions must be followed exactly.
*   The maximum length of 10 pages must not be exceeded.
*   The paper **must be presented** at the conference.

If these conditions are not adhered to, the paper will not be published in Procedia Computer Science.

## Copyright

Elsevier has automated the exclusive license transfer process. A copy of the online form will be sent to authors during production. For copyright queries, contact [oxfordcopyrights@elsevier.com](mailto:oxfordcopyrights@elsevier.com).

## Submission Conditions

*   All oral and poster papers must be presented by one of the authors who must register for the conference and pay the fee.
*   By submitting a paper, authors agree that if accepted, they will pay the fee, attend the conference, and present the paper.
*   By submitting a paper, authors indicate acceptance of the KES Terms and Conditions, available [here](http://www.kesinternational.org/terms.php).

## Important Dates

### General Tracks and Invited Sessions:

*   **Submission of papers:** March 31, 2025 (Extended to **April 14, 2025**)
*   **Notification of acceptance:** May 22, 2025
*   **Final paper publication files to be received by:** June 9, 2025

### Invited Sessions:

*   **Submission of Papers:** Chair sets deadlines
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Chair sets deadlines
*   **Final paper publication files to be received by:** June 9, 2025

## Authors Registration Deadline

*   **Early / Authors Registration Deadline:** June 9, 2025

Every paper for the General Track or Invited Sessions must have at least one author who has registered for the conference with payment by the Early Registration Deadline for the paper to appear in the proceedings. Any paper that does not have at least one author who has registered and paid by this deadline will be withdrawn from the proceedings.

## Registration Fees

*   **Early Registration Deadline:** June 9, 2025
    *   Reduced registration fees apply before this deadline.
    *   Note: Payment must be received by this date to avoid the full late fee.

It will take place from June 25-27, 2025, as part of the Smart Digital Futures 2025 multi-theme conference. Full papers will be published by Springer as book chapters in the KES Smart Innovation Systems and Technologies series, submitted for indexing in Scopus and Thomson-Reuters CPCI/Web of Science.
callForPapers:
# KES AMSTA 2025: Call for Papers

## Introduction

Welcome to KES-AMSTA-25, the **19th International KES Conference on Agents and Multiagent Systems - Technologies and Applications**. AMSTA-25 is an international scientific conference for research in the field of agent and multi-agent systems. Agents and multi-agent systems are related to a modern software paradigm which has long been recognized as a promising technology for constructing autonomous, complex and intelligent systems.

Consisting of keynote talks by experts in the field, oral and poster presentations, KES-AMSTA-25 will provide an excellent opportunity for researchers to discuss modern approaches and techniques for agent and multi-agent systems and their applications, as well as intelligent systems in the field of social networks, self-organisation and trust.

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** June 25, 26, 27, 2025
*   **Venue:** Part of the Smart Digital Futures 2025 multi-theme conference.
*   **Website:** [http://kes2025.kesinternational.org](http://kes2025.kesinternational.org)

## Proceedings Information

### Full Papers (Springer Proceedings)

The Full Papers conference proceedings will be published by **Springer** as book chapters in a volume of the **KES Smart Innovation Systems and Technologies** series. These will be submitted for indexing in **Scopus** and **Thomson-Reuters Conference Proceedings Citation Index (CPCI)** and the **Web of Science**.

*   **Format:** Papers must be formatted according to Springer guidelines found here: [https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/conference-proceedings/conference-proceedings-guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/conference-proceedings/conference-proceedings-guidelines).
*   **Length:** A guide length of **10 pages** is required. Papers longer than this will be subject to an additional charge for each extra page.
*   **Submission Format:** PDF for review. Editable word-processor files (LaTeX or MS Word) are required at the end of the review process.

### Abstracts and Late Papers

*   Authors may submit an abstract (1-2 pages) for presentation without providing a full or short paper.
*   Full or short papers submitted too late for the Springer proceedings will be published in the online journal **'Advances in Smart Systems Research (ISSN:2050-8662)'**, but will **NOT** be included in the Springer Proceedings.

## Call for Papers

Papers are invited for the conference on topics lying within the scope of the conference. All contributions must be of high quality, original, should not have been published elsewhere and should not be intended for publication elsewhere during the review period or time of the conference. Papers may be rejected without being sent to reviewers if they do not comply with the required format, length, or scope.

## Submission Conditions

*   All submissions must be presented by one of the authors, who must register for the conference and pay the fee.
*   Authors submitting multiple papers must pay a separate fee for each.
*   By submitting, authors undertake to attend, pay, and present if accepted.
*   By submitting, authors agree to abide by the KES Terms and Conditions.

## Important Dates & Deadlines

### General Track and Invited Sessions (Springer Proceedings Papers)

*   **Submission of Papers:** **5 February 2025** (Extended to **24 February 2025**)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **15 March 2025**
*   **Upload Final Publication Files:** **25 March 2025**

### Invited Session and Workshops

*   **Proposals deadline:** **31 December 2024**
*   **Submission/Notification:** Session Chair Sets Deadlines (see individual template)
*   **Upload of Final Publication Files:** **25 March 2025**

### Registration Deadlines

*   **Authors Registration Deadline:** **25 March 2025**
*   **Early Registration Deadline:** **25 March 2025**

### Late Papers and Abstracts (Not Springer Proceedings Papers)

*   **Submission of Papers:** **1 May 2025**
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **15 May 2025**
*   **Upload of Final Publication Files:** **1 June 2025**

## Submission System

Submissions must be submitted in PDF form through the EasyChair online submission and review system available [here](https://easychair.php).

## Publication Files

When a PDF copy of the paper has been accepted, authors must upload publication files, including:

*   A full set of word-processor files for the camera-ready paper (MS Word or LaTeX), including all image files.
*   A PDF copy made from these source files, with all comments removed.
*   A scanned completed copy of the Springer 'Publishing Agreement' form.

## Contact Information

For general inquiries, please refer to the contact section on the conference website.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - KES International Symposium on Intelligent Decision Technologies (KES IDT 2025)

Papers are invited for the KES IDT 2025 conference on topics lying within the scope of the conference. All contributions must be of high quality, original, and should not have been published elsewhere or be intended for publication elsewhere during the review period or time of the conference.

To ensure high quality, all papers will be thoroughly reviewed by the conference Programme Committee. Papers may be rejected without being sent to reviewers if they do not comply with the required format, length, or scope.

## Proceedings

The conference proceedings will be published by **Springer** as book chapters in a volume of the **KES Smart Innovation Systems and Technology** series, submitted for indexing in **Scopus** and **Thomson-Reuters Conference Proceedings Citation Index (CPCI)** and the **Web of Science**.

### Proceedings Papers

*   **Format:** Papers submitted for the conference proceedings must be formatted according to the instructions found on the Springer website ([https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/conference-proceedings/conference-proceedings-guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/conference-proceedings/conference-proceedings-guidelines)).
*   **Length:** A guide length of **10 pages** in publisher format. Papers longer than this will be subject to an additional charge for each extra page.
*   **Submission:** Submissions must be in **PDF format** for review purposes. Authors are required to upload editable word-processor files (LaTeX or MS Word) at the end of the review process.
*   **Submission System:** Papers must be submitted through the EasyChair online submission and review system available [here](http://easychair.php).

### Abstracts and Late Papers

*   Authors may choose to submit a **1-2 page abstract** for presentation without providing a full or short paper.
*   Full or short papers submitted too late to be included in the Springer proceedings may also be published under this category.
*   Abstracts and late papers will be published in the online journal **'Advances in Smart Systems Research' (ISSN:2050-8662)**, but they will **NOT** be included in the Springer Proceedings.
*   Information about abstracts and late papers, and submission instructions are available [here](http://submission.php).

## Submission Conditions

*   All submissions must be presented by one of the authors who must register for the conference and pay the fee.
*   Authors submitting multiple papers are required to pay a separate fee for each.
*   By submitting a paper, you undertake to attend the conference, pay the fee, and present the paper if accepted.
*   By submitting a paper, you indicate that you accept the KES Terms and Conditions and agree to abide by them.

## Publication Files

When the PDF copy of the paper has been accepted, you will receive an email asking for the publication files. You must upload:

*   A full set of word-processor files for the camera-ready paper, in **MS Word or LaTeX**, including all image files.
*   A **PDF copy** made from these source files, with all comments removed.
*   A scanned completed copy of the **Springer 'Publishing Agreement' form**.

Ensure the status of your paper is 'Accepted Publication Files Received' before the deadline, or your paper will not be included in the proceedings.

## Important Dates & Deadlines

### General Track and Invited Sessions (Springer Proceedings Papers)

*   **Submission of Papers:** 5 February 2025 (**Extended to 24 February 2025**)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** 15 March 2025
*   **Upload Final Publication Files:** 25 March 2025

### Invited Session and Workshops

*   **Proposals deadline:** 31 December 2024
*   **Submission/Notification Deadlines:** Set by Session Chair (see individual template)
*   **Upload of Final Publication Files:** 25 March 2025

### Author and Registration Deadlines

*   **Authors Registration Deadline:** **25 March 2025** (Authors must have registered by this date and full payment received for papers to be included in the Springer proceedings).
*   **Early Registration Deadline:** **25 March 2025** (Fees increase after this date).

### Late Papers and Abstracts (Not Springer Proceedings Papers)

*   **Submission of Papers:** 1 May 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** 15 May 2025
*   **Upload of Final Publication Files:** 1 June 2025

## Conference Dates

*   **Conference Sessions:** 25, 26, 27 June 2025

callForPapers:
# KSEM 2025: Call for Papers

## Final Paper Submission

Authors are required to submit the files including their camera-ready paper and copyright form using their EasyChair author account. The submission should include:

*   **(a) Either a zipped file containing all your LaTeX sources or a Word file in the RTF format.**
*   **(b) PDF version of your camera-ready paper.**

## Author Instructions

*   The page limit is strict. Please follow strictly the author instructions of Springer-Verlag for the Final Version: [https://files.sciconf.cn/master/508/35615/202502/20250225150134_34216.pdf](https://files.sciconf.cn/master/508/35615/202502/20250225150134_34216.pdf)
*   Springer requires the email address of all authors to be listed in the publication. Please ensure all authors' email addresses are included to avoid revisions and delays.
*   ORCIDs are encouraged. For more information, see: [https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/orcid?wt_mc=Other.Other.1.AUT642.ORCID_LNC_letters&utm_medium=other&utm_source=other&utm_content=4092018&utm_campaign=1_barz01_orcid_lnc_letters](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/orcid?wt_mc=Other.Other.1.AUT642.ORCID_LNC_letters&utm_medium=other&utm_source=other&utm_content=4092018&utm_campaign=1_barz01_orcid_lnc_letters)
*   Authors will be contacted by the publisher for a final check of their papers before printing.

## Copyright Form

*   Please upload a signed and completed copyright form as soon as possible.
*   Springer copyright forms can be found here: [https://files.sciconf.cn/master/508/35615/202502/20250225150322_21725.docx](https://files.sciconf.cn/master/508/35615/202502/20250225150322_21725.docx)
*   The title of the book or conference name should be entered in the top line of the copyright form.
*   The corresponding author must sign the form on behalf of all authors and be available to check the paper before publication.
*   Changes to authorship (addition, deletion, order change, corresponding author alteration) are not permitted after the paper has been delivered to Springer.
*   One author's signature is sufficient. The form can be scanned into PDF or any other standard image format.

## Registration Fees (USD/HKD = 7.8)

| Category                        | Early registration (Until June 22, 2025, AoE) | Late registration (After June 22, 2025, AoE) |
| :------------------------------ | :------------------------------------------- | :------------------------------------------ |
| Author Registration             | HKD 5,850.00 (~USD 750.00)                   | HKD 7,410.00 (~USD 950.00)                  |
| Non-Author / 2nd Author Reg.  | HKD 2,730.00 (~USD 350.00)                   | HKD 3,120.00 (~USD 400.00)                  |
| Student Registration            | HKD 1,950.00 (~USD 250.00)                   | HKD 2,340.00 (~USD 300.00)                  |

*   If you have more than one accepted paper, you must register for each one individually. There is no discount for multiple papers.
*   One registration fee covers only one person.

## Extra Page Fee

*   For regular papers (max length 16 pages), each extra page in excess of 12 pages costs **USD 150 / HKD 1170**. Click here to pay: [https://ksem2025.scimeeting.cn/en/user/index/27434?reg](https://ksem2025.scimeeting.cn/en/user/index/27434?reg)
*   For short papers (max length 10 pages), each extra page in excess of 8 pages costs **USD 150 / HKD 1170**.
*   The cost of over length charges is calculated based on the camera-ready version.

## Policy of Registration

*   All accepted regular papers/short papers will be published in KSEM 2025 proceedings.
*   High-quality accepted papers may be recommended to related special issues of prestigious international journals.
*   Each accepted paper requires at least **one Author Registration** before **June 22, 2025 (AoE)**. Papers not registered will not be included in the proceedings.
*   Submitting a paper implies that at least one author will register and attend the conference to present the paper.
*   Camera-ready papers (source file and PDF) and the copyright form must be uploaded to Easychair before **June 15, 2025 (AoE)** (STRICT DEADLINE).
*   If you register before June 15, 2025 but do not submit the camera-ready paper by June 15, 2025, a **$200 make-up fee** will be applied.

## Cancellation Policy

*   For refunds, please email the secretariat at [ksem2025@iccmacao.com](mailto:ksem2025@iccmacao.com) before **June 22, 2025 (AoE)**.
*   An administrative fee of **USD 50 (HKD 400)** will be deducted from each refund.
*   Refunds will be processed within 2-3 weeks after the conference.
*   No refunds will be made after **June 22, 2025 (AoE)**.

## Payment Options

*   **Online Payment:** Visa and Mastercard accepted.
*   **By Bank Transfer:**
    *   Bank Name: Bank of China, Macau Branch
    *   Bank Address: Bank of China Building, Avenida Doutor Mario Soares, Macau
    *   Account Name: Macau Expo Group Limited
    *   Account Number: 181988100112503 (USD) or 181911200172323 (HKD)
    *   SWIFT/BIC Code: BKCHMOMXXXX
    *   Payment Reference: KSEM 2025 + Registration Number + Your Name
    *   Address: Ave do Dr. Rodrigo Rodrigues, No.223-225, Nam Kwong Building, 13/K, Macau

**Note:**
*   Bank charges are the responsibility of the participant and should be paid at source.
*   All costs must be covered by the ordering customer, and payments should be made "free of charge for the receiver account".
*   A copy of the bank transfer document should be sent to: andrew@iccmacao.com.

## Registration

*   Individual registration: [https://ksem2025.scimeeting.cn/en/web/index/27434_2352138](https://ksem2025.scimeeting.cn/en/web/index/27434_27434_2352138)
*   Poster Printing Service: [https://ksem2025.scimeeting.cn/en/web/index/27434_2667993](https://ksem2025.scimeeting.cn/en/web/index/27434_2667993)
