callForPapers:
# PPoPP 2025: Call for Papers

The 30th ACM SIGPLAN Symposium on Principles and Practice of Parallel Programming (PPoPP 2025) will be held from **March 1st to March 5th, 2025**, in **Las Vegas, Nevada, USA**, co-located with CC, CGO, and HPCA.

## Scope

PPoPP is the premier forum for leading work on all aspects of parallel programming, including theoretical foundations, techniques, languages, compilers, runtime systems, tools, and practical experience. The symposium covers concurrent and parallel systems such as multicore, multi-threaded, heterogeneous, clustered, and distributed systems, grids, accelerators (ASICs, GPUs, FPGAs), data centers, clouds, and quantum computers.

PPoPP is interested in improving the productivity of parallel programming on modern architectures, new parallel workloads, and issues arising from large-scale scientific or enterprise workloads.

## Specific Topics of Interest

*   Languages, compilers, and runtime systems for parallel programs
*   Concurrent data structures
*   Development, analysis, or management tools
*   Fault tolerance for parallel systems
*   Formal analysis and verification
*   High-performance libraries
*   Middleware for parallel systems
*   Machine learning for parallel systems
*   Parallel algorithms
*   Parallel applications (scientific computing, enterprise workloads, web, search, analytics, cloud, machine learning)
*   Parallel frameworks
*   Parallel programming for deep memory hierarchies (including nonvolatile memory)
*   Parallel programming theory and models
*   Performance analysis, debugging and optimization
*   Productivity tools for parallel systems
*   Software engineering for parallel programs
*   Synchronization and concurrency control

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission URL:** [https://ppopp25.hotcrp.com](https://ppopp25.hotcrp.com)
*   **Format:** PDF, printable on US Letter and A4.
*   **Template:** ACM Conference Format (2-column acmart, using `acmart-sigplanproc-template.tex` for LaTeX or `interim-layout.docx` for Word). Note: Use 10pt font for the Word template.
*   **Length:** Maximum 10 pages for text, figures, etc. (excluding references). Unlimited references. No appendices allowed, but supplementary material (proofs, source code) can be submitted in PDF or ZIP format.
*   **Double-blind reviewing:** Submissions must not reveal author identity. References to authors' own work should be in the third person. Important background references should not be omitted.
*   **Supplementary Material:** Encouraged for reproducibility and artifact evaluation.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Full paper submission:** Friday, August 16, 2024
*   **Author response period:** Wednesday, October 23 – Friday, October 25, 2024
*   **Author notification:** Monday, November 11, 2024
*   **Artifact submission to AE committee:** Monday, November 18, 2024
*   **Artifact notification by AE committee:** Monday, January 6, 2025
*   **Final paper due:** Friday, January 10, 2025

## Artifact Evaluation (AE)

Authors of accepted papers are encouraged to submit their papers for Artifact Evaluation (AE) to promote reproducibility. Successful AE submissions will receive ACM reproducibility badges.

## Registration

Information on registration, accommodation, and student travel grants can be found on the conference website: [https://ppopp25.sigplan.org/attending/registration](https://ppopp25.sigplan.org/attending/registration).

## Committees

Details on the Organizing Committee, Steering Committee, and Track Committees (Main Conference, Workshops and Tutorials, Artifact Evaluation) are available on the conference website.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: 30th IEEE Pacific Rim International Symposium on Dependable Computing (PRDC 2025)

PRDC 2025 is the 30th event in a series of symposia started in 1989 devoted to dependable and fault-tolerant computing. It encompasses fundamental theoretical approaches, practical experimental projects, and commercial components and systems. This symposium is recognized as the main event in the Pacific Rim area, and it provides a forum for countries around the world to exchange ideas for improving the dependability of computing systems.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include (but not limited to):

*   Software and hardware reliability, resilience, safety, security, testing, verification, and validation
*   Dependability measurement, modeling, evaluation, and tools
*   Self-healing, self-protecting, and fault-tolerant systems
*   Architecture and system design for dependability
*   Prognostics in Complex Systems
*   Reliability analysis of Complex Systems
*   Fault-tolerant algorithms and protocols
*   Cloud computing resiliency, security and privacy
*   Software defined networks architectures and protocols
*   Dependability issues in computing systems (e.g. computer networks and communications, high performance computing, real-time systems, storage and databases systems, cyber-physical systems, socio-technical systems, and blockchain and smart contracts).
*   Emerging technologies (autonomous systems including autonomous vehicles, human machine teaming, smart devices/Internet of Things)

## Submission and Publication Information

*   **Manuscript Format:** IEEE double-column format.
*   **Page Limits:** **10 pages** for full papers and **6 pages** for short papers (references are not included in the page limit). Appendixes beyond the page limit are allowed in submission, but they are not expected to be reviewed.
*   **Submission Categories:**
    1.  **Regular Research Papers:** Should describe original research (not submitted or published elsewhere).
    2.  **Practical Experience Reports:** Should describe an experience or a case study, such as the design and deployment of a system or actual failure and recovery field data.
*   **Submission Method:** All submissions must be made electronically (in PDF format) on the submission website: [https://prdc2025.hotcrp.com/](https://prdc2025.hotcrp.com/).
*   **Review Process:** All submissions will undergo a **double-blind review**. Please ensure that you have removed any references that could lead to identifying the authors of the paper. Failure to do so may result in the rejection of the paper.
*   **Selection Criteria:** Papers will be reviewed internationally and selected based on their originality, significance, relevance, and clarity of presentation.
*   **Publication:** All accepted papers will be published by the IEEE Computer Society Press (EI Indexed).

## Paper Awards

*   One outstanding paper will be selected to receive the **Best Paper Award**.
*   One outstanding paper first-authored by a student will receive the **Best Student Paper Award**.
*   A few excellent papers will be recommended to have their extended versions submitted to an international journal.

## Important Dates (Time 23:59 AoE)

*   **Abstract submission:** July 11th, 2025
*   **Paper submission:** July 25th, 2025
*   **Author notification:** August 22nd, 2025
*   **Camera-ready version:** September 26th, 2025
*   **Conference:** November 3 - 5, 2025

callForPapers:
# Call For Papers, Abstracts and Demonstrations

**Pacific Symposium on Biocomputing (PSB) 2026**
**Big Island of Hawaii - January 3-7, 2026**

The thirty-first Pacific Symposium on Biocomputing (PSB), will be held January 3-7, 2026 at the Fairmont Orchid on the Big Island of Hawaii. PSB will bring together top researchers from North America, the Asian Pacific nations, Europe and around the world to exchange research results and address open issues in all aspects of computational biology. PSB will provide a forum for the presentation of work in databases, algorithms, interfaces, visualization, modeling and other computational methods, as applied to biological problems, with emphasis on applications in data-rich areas of molecular biology. PSB intends to attract a balanced combination of computer scientists and biologists to present significant original research, demonstrate computer systems, and facilitate formal and informal discussions on topics of importance to computational biology.

## PSB 2026 Sessions:

To provide focus for the very broad area of biological computing, PSB is organized into a series of specific sessions. Each session will involve both formal research presentations and open discussion groups.

*   **AI and Machine Learning in Clinical Medicine: Bridging or Separating Model Intelligence and Human Expertise**
*   **Biological molecular function: methods and benchmarks for finding function in biological dark matter**
*   **Fairness and Bias in Biomedical AI/ML: Defining Goals and Putting Them Into Practice**
*   **Precision Medicine: Integrating large scale data and intermediate phenotypes for understanding health and treating disease**
*   **Systems Biology and Network Analysis: From Multi-omics Integration to Biological Mechanisms**

## Papers and Posters

*   **Papers:**
    *   Papers must be submitted to the [PSB 2026 paper management system](http://psb.wufoo.com/forms/psb-paper-submission/).
    *   The core of the conference consists of rigorously peer-reviewed full-length papers reporting on original work. All accepted papers will be published electronically and indexed in PubMed, and the best of these will be presented orally to the entire conference.
    *   PSB's publisher, World Scientific Publishing (WSP), will initiate submission to PubMed Central (PMC) for accepted papers that must comply with the NIH Public Access Policy. Authors are responsible for ensuring that the manuscript is deposited into the NIHMS upon acceptance for publication.
    *   Authors may post their submitted manuscript (preprint) at any time on their personal website, in their company or institutional repository, in not-for-profit subject-based preprint servers or repositories, and on scholarly collaboration networks (SCNs). Please provide the applicable acknowledgement along with a link to the article via its DOI if available.
    *   Authors are encouraged to submit preprints to bioRxiv and/or medRxiv. If you choose to submit your preprint, please ensure that the deposit is made at the time of the paper submission deadline rather than upon acceptance.

*   **Abstracts/Posters:**
    *   Researchers wishing to present their research at PSB without official publication are encouraged to submit a one-page abstract by the abstract/poster submission deadline listed below to present their work in the poster sessions.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submissions due (absolute deadline):** August 1, 2025 11:59PM PT
*   **Notification of paper acceptance:** September 8, 2025
*   **Final paper deadline:** October 1, 2025 11:59PM PT
*   **Abstract deadline:** December 1, 2025 11:59PM PT
*   **Meeting:** January 3-7, 2026

## Paper Format

*   Please reference the [PSB paper format template and instructions](/psb-online/psb-submit/).
*   Papers must be submitted to the [PSB 2026 paper management system](http://psb.wufoo.com/forms/psb-paper-submission/).
*   The accepted file format is **PDF** (Adobe Acrobat preferred).
*   Files should be named with the last name of the first author (e.g., altman.pdf).
*   Hardcopy submissions or unprocessed TEX or LATEX files or electronic submissions not submitted through the paper management system will be rejected without review.
*   Each paper must be accompanied by a **cover letter** (as the first page).
*   The cover letter must state:
    *   The email address of the corresponding author.
    *   The specific PSB session that should review the paper.
    *   The submitted paper contains original, unpublished results, and is not currently under consideration elsewhere.
    *   All co-authors concur with the contents of the paper.
*   Submitted papers are limited to **twelve (12) pages** (NOT including the cover letter, title page with author list, or references).
*   Color images are accepted for publication at no additional charge.
*   Supplemental material may be referenced by URL (PSB will not host supplemental material).

## Contact PSB

Contact: psb.hawaii @ gmail.com for additional information about paper submission requirements.

## Travel Support

Partial travel support may be offered, but no one is guaranteed travel support. The online travel support application form will open in August.

callForPapers:
# Call for Contributions: RecSys 2025

The 19th ACM Conference on Recommender Systems (RecSys 2025) will be held in **Prague, Czech Republic, from September 22nd to 26th, 2025**.

RecSys is the premier international forum for research on the foundations and applications of recommendation technologies, connecting researchers and practitioners.

## Submission Tracks & Deadlines

### Full Papers

*   **Abstract Due:** April 1, 2025
*   **Paper Due:** April 8, 2025
*   **Author Rebuttal:** May 20-26, 2025
*   **Notification:** July 3, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Due:** July 21, 2025 (Strict)

### Short Papers

*   **Abstract Due:** April 22, 2025
*   **Paper Due:** April 30, 2025
*   **Author Rebuttal:** June 5-10, 2025
*   **Notification:** July 3, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Due:** July 21, 2025 (Strict)

### Reproducibility Papers

*   **Abstract Due:** May 6, 2025
*   **Paper Due:** May 13, 2025
*   **Author Rebuttal (Artifacts):** June 5-10, 2025
*   **Notification:** July 3, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Due:** July 21, 2025

### Doctoral Symposium

*   **Submission Due:** June 3, 2025
*   **Notification:** July 3, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Due:** July 21, 2025

### Industry Papers

*   **Submission Due:** May 15, 2025
*   **Notification:** July 3, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Due:** July 21, 2025

### Demos & Late-Breaking Results (LBR)

*   **Submission Due:** July 9, 2025
*   **Notification:** August 4, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Due:** August 11, 2025

### Workshops

*   **Proposal Submission Due:** February 27, 2025
*   **Proposal Notification:** March 28, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Summary Due:** July 14, 2025

### Tutorials

*   **Proposal Due:** April 15, 2025
*   **Proposal Notification:** April 30, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Abstract Due:** July 14, 2025

*All deadlines refer to 23:59 (11:59pm) AoE (Anywhere on Earth) time zone.* 

## In-Person Attendance Policy

RecSys 2025 is an **in-person conference**. All accepted contributions are expected to be presented in-person by at least one author. Remote presentations or videos will not be permitted. Papers not presented in person may be removed from the proceedings.

## Submission Guidelines Highlights

*   **Anonymity:** Submissions for most tracks (Full Papers, Short Papers, Reproducibility, Demos, LBR) must be anonymous. Refer to previous work in the third person and avoid identifying information. Resource papers are an exception and do not require anonymity.
*   **Page Limits:** Strict page limits apply (e.g., 8 pages for Full Papers + 2 pages for references; 4 pages for Short Papers + up to 2 pages for references). Appendices count towards the page limit.
*   **Formatting:** Use the ACM 2-column template (Word or LaTeX). Refer to specific instructions for LaTeX (use `sigconf,anonymous` option) and Word templates.
*   **Originality & Dual Submission:** Manuscripts must be original, not published elsewhere, and not simultaneously submitted to other venues, including other RecSys 2025 tracks.
*   **AI Use Policy:** Disclose the use of generative AI tools in the "Acknowledgments" section. Authors are responsible for any inaccuracies or violations.
*   **Plagiarism & Ethics:** Strict policies against plagiarism and requirements for ethical review for human-subjects research apply.
*   **EasyChair Submission:** Submissions will be handled electronically via EasyChair. Specific track selection is required.
*   **Conflict of Interest (COI):** Declare all COIs with PC and SPC members before submission. Failure to do so may result in desk-rejection.

## Relevant Areas & Topics

RecSys covers a broad spectrum of recommender systems research, including but not limited to:

*   **Human-Centered Recommendation:** Adaptive algorithms, explanations, human-in-the-loop, innovative interfaces, user control, user experiments.
*   **Societal Recommender Systems:** Cultural contexts, digital divides, bias, fairness, ethics, diversity, eco-aware models, understudied populations, sustainable systems.
*   **Computational Innovations:** Large-scale datasets, case studies, conversational systems, cross-domain recommendation, generative models, knowledge-based systems, privacy, security, evaluation metrics.
*   **Specific Track Topics:** Reproducibility, Doctoral Symposium, Industry challenges, Tutorials, Workshops, Demos, Late-Breaking Results.

## Program Chairs

*   Marco de Gemmis
*   Sole Pera
*   **Contact:** program2025@recsys.acm.org

callForPapers:
# QSHINE 2023: Call for Papers

QSHINE 2023 was held as an on-site conference, with an option for remote presentation for authors unable to attend in person.

## Scope

Heterogeneous networking has long been the focus of computer network and communications researchers worldwide. Since 2004, QSHINE has been established as the primary venue for researchers and practitioners to present novel ideas on heterogeneous networking related subjects, particularly for quality, experience, reliability, security and robustness of heterogeneous networking. QSHINE 2023 set the goal to be a high-quality conference and an international forum for presentation and discussion of cutting-edge research in the field. The scope of QSHINE 2023 covers both newest theoretical and practical research topics to address the challenges from both the trending application requirements and the communication technologies.

## Topics

We welcome contributions from the following fields:

*   **Quality of Service (QoS) and Quality of Experience (QoE):** Architectures, Protocols and Mechanisms
*   **Reliability and Scalability:** Modeling, Cognition, Extensibility, Big Data
*   **Network Security and Privacy:** Intrusion Detection, Encryption, and Blockchain
*   **Robustness:** Fault/ Disruption/ Disaster-tolerance, Resilience, Survivability
*   **Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning:** Online Computational Intelligence, Distributed Learning, Federated Learning, Edge Intelligence, Game-Theoretic Approaches
*   **Transportation Networks:** Traffic Control, Traffic Signal Processing, Intelligent Transportation
*   **E-Health Networks:** Biomedical Signal processing, Data Mining and Pattern Recognition
*   **Networks and Applications:** Internet of Things, Space-Air-Ground Networks, Cloud/Edge/Fog Computing, SDN/NFV, Smart Grid, Quantum Communications & Computing, AR/VR

## Publication

All registered papers were submitted for publishing by Springer and made available through SpringerLink Digital Library: [QSHINE Conference Proceedings](https://link.springer.com/conference/qshine?utm_source=confweb&utm_medium=outbound&utm_campaign=proceedings-series).

QSHINE proceedings are indexed in leading indexing services, such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Inspec, and Zentralblatt MATH.

Authors of selected best accepted and presented papers were invited to submit an extended version to:

*   Wireless Networks (WINET) Journal [IF: 2.701 (2020)]
*   IEEE Internet of Things Journal [IF: 10.238]
*   IEEE Journal of Biomedical and Health Informatics [IF: 7.021]
*   Digital Communications and Networks [IF: 6.348]

All accepted authors were eligible to submit an extended version in a fast track of:

*   EAI Endorsed Transactions on Scalable Information Systems (Open Access) – indexed in ESCI, Ei Compendex & Scopus

Additional publication opportunities:

*   EAI Transactions series (Open Access)
*   EAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series (titles in this series are indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)

## Submission Process

*   Papers should be submitted through EAI ‘Confy+‘ system ([https://qshine.eai-conferences.org/2023/submission/](https://qshine.eai-conferences.org/2023/submission/)).
*   Papers must comply with the Springer format (see [Author’s kit section](https://qshine.eai-conferences.org/2023/submission/#authorskit)).
*   **Regular papers** should be up to **12-15+ pages** in length.
*   **Short papers** should be **6-11 pages** in length.
*   All conference papers undergo a thorough peer review process. EAI Community Review allows EAI members to bid to review specific papers.

## Important Dates (Late Track)

*   **Full Paper Submission deadline:** 17 August 2023
*   **Notification deadline:** 31 August 2023
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** 5 October 2023

(Main Track dates were not specified in the provided text.)

callForPapers:
# RECOMB 2025: Call for Papers

RECOMB 2025 is the 29th edition of the International Conference on Research in Computational Molecular Biology, taking place from **April 26 - 29, 2025**, in **Seoul, Korea**, at the **Sinchon campus of Yonsei University**.

The conference aims to bridge the computational, mathematical, statistical, and biological sciences, bringing together researchers, professionals, students, and industrial practitioners.

## Topics of Interest

Papers reporting on original research (both theoretical and applied) in all areas of computational molecular biology are suitable for submission. Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Molecular sequence analysis
*   Sequencing and genotyping technologies
*   Gene regulation and epigenomics
*   Transcriptomics
*   Single-cell omics
*   Metagenomics and microbiome analysis
*   Population genetics and statistical genomics
*   Evolution and comparative genomics
*   Structure and function of non-coding RNAs
*   Computational proteomics and proteogenomics
*   Computational structural biology
*   Computational metabolomics
*   Protein structure and function
*   Biological networks and network biology
*   Computational systems biology
*   Multimodal data integration in biological research
*   Computational approaches to understanding human disease
*   Data privacy and security in biomedical research
*   Bioimaging and molecular and cellular imaging analysis

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions should represent **original, previously unpublished work**.
*   Accepted abstracts will be published as a proceedings volume in the **Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics (LNBI) series from Springer-Verlag**.
*   Authors who prefer not to publish their papers in the LNBI proceedings must submit a final four-page extended abstract for inclusion in the Springer LNBI proceedings and must submit the full paper to the preprint servers **arxiv.org or bioRxiv.org** by the camera-ready deadline.

## Submission Deadlines

*   **Abstract/paper registration deadline:** October 16, 2024, 11:59 PM AoE
*   **Full paper submission deadline:** October 25, 2024, 11:59 PM AoE

*Note: Abstract registration is mandatory and must align closely with the full paper submission in terms of title, author list, and abstract content. "Placeholder" abstract registrations will not be accepted.* 

## Paper Submission

Please submit your papers through EasyChair at [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=recomb2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=recomb2025).

## Formatting Instructions

*   **Main paper format:** PDF format. Maximum length is **10 Letter pages**, including figures/tables and captions, using a minimum font size of 10pt and 1-inch margins. An additional title page with title, author list, and abstract is permitted. The bibliography does not count toward the page limit.
*   Authors are encouraged to use the [Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science template](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/book-authors-editors/lncs-ebooks).
*   **Optional Appendix:** Can be submitted as Supplementary Material in a single PDF file. No page limit for the Appendix, but reviewing is at the discretion of the reviewers.
*   **Source code availability:** If the paper involves new software or analysis methods, the source code should be made publicly accessible via a GitHub repository and the link must be clearly indicated in the paper.

## Journal Publication

Selected accepted papers will be invited to submit a revised version for a special issue in partnering journals: **Cell Systems**, **Genome Research**, and the **Journal of Computational Biology**. These journals will require some expansion of the RE আমন্ত্রণ paper.

## Contact Information

For questions related to submissions, please email Sriram Sankararaman, Program Committee Chair of RECOMB 2025, at [sriram@cs.ucla.edu](mailto:sriram@cs.ucla.edu).

For general inquiries, email organizers at [recomb2025@gmail.com](mailto:recomb2025@gmail.com).

The **IEEE International Requirements Engineering Conference (RE)** is the premier requirements engineering conference, where researchers, practitioners, students, and educators meet, present, and discuss the most recent innovations, trends, experiences, and issues in the field of requirements engineering.

The **33rd edition of RE (RE’25)** will be hosted in **Valencia, Spain**, from **September 1-5, 2025**.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: RTSS 2025

The IEEE Real-Time Systems Symposium (RTSS) is the premier conference in the field of real-time systems, where researchers and practitioners showcase innovations covering all aspects of real-time systems, including theory, design, analysis, implementation, verification, evaluation, and experience.

## Scope of the Conference

RTSS’25, the 46th edition of the event, continues the tradition of embracing new and emerging areas of real-time systems research. It is an expansive and inclusive event.

## Tracks

RTSS’25 welcomes submissions of high-quality, original research papers related to both real-time systems theory and practice. Manuscripts may be submitted to either of the following tracks:

### Track 1: Real-Time Systems and Foundations

This track focuses on the practical and theoretical foundations that enable predictable timing in computing systems. This includes core real-time operating systems components, schedulability analysis, scheduling algorithms, theoretical foundations, and verification methods. Topics of interest also cover timing analysis (e.g., WCET analysis), real-time and time-sensitive networking, timing-predictable hardware architectures, modeling and analysis of stochastic real-time systems, fault tolerance, security in relation to timing guarantees, compiler techniques, system synthesis, model-driven engineering, and applied formal methods.

**Artificial Intelligence for Real-Time Systems Foundations:** RTSS invites contributions on the use of AI and machine learning techniques to advance real-time scheduling, timing analysis, resource management, and system optimization under timing constraints.

### Track 2: Design and Applications

This track focuses on real-time systems in a broader systems context, emphasizing novel research on designs, implementations, and applications where real-time requirements are integral. It explores how tools and techniques are adapted and applied to specific application domains.

*   **Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS):** Applications in transportation, healthcare, industrial control, etc., that interact closely with the physical world. Topics include enabling technologies, application-specific solutions, design methodologies, tool chains, CPS architectures, secure CPS, performance analysis, robustness, safety, certification, and hardware/software co-design.
*   **Real-Time System Design for Artificial Intelligence:** Practical implementation of AI components in latency-sensitive and resource-constrained environments. Focuses on designing real-time systems to deploy AI under real-time constraints, including system design, frameworks, resource management, hardware acceleration, and AI safety in CPS.
*   **HW-SW Integration and System-Level Design:** Design methodologies and tools for hardware/software integration and co-design in embedded systems. Topics include architecture description languages, hardware architectures, design space exploration, synthesis, optimization, SoC design, FPGA-based simulation, emerging trends like RISC-V, and AI/ML hardware accelerators.
*   **Internet of Things (IoT):** Addressing challenges in IoT with resource constraints, scalability demands, and dynamic environments. Topics include real-time capabilities in IoT, distributed sensing and control, low-latency processing, edge computing, fog computing, and AI-at-the-edge. Emerging areas like 5G/6G for URLLC and in-network computing are also of interest.

## Timing Requirements

To be in scope, ALL submissions must explicitly address some form of real-time requirements / constraints (e.g., deadlines, response-time bounds, tail latencies, statistical notions of timeliness). Submissions must provide a compelling justification if timing-predicability requirements necessitate a nontrivial resource allocation, programming, scheduling, or design approach.

## Surveys and User Studies

Empirical survey-based research focused on the real-time systems field, using surveys, questionnaires, interviews, use-cases, or other empirical techniques, is also welcome. Literature surveys that solely classify, review, and summarize existing research papers are not in scope.

## Proceedings and Awards

All accepted papers will appear in the main program and proceedings if presented at the conference. Outstanding papers will be recognized. Best paper, best student paper (first author is a student), and best presentation awards will be presented.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline (firm):** May 22, 2025 (anywhere on Earth)
*   **Author Response Period:** July 14-17, 2025
*   **Author Notification:** July 25, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** September 16, 2025 (tentative)
*   **Conference:** December 2–5, 2025

## Paper Submission

*   Authors are invited to submit supplemental research artifacts such as source code, mechanized proofs, data sets, formal models, short demo videos, etc., alongside their manuscripts via the HotCRP system. Artifacts should ideally contain a README with relevant information.
*   The conference site [rtss25.hotcrp.com](https://rtss25.hotcrp.com) accepts submissions.
*   Please refer to the [paper submission guidelines](https://2025.rtss.org/paper-submission/) for further details.

## Remote Participation

RTSS’25 is primarily an in-person conference. However, exceptions for authors unable to attend in person due to valid reasons may be made on a case-by-case basis at the discretion of the Program Chair. Authors facing potential travel complications should contact the Program Chair prior to paper submission. At least one author must register at the “in-person” rate.

summary: The 44th International Conference on Computer Safety, Reliability and Security (SafeComp 2025) will be held in Stockholm, Sweden, from September 9-12, 2025, hosted by KTH Royal Institute of Technology. The conference theme is "Managing safety in an era of a software defined computing continuum" and it focuses on exploring and debating challenges in safety-critical computing systems, covering state-of-the-art, industrial experiences, and new trends in safety, security, and reliability. SafeComp is a single-track conference designed to facilitate easy networking.
callForPapers:
# SafeComp 2025: Call for Papers

The 44th International Conference on Computer Safety, Reliability and Security (SafeComp 2025) will be held from **September 9–12, 2025**, in **Stockholm, Sweden**, hosted by KTH Royal Institute of Technology.

## Conference Theme

**Managing safety in an era of a software defined computing continuum.** Future societal and industrial systems will increasingly rely on a digitalized infrastructure, from embedded systems to cloud and edge computing. The theme highlights the need for dependability properties in these increasingly software-defined and upgradeable systems, focusing on challenges such as:

*   Predictability and reliability of cloud, edge computing, and AI components.
*   Architectures ensuring safety while enhancing performance.
*   Co-design of applications and digital infrastructure for cost-efficient dependability.
*   Trustworthy DevOps – reconciling software and safety practices.

## Submission Types and Guidelines

SafeComp acts as a platform for bringing academic research and industrial needs together. Industrial contributions and real-world experience reports are explicitly invited.

### Regular Papers

*   **Content:** Address a research gap and illustrate how the contribution can help improve the state-of-the-art, or provide new insights and valuable support to practitioners through practical experience reports/tool descriptions.
*   **Length:** Up to 14 pages (including bibliography).
*   **Review:** Papers will be reviewed by at least three members of the International Programme Committee.
*   **Originality:** Papers must not have been previously published or concurrently submitted elsewhere.
*   **Formatting:** Must be formatted according to the [LNCS templates](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/preface-and-conference-proceedings). Abstracts and papers should be submitted in pdf through [Easychair](https://easychair.org/cfp/safecomp2025).

### Workshop Papers

*   **Content:** Papers for workshops are welcome.
*   **Submission:** Workshops will take place the day preceding the conference. Accepted contributions will be included in the SAFECOMP Workshop Proceedings, provided publisher requirements are fulfilled.

### Position Paper Track

*   **Content:** Submissions for a dedicated position paper track are accepted.

## Important Dates

All times Anywhere on Earth (AoE):

*   **Regular Papers:**
    *   Submission (passed): **February 24, 2025**
    *   Author notification (passed): **April 12, 2025**
    *   Camera ready submission (passed): **June 9, 2025**
*   **Workshop Papers:**
    *   Full paper submission: **May 5, 2025**
    *   Notification of acceptance: **May 19, 2025**
    *   Camera-ready submission: **June 10, 2025**
*   **Position Paper Track:**
    *   Position paper submission: **July 9, 2025**
    *   Author notification: **July 11, 2025**
*   **Registration:**
    *   Early bird deadline: **July 14, 2025**
*   **Conference & Workshops:**
    *   Workshops: **September 9, 2025**
    *   Main Conference: **September 10-12, 2025**

## List of Topics

The conference covers all aspects related to the development, assessment, operation, and maintenance of safety-related and safety-critical computer systems. Major topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Distributed and real-time monitoring and control
*   Fault-tolerant and resilient hardware and software architectures
*   Fault detection and recovery mechanisms
*   Security and privacy protection mechanisms for safety applications
*   Safety guidelines and standards
*   Safety/security co-engineering and tradeoffs
*   Safety and security qualification, quantification, assurance and certification
*   Threat and vulnerability analysis
*   Risk assessment in safe and secure systems
*   Dependability analysis using simulation and experimental measurement
*   Model-based analysis, design, and assessment
*   Formal methods for verification, validation, and fault tolerance
*   Testing, verification, and validation methodologies and tools
*   Multi-concern dependability assurance and standardization

Domains of application include (but are not limited to):

*   Railways, automotive, space, avionics & process industries
*   Highly automated and autonomous systems
*   Telecommunication and networks
*   Safety-related applications of smart systems and IoT
*   Critical infrastructures, smart grids, SCADA
*   Medical devices and healthcare
*   Surveillance, defense, emergency & rescue
*   Logistics, industrial automation, off-shore technology
*   Education & training

## Publication

All accepted research papers, practical experience reports, and tool descriptions will be published by Springer in the LNCS series (Lecture Notes on Computer Science) in the SafeComp and the SafeComp Workshop volumes.

## Venue

The conference will be held at **KTH Royal Institute of Technology**, located in the northern part of Stockholm city center, Sweden.

## Contact

*   For submissions: [safecomp2025@easychair.org](mailto:safecomp2025@easychair.org)
*   Conference Secretariat (Meetx): [safecomp2025@meetx.se](mailto:safecomp2025@meetx.se), Tel: +46 31 708 86 90

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: Symposium on Usable Security and Privacy (USEC) 2025

The Symposium on Usable Security and Privacy (USEC) 2025 invites submissions on all aspects of human factors and usability in the context of security and privacy.

USEC '25 aims to bring together researchers already engaged in this interdisciplinary effort with other researchers in relevant areas, encouraging economics, HCI, AI, theoretical computer science, cryptography, psychology, and business studies researchers and practitioners to submit original research. Collaborative research from authors in multiple fields is particularly encouraged.

## Submission Tracks

USEC '25 will feature the following tracks:

*   **Research Track:** For mature, completed work. Papers must not be more than **12 pages** in length (excluding bibliography and appendices). Longer papers should scale length according to contributions.
*   **Meta-Science Track:** For mature work focused on research practices, replicability, and systematization of knowledge. Papers must not exceed **12 pages** (excluding bibliography and appendices). Supplementary appendices are encouraged.
*   **Vision Track:** For work in progress or concrete ideas for future work. Papers must be up to **5 pages** in length (excluding bibliography and appendices).

## Submission Guidelines

*   All submissions must be original work and clearly document any overlap with previously published or simultaneously submitted papers.
*   Papers must be written in English.
*   **Font:** Times, 10-point or larger, with 11-point or larger line spacing.
*   **Templates:** Use the [templates for NDSS Symposium and co-located events](https://www.ndss-symposium.org/ndss2025/submissions/templates/).
*   **Submission Portal:** [https://usec25.hotcrp.com/](https://usec25.hotcrp.com/)
*   **Reviewing:** Double-blind. Author names and affiliations should not appear in the paper. Reasonable effort must be made to ensure anonymity in text, figures, photos, links, etc. Prior work should preferably be referred to in the third person or blinded.
*   Author names cannot be changed after acceptance without Program Chairs' approval.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper must attend USEC 2025 and present their paper.

## Areas of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Innovative security or privacy functionality and design
*   New applications of existing models or technology
*   Usability evaluations of new or existing security or privacy features and lessons learned
*   Security testing of new or existing usability features
*   Psychological, sociological, and economic aspects of security and privacy
*   Research and design methodologies for human-centric security and privacy research
*   Reports of replicating previously published studies and experiments
*   Reports of failed usable privacy/security studies or experiments, with the focus on the lessons learned
*   Systematization of Knowledge (SoK)
*   Inclusive security and privacy
*   Ethics in human-centric security and privacy research
*   Workforce, labels, cyber-physical systems
*   Usability in smart manufacturing

*All submissions must clearly relate to the human aspects of security or privacy.* Papers on security or privacy without addressing usability/human factors, or on usability/human factors without addressing security/privacy, will not be considered.

## Awards

*   **Test of Time Award:** Celebrates research demonstrating enduring relevance and influence in usable security and privacy.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline:** **25 November 2024**, 11:59 pm, Anywhere-on-earth (AOE)
*   **Reviews Due:** 16 December 2024
*   **Discussion Period:** 16-19 December 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **20 December 2024**
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** **28 January 2025**
*   **Workshop Date:** **24 February 2025**

## Sponsorship

We sincerely acknowledge the generous support of **Indiana University Bloomington – Security and Privacy in Informatics, Computing, and Engineering (SPICE)** for sponsoring the awards and certificates.

callForPapers:
# UIST 2025: Call for Participation

The ACM Symposium on User Interface Software and Technology (UIST) is the premier forum for innovations in human-computer interfaces. Sponsored by ACM special interest groups on computer-human interaction (SIGCHI) and computer graphics (SIGGRAPH), UIST brings together people from diverse areas, including graphical & web user interfaces, tangible & ubiquitous computing, virtual & augmented reality, multimedia, new input & output devices, Human-Centered AI, and CSCW. The intimate size and intensive program make UIST an ideal opportunity to exchange research results and ideas.

## Deadlines

Note: all deadlines are at 11:59pm AoE unless otherwise specified.

*   **Papers (abstract):** Wednesday, April 2, 2025
*   **Papers (paper PDF):** Wednesday, April 9, 2025
*   **Papers (materials incl. Videos, Supplementary materials, Accessibility alt-text and video subtitles):** Friday, April 11, 2025
*   **Posters:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Demos:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Doctoral Symposium:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Workshops:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Visions:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Lasting Impact:** Monday, June 17, 2025
*   **Student Innovation Contest:** Friday, July 18, 2025

## Papers

Papers are the main medium for conveying new research results at UIST and must describe original, unpublished work.

*   **Abstract due (incl. title, abstract, author list):** Wednesday, April 2, 2025
*   **Papers due (Paper PDF):** Wednesday, April 9, 2025
*   **Materials due (incl. videos, supplementary materials, accessibility alt-text and video subtitles):** Friday, April 11, 2025

### Submission Formatting Guidelines

*   We strongly recommend submitting papers in the 2-column format, but will accept papers for review as either 1- or 2-column paper format if you are authoring in Word.
*   Your submission must be original. UIST only accepts original submissions.
*   Authors should avoid generating content using AI-agents (e.g., LLMs such as ChatGPT or similar), but the usage of these tools is allowed for editing and checking the author’s own text.
*   Revised Papers from Prior Submissions: Authors of previously rejected papers are encouraged to upload the prior version of the paper, corresponding reviews, and summary of changes.

### Submission Information

*   **Submission Platform:** All required materials must be submitted electronically to PCS.
*   **Submission Format and Length:**
    *   We will adopt the ACM TAPS Workflow.
    *   LaTeX authors: submissions are strongly recommended to be in the double-column format using `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}`.
    *   Word authors: submissions should be made using either the double-column or single-column template.
    *   UIST papers are of variable length. Short Papers: 5,000 words or less. Standard Length Papers: 5,000 to 12,000 words. References and appendices are excluded from the word count.
    *   Size: < 20 MB (compressed PDF files are encouraged).
*   **Accompanying Video:** Optional, but highly encouraged. Resolution 1080p or 4k, MP4, H.264 codec, no more than 5 minutes, < 250 MB. Subtitles are required.
*   **Anonymity:** Anonymous, i.e., authors must remove their names and affiliations throughout all submission materials.
*   **Selection Process:** Refereed (program committee and two external reviewers).
*   **Publication:** Archival, published in the ACM Digital Library.

## Posters

Posters provide an interactive forum for presenting work to conference attendees during special poster sessions.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Wednesday, August 1, 2025
*   **Camera-ready versions due:** Wednesday, August 8, 2025
*   **Video preview due (optional):** Wednesday, August 8, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Submission Platform:** All materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:**
    *   Poster's Extended Abstract: Not to exceed 2 pages (excluding references).
    *   ACM TAPS Workflow will be adopted.
    *   LaTeX authors: double-column format is required.
    *   Word authors: double-column format is required.
*   **Accompanying Poster:** Recommended physical size is A0 or less.
*   **Accompanying Video:** Optional, highly encouraged.
*   **Anonymity:** IMPORTANT: Anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Reviewed, less rigorous than paper review, no rebuttal phase.
*   **Publication:** Semi-archival, included in ACM Digital Library as adjunct proceedings.

## Demos

Demos showcase implementations of novel and compelling interaction concepts, techniques, devices, and systems.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Friday, August 1, 2025
*   **Camera-ready versions due:** Friday, August 8, 2025
*   **Video preview due:** Friday, August 8, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Submission Platform:** All materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:**
    *   Demo Abstract: Recommend ~1,500-2,000 words. PDF document describing setup and interaction.
    *   ACM TAPS Workflow will be adopted.
    *   LaTeX authors: double-column format is recommended.
    *   Word authors: double-column or single-column template.
*   **Demo Video:** Should be a standalone demonstration of the work, up to 5 min, includes subtitles.
*   **Anonymity:** Demo submissions are not anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Juried by demo chairs; no feedback or rebuttal phase.
*   **Publication:** Non-archival. Demo abstracts may be included in ACM Digital Library as Adjunct Proceedings.

## Doctoral Symposium

The UIST Doctoral Symposium provides an opportunity for Ph.D. students to interact with researchers and receive feedback on their research.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Friday, August 1, 2025
*   **Camera-ready versions due:** Friday, August 8, 2025
*   **Doctoral Symposium date:** Sunday, September 28, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Eligibility:** Current Ph.D. students, ideally entering third year or later.
*   **Submission Platform:** All submission materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:** Maximum of 4 pages + references in 2-column format.
*   **Anonymity:** Not anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Juried based on anticipated contributions to intellectual discussions.
*   **Publication:** Non-archival. Abstracts included in ACM digital library as adjunct proceedings.

## Workshops

Workshops provide an interactive forum to discuss designated areas of interest.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Friday, August 1, 2025
*   **Workshop description camera-ready version due (optional):** Friday, August 8, 2025
*   **Workshop date:** Sunday, September 28, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Submission Platform:** All materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:** Extended Abstract, not exceeding 2 pages (excluding references). Double-column ACM paper template.
*   **Anonymity:** Not anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Juried.
*   **Publication:** Optional inclusion in ACM Digital Library as adjunct proceedings.

## Visions

UIST Visions is a venue for forward-thinking ideas to inspire the community and project the UIST community as thought leaders.

*   **Submission deadline:** Friday, July 11, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** Friday, August 8th, 2025

### Submission Information

*   **Eligibility:** Single Author.
*   **Submission Platform:** All submission materials must be submitted electronically to PCS 2.0.
*   **Submission Format and Length:** Up to 1000 words (excluding references), roughly 1 page.
*   **Anonymity:** Not anonymous.
*   **Selection Process:** Curated by Vision Chairs; up to two speakers selected.
*   **Publication:** Non-archival. Abstracts included in ACM digital library as adjunct proceedings.

## Lasting Impact

Recognizes UIST papers that have had a long-lasting influence on the field.

*   **Award nomination deadline:** Monday, June 17, 2025, 11:59 PM AoE

### Nomination Process

Send an email to lastingimpact2025@uist.org with nominator details, nominated paper reference, a one-sentence description of impact, and a nomination letter.

callForPapers:
# USENIX ATC '25 Call for Papers

The 2025 USENIX Annual Technical Conference (ATC '25) will be held from **July 7–9, 2025**, at the **Sheraton Boston in Boston, MA, USA**. It is co-located with the **19th USENIX Symposium on Operating Systems Design and Implementation (OSDI '25)**.

## Overview

The USENIX ATC '25 seeks original, high-quality submissions that improve and further the knowledge of computing systems, with an emphasis on implementations and experimental results. Submissions are welcome for systems of all scales, from embedded mobile devices to data centers and clouds. The scope covers all practical aspects related to computer systems, including operating systems, runtime systems, parallel and distributed systems, storage, networking, security and privacy, virtualization, software-hardware interactions, performance evaluation, reliability, energy management, and bug-finding.

USENIX ATC '25 particularly encourages new ideas and approaches, and values submissions accompanied by clearly defined artifacts (traces, data, source code, tools) not previously available.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions must contain original unpublished material that is not under review at any other forum.
*   Papers will be judged on relevance, novelty, technical merit, correctness, and clarity. Flawed ideas or designs may lead to rejection.
*   **USENIX ATC '25 will employ double-blind reviewing.** Papers that are not properly anonymized may be rejected without review.
*   Papers need to be registered, and their abstracts submitted by the abstract registration deadline. Papers with an empty abstract will be rejected.
*   An optional artifact evaluation process will be available for accepted papers.

## Submission Type: Full vs. Short

*   **Full submissions:** Must not exceed **12 pages** (excluding references and appendices).
*   **Short submissions:** Must not exceed **6 pages** (excluding references and appendices).
*   Both types are reviewed to the same standards and differ primarily in scope. Short papers present a complete idea that is properly evaluated.
*   Optionally, authors can include an appendix for material not central to the contributions (e.g., algorithm details, proofs, code snippets).
*   For further details, see the [submission instructions](https://www.usenix.org/conference/atc25/submission-instructions).

## Deployed Systems Track

USENIX ATC '25 solicits papers describing the design, implementation, analysis, and experience with real-world deployment of systems and networks. These papers need not present new ideas but should convey practical insights. Note that submission and anonymization rules differ for this track.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract registrations due:** Tuesday, January 7, 2025, 11:59 pm UTC
*   **Submissions due:** Tuesday, January 14, 2025, 11:59 pm UTC
*   **Authors' response period:** Monday, April 7–Wednesday, April 9, 2025, 11:59 pm UTC
*   **Notification to authors:** Friday, April 25, 2025
*   **Final papers due:** Tuesday, June 3, 2025

## On the Use of Generative AI

Authors must not submit papers containing sections generated entirely by generative AI. Authors must submit a statement attesting that their paper does not include sections completely created by generative AI as part of the submission process in HotCRP.

## Contact Information

Please direct any questions to the program co-chairs at [atc25chairs@usenix.org](mailto:atc25chairs@usenix.org) or to the USENIX office at [submissionspolicy@usenix.org](mailto:submissionspolicy@usenix.org).

## Conference Organizers

*   **Program Co-Chairs:**
    *   Deniz Altınbüken, Google

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: The 22nd IEEE International Conference on Ubiquitous Intelligence and Computing (UIC 2025)

The **22nd IEEE International Conference on Ubiquitous Intelligence and Computing (UIC 2025)** will be held as a **hybrid event** in **Calgary, Alberta, Canada**, from **August 18 - 22, 2025**.

Ubiquitous intelligence, distributed throughout the physical environment, is paving the way towards a smart world, enabling new breeds of applications and systems by enhancing everyday objects with intelligence. UIC 2025 aims to foster advancements in this domain, creating more efficient, simplified, and enjoyable experiences.

## Keynotes

*   Giancarlo Fortino
*   Runhe Huang
*   Chunsheng Yang

## Tutorials

*   **Call for Tutorials**
*   Intelligent Network Management for Next-Generation Networks
*   Knowledge Graph Computation in the Era of Gen AI
*   The Practice of Using Language Models
*   Towards Resilient and Ultrasafe Energy Systems for the Next-Gen Smart Grid

## Tracks and Topics

We welcome high-quality papers that describe original and unpublished research advancing the state of the art in ubiquitous intelligence and computing. Topics include, but are not limited to:

### Track 1: Intelligent/Smart Object & Interaction

*   AutoID technologies such as RFID/iBeacon
*   Embedded Chips, Sensors, and Actuators
*   MEMS, NEMS, Micro, and Biometric Devices
*   Printed Electronics and Pasted Circuits
*   Wearable Devices & Embodied Interaction
*   Materials, Textiles, Fabrics, Furniture, etc.
*   Embedded Software and Agents
*   Interaction to Smart Objects and Devices

### Track 2: Smart Environment Application

*   Intelligent Traffic and Transportation
*   Intelligent Energy Consumption
*   Intelligent Environmental Protection
*   Smart Healthcare and Active Assisted Living
*   Smart Education and Learning
*   Pervasive Games and Entertainment
*   Smart Public Safety and Security
*   Virtual Personal Assistants, Cognitive Experts

### Track 3: Intelligent/Smart Systems & Services

*   Sensor, Ad Hoc, and P2P Networks
*   Wearable, Personal, and Body Area Systems
*   Smart Systems Programming Models
*   Intelligent Services and Architectures
*   Cognitive computing in ubiquitous systems
*   Human Activity Recognition
*   Adaptive, Autonomic & Context-aware Systems
*   Autonomous Cars, Assistive Driving
*   Big Data in Ubiquitous Systems
*   Nature-inspired Intelligent Systems
*   Knowledge Representation and Reasoning

### Track 4: Personalization and Social Aspects

*   Social Computing and Crowd Computing
*   Mobile Crowd Sensing and Sourcing
*   Affect/Emotion/Personality Computing
*   Location-Based Social Networks
*   Human Mobility Modeling and Mining
*   Human Centered Computing
*   Context-aware Computing
*   Recommendation Systems for Ubiquitous Computing
*   Human-centric Design & Sensing
*   Socially Community-aware Systems
*   Security, Privacy, Safety, and Ethical Issues

## Submission Guidelines

*   All papers need to be submitted electronically through the conference submission website (EDAS) in **PDF format**.
*   Regular full papers are limited to **8 pages** (or 10 pages with over-length charge).
*   Full papers including figures and references must use the **IEEE Computer Society Proceedings manuscripts style**.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register and present their work at the conference; otherwise, the paper will not be included in the proceedings.

**Submission Link:** [https://edas.info/N33589](https://edas.info/N33589)

## Paper Publication

*   Papers accepted by IEEE UIC 2025 conference will be published by the **IEEE Computer Society Press**.
*   All accepted papers will be submitted to **IEEE Xplore and EI**.
*   Distinguished papers presented at the conference, after further revision, will be invited for submission to a special issue.

## Final Paper Submission

Important: Final paper and copyright submissions must be made through **IEEE CPS (Conference Publishing Services)**, NOT EDAS!

**Submission Link:** [https://ieeecps.org/cps/v2/auth/login?ak=1&pid=2FBloH8EZnpjmoosiBNJHK](https://ieeecps.org/cps/v2/auth/login?ak=1&pid=2FBloH8EZnpjmoosiBNJHK)

View Final Submission Instructions: [https://ieeecps.org/cps/v2/auth/login?ak=1&pid=2FBloH8EZnpjmoosiBNJHK](https://ieeecps.org/cps/v2/auth/login?ak=1&pid=2FBloH8EZnpjmoosiBNJHK)

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** April 14, 2025 (extended to May 1, 2025)
*   **Authors Notification:** June 10, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Submission:** June 30, 2025
*   **Registration:** June 30, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** August 18 - 22, 2025

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE VIS 2025

IEEE VIS 2025 solicits novel research contributions and innovative applications in all areas of visualization and visual analytics. The conference convenes an international community of researchers and practitioners from universities, government, and industry to exchange recent findings on the design and use of visualization tools.

## Areas of Focus

*   **Area 1: Theoretical & Empirical:** Theoretical and empirical research topics that aim to define the foundation of VIS as a scientific subject.
*   **Area 2: Applications:** All forms of application-focused research.
*   **Area 3: Systems & Rendering:** Building systems, algorithms for rendering, and alternate input and output modalities.
*   **Area 4: Representations & Interaction:** The design of visual representations and interaction techniques for different types of data, users, and visualization tasks.
*   **Area 5: Data Transformations:** Algorithms and techniques that transform data from one form to another to enable effective and efficient visual mapping as required by the intended visual representations.
*   **Area 6: Analytics & Decisions:** Design and optimization of integrated workflows for visual data analysis, knowledge discovery, decision support, machine learning, and other data intelligence tasks.

## Submission Types

*   Papers
*   Short Papers
*   Posters
*   Tutorials
*   Workshops
*   Panels
*   Doctoral Colloquium

## Important Dates

All deadlines are at 11:59pm (23:59) AoE Anywhere on Earth (AoE).

*   **Abstract submission (MANDATORY):** March 21, 2025
*   **Paper submission:** March 31, 2025
*   **Notification of results of first review cycle:** June 6, 2025
*   **Paper submission for second review cycle:** July 1, 2025
*   **Final notification:** July 15, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copy:** August 8, 2025

## Submission Guidelines and Reviewing Criteria

Submissions will be judged on their scientific quality and novelty, potential impact, degree to which the evidence supports the findings, appropriateness of methodology, and the research process followed. After the initial notification of review results, selected papers are only conditionally accepted and will undergo a full revision and review cycle; only papers that improve according to the required changes will be accepted after the second round review.

Please carefully read and adhere to the [paper submission guidelines](https://ieeevis.org/year/2025/info/call-participation/paper-submission-guidelines).

Reviewers should be familiar with the [guidelines for reviewing papers for VIS](https://ieeevis.org/year/2025/info/call-participation/review-instructions).

## Accessibility

We highly recommend screen reader accessible final submissions. Please see the [VIS Accessibility Guide](https://ieeevis.org/year/2025/info/call-participation/make-pdf-accessible) to learn how you can make your contribution accessible.

## Open Access Policy

Authors are encouraged to share their accepted paper in an open-access repository in accordance with IEEE copyright regulations. Please see the [VIS Open Practices Guidelines](https://ieeevis.org/year/2025/info/open-practices/open-practices).

## Publication Venue

Full papers accepted to IEEE VIS will appear in a special issue of the **IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics (TVCG)** and will be indexed in **IEEE Xplore**.

callForPapers:
# UMAP 2025: Call for Full and Short Papers

We invite prospective authors to submit contributions to the 33rd ACM International Conference on User Modeling, Adaptation and Personalization (UMAP 2025). UMAP 2025 is the premier international conference bringing together research in AI and HCI to support effective human-AI collaboration via interactive systems that can model, adapt and personalize to their users.

The conference is sponsored by ACM SIGCHI and SIGWEB. The main conference proceedings, published by ACM, will be part of the ACM Digital Library.

## Theme

The theme of ACM UMAP 2025 is **“Shaping Personalization and FATE (Fairness, Accountability, Transparency, and Ethics) in Human-Centered Generative AI”**.

ACM UMAP 2025 will bring together researchers, practitioners, and policymakers to discuss the latest developments in human-centered approaches to design and use AI systems that adapt to human needs while ensuring user control, fairness, accountability, transparency, inclusivity, and sustainability.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission:** January 23, 2025
*   **Paper submission:** January 30, 2025
*   **Rebuttal phase:** March 3-7, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** March 26, 2025
*   **Camera-ready papers:** April 7, 2025
*   **Registration deadline for authors:** April 7, 2025
*   **Conference:** June 16-19, 2025

*Note: The submission deadline is at 11:59 pm AoE (Anywhere on Earth) time.* For special tracks, please consult the respective calls.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Recommender systems
*   Data mining techniques for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Generative AI techniques for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Large Language Models and Natural Language Processing methods for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Knowledge graphs, Linked Data, and semantics for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Intelligent user interfaces
*   Intelligent and personalized e-learning applications and educational games
*   Personalized behavior change and persuasive applications
*   Modeling and adapting to human affective states
*   Virtual assistants, conversational agents, personalization in augmented reality
*   Group modeling and collaborative team formation
*   Ethical issues of personalization and human-centered AI systems: Privacy, Fairness, Accountability, Transparency
*   Creativity in User Modeling, Adaptation, and Personalization
*   Sustainability-aware methods and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Personalized approaches for preventing eco-chambers, user manipulation, and disinformation
*   Research methods and reproducibility

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Language:** All submissions must be written in English.
*   **Format:** PDF format.
*   **Submission System:** Submit electronically through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=umap2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=umap2025), selecting the “UMAP25 Full and Short Papers” track.
*   **Contribution Types:**
    *   **Long papers:** Up to 8 pages (plus additional pages for references; all content counts toward the page limit). Should report substantial contributions of lasting value.
    *   **Short papers:** Up to 4 pages (plus additional pages for references; all content counts toward the page limit). Typically discuss exciting new work that is not yet mature enough for a long paper.
*   **Supplementary Material:** Recommend linking to an external source using an anonymized link.
*   **Anonymity:** Submissions must be anonymous due to the double-blind review process. Omit names, affiliations, and identifying statements. Cite prior work in the third person. Failure to anonymize may result in desk rejection. Anonymous repositories like [https://anonymous.4open.science](https://anonymous.4open.science) can be used for code/materials.
*   **Templates:**
    *   **LaTeX:** Use the latest version of the Primary Article Template – LaTeX. Start with `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}` for double-column output. Follow ACM's LaTeX best practices guide. Do not use the "manuscript" option.
    *   **Overleaf:** Use `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}` for double-column. Follow ACM's instructions for preparing articles with Overleaf.
    *   **Word:** Use the double-column Word template. Follow ACM's instructions for preparing articles with Microsoft Word.

## Accessibility

Authors are strongly encouraged to provide "alt text" for floats (images, tables, etc.) and follow ACM Accessibility Recommendations for Publishing in Color and SIG ACCESS guidelines.

## Submission Policy

*   ACM UMAP has a no dual submission policy. Submitted manuscripts should not be under review at another publication venue.
*   Authors must comply with all ACM Publications Policies, including those on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects.
*   Authors are required to obtain an ORCID ID.

## Review Process

*   **Review:** ACM UMAP uses a **double-blind review process**. Submissions must be anonymous.
*   Reviewers evaluate papers based on significance, originality, rigor, and contribution.
*   Papers out of scope, incomplete, or lacking sufficient evidence may be rejected without full review.
*   A rebuttal stage will be available for authors to optionally discuss the initial decision.
*   The ACM Code of Ethics will be considered; papers perpetuating harmful stereotypes or employing unethical research practices may be rejected.

## Registration and Presentation Policy

*   Each accepted paper must be accompanied by a **distinct full author registration** by the early registration date.
*   Each accepted paper **must be presented in person** to be included in the conference proceedings and the ACM Digital Library.

## Camera-ready Submission

*   Instructions for preparing camera-ready versions will be provided after acceptance.
*   LaTeX/Overleaf is strongly recommended for minimal reformatting.
*   Camera-ready versions will be submitted using ACM’s new production platform.

## Ethical & Human Subjects Considerations

*   Papers should discuss ethical considerations and the impact of the work.
*   Authors must comply with ethical standards and regulatory guidelines for human subjects research.
*   Papers reporting on human subjects research must include a statement identifying regulatory review approval or explaining the lack thereof.

## Program Chairs

*   Cataldo Musto, University of Bari Aldo Moro, Italy
*   Julita Vassileva, University of Saskatchewan, Canada

## Contact Information

*   Email: [umap2025-program@um.org](mailto:umap2025-program@um.org)

## Follow Us

*   [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/acm-umap-conf)
*   [X](https://x.com/UMAPconf)
*   [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/acmumap)
*   [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/umapconf.bsky.social)

callForPapers:
# VEHITS 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Vehicle Technology and Intelligent Transport Systems (VEHITS) 2026 is an event dedicated to bringing together engineers, researchers, and practitioners interested in the advances and applications in the field of Vehicle Technology and Intelligent Transport Systems.

VEHITS 2026 will be held from **May 18 to May 20, 2026**, and is sponsored by INSTICC – Institute for Systems and Technologies of Information, Control and Communication.

## Scope

This conference focuses on innovative applications, tools, and platforms across all technology areas related to vehicles and intelligent transportation systems. Papers describing advanced prototypes, systems, tools, techniques, and survey papers indicating future directions are encouraged. Both full research reports and work-in-progress reports are welcome.

## Conference Areas

1.  **Connected Vehicles**
2.  **Data Analytics**
3.  **Intelligent Transport Systems and Infrastructure**
4.  **Intelligent Vehicle Technologies**
5.  **Smart Mobility and Sustainable Transport Services**

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a complete paper or an abstract. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings.

*   **Language:** English, carefully checked for correct grammar and spelling.
*   **Content:** Papers should indicate the nature of their technical/scientific contribution and their applicability.
*   **Anonymity:** To facilitate double-blind evaluation, authors must produce papers without any reference to authors' personal details, acknowledgments, or other identifying information.
*   **Originality:** Only original papers should be submitted. Submissions must not substantially overlap with work published elsewhere or simultaneously submitted.
*   **Submission Platform:** All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform PRIMORIS.
*   **Ethical Norms:** Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, available in the SCITEPRESS Digital Library, with an ISBN reference and DOI.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with Springer in a CCIS Series book (final approval pending).

## Important Dates

All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth"

### Regular Papers

*   **Paper Submission:** January 5, 2026
*   **Authors Notification:** March 3, 2026
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** March 17, 2026

### Position Papers / Regular Papers

*   **Paper Submission:** February 17, 2026
*   **Authors Notification:** March 24, 2026
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** April 6, 2026

### Workshops

*   **Workshop Proposal:** January 20, 2026

### Special Sessions

*   **Special Session Proposal:** January 20, 2026

### Tutorials

*   **Tutorial Proposal:** April 10, 2026

### Demos

*   **Demo Proposal:** April 10, 2026

### Panels

*   **Panel Proposal:** April 10, 2026

## Conference Chair

*   Karsten Berns, University of Kaiserslautern-Landau, Germany

## Program Co-Chairs

*   Jeroen Ploeg, Siemens Industry Software Netherlands B.V., Netherlands
*   Arnaud de La Fortelle, Heex Technologies, France

## Program Committee

(Members listed on the website)

callForPapers:
# VLDB 2025: Call for Contributions

The 51st International Conference on Very Large Data Bases (VLDB 2025) is seeking contributions for various tracks. The conference will be held in **London, United Kingdom, from September 1-5, 2025**.

## Tracks and Deadlines

### Research Track
*   **Submissions Open:** 20th of every month, starting March 2024
*   **Submissions Deadline:** 1st of every month, until March 2025
*   **Notifications:** 15th of the next month following the deadline
*   **Camera-Ready Submissions:** Proceedings chairs will contact authors with CR instructions by the 5th of the next month following acceptance notification.

### Industrial Track
*   **Submissions Deadline:** March 17, 2025
*   **Notifications:** May 17, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Submissions:** July 14, 2025

### PhD Workshop
*   **Submissions Deadline:** May 22, 2025
*   **Notifications:** June 30, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Submissions:** June 23, 2025
*   **Final Camera-Ready:** July 22, 2025

### Workshops
*   **Submissions Deadline:** January 17, 2025
*   **Notifications:** January 31, 2025

### Tutorials
*   **Submissions Deadline:** April 15, 2025
*   **Notifications:** May 30, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready:** July 1, 2025
*   **Slides Availability:** August 20, 2025

### Demonstrations
*   **Submissions Deadline:** March 30, 2025
*   **Notifications:** May 27, 2025

### Panels
*   **Submissions Deadline:** May 15, 2025 / May 30, 2025
*   **Notifications:** May 30, 2025 / June 15, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready:** June 31, 2025 / July 15, 2025

## About VLDB

VLDB is a premier annual international forum for data management, scalable data science, and database researchers, vendors, practitioners, application developers, and users. The conference covers a spectrum of research topics related to all aspects of data management, with a significant focus on systems issues.

## Key Areas of Interest

*   Data mining and analytics
*   Data privacy and security
*   Database engines
*   Database performance and manageability
*   Distributed database systems
*   Graph and network data
*   Information integration and data quality
*   Languages, machine learning, AI, and databases
*   Novel database architectures
*   Provenance and workflows
*   Specialized and domain-specific data management
*   Text and semi-structured data
*   User interfaces

## Submission Links

*   [Research Track](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-research-track)
*   [Industrial Track](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-industrial-track)
*   [PhD Workshop](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-phd-workshop)
*   [Workshops](https://vldb.org/2025/?2025-call-for-workshops)
*   [Tutorials](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-tutorials)
*   [Demonstrations](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-demonstrations)
*   [Panels](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-panels)

## Formatting and Submission Guidelines

Please refer to the official VLDB 2025 website for detailed formatting and submission guidelines: [https://vldb.org/2025/](https://vldb.org/2025/)

The conference brought together nearly 1200 participants, featuring a rich scientific program with over 600 publications, including papers, posters, research demonstrations, and XR art pieces.
