callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## IEEE VR 2025: The 32nd IEEE Conference on Virtual Reality and 3D User Interfaces

**Dates:** March 8-12, 2025
**Location:** Saint-Malo, France

### Overview

IEEE VR 2025 seeks original, high-quality papers in all areas related to virtual reality (VR), including augmented reality (AR), mixed reality (MR), and 3D user interfaces (3DUIs). There is a unified review process for both IEEE TVCG and conference-only papers, with possible outcomes including acceptance as an IEEE TVCG paper (with presentation at IEEE VR 2025), acceptance as an IEEE VR 2025 conference paper (with presentation), acceptance as an IEEE VR 2025 poster, or rejection.

### Inquiries

*   Contact: [program2025@ieeevr.org](mailto:program2025@ieeevr.org)

### Important Dates

*   Abstracts due: **September 11, 2024** (AoE)
*   Submissions due: **September 18, 2024** (AoE)
*   Initial notifications: **December 10, 2024** (AoE)
*   Revised submissions due: **January 6, 2025** (AoE)
*   Final notifications: **January 13, 2025** (AoE)
*   Camera-ready materials due: **January 20, 2025** (AoE)

### Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Platform:** Submissions will be accepted through Precision Conference Solutions at [https://new.precisionconference.com/vr25a](https://new.precisionconference.com/vr25a).
*   **Review Process:** IEEE VR 2025 uses a **DOUBLE-BLIND** review process. Failure to anonymize submissions will result in desk rejection.
*   **Contribution Categories:** Papers should cover one or more of the following: methodological, technical, applications, and systems.
    *   **Methodological papers:** Describe advances in theories and methods of AR/VR/MR and 3DUI.
    *   **Technical papers:** Describe advancements in algorithms or devices critical to AR/VR/MR and 3DUI development.
    *   **Application papers:** Explain how existing ideas were applied to solve a problem, including an evaluation of success.
    *   **System papers:** Indicate how techniques and technologies were integrated to produce an effective system and convey lessons learned.
*   **Evaluation:** Each paper must include an evaluation of its contributions (e.g., user studies, benchmarking).
*   **Submission Length:** Between 4 and 9 pages (excluding references), with an additional 2 pages for references. Supplementary materials and videos are encouraged.
*   **Formatting:** Papers must be formatted using the [IEEE Computer Society VGTC conference format](https://tc.computer.org/vgtc/publications/conference/).

### Topics

IEEE VR 2025 seeks contributions in VR/AR/MR and 3DUI including, but not limited to:

*   360° video
*   3D and volumetric display and projection technology
*   3D authoring
*   3D user interfaces
*   Accessibility of immersive interfaces
*   Audio interfaces and rendering
*   Collaborative interactions
*   Computer graphics techniques
*   Crowd simulation
*   Cybersickness
*   Diversity and gender issues
*   Embodied agents, virtual humans and (self-)avatars
*   Ethical issues
*   Evaluation methods
*   Haptic interfaces and rendering
*   Human factors and ergonomics
*   Immersive analytics and visualization
*   Immersive applications and games
*   Input devices
*   Locomotion and navigation
*   Mediated and diminished reality
*   Mobile, desktop or hybrid 3DUIs
*   Modeling and simulation
*   Multi-user and distributed systems
*   Multimodal capturing and reconstruction
*   Multimodal/cross-modal interaction and perception
*   Multisensory interfaces and rendering
*   Perception and cognition
*   Presence, body ownership, and agency
*   Redirection
*   Software architectures, toolkits, and engineering
*   Teleoperation and telepresence
*   Therapy and rehabilitation
*   Touch, tangible and gesture interfaces
*   Tracking
*   User experience and usability
*   XR technology infrastructure

### Review Process

The review process has two cycles:

*   **Review Cycle I (Submission to Initial notification):** Submissions are assigned to two IPC members. Early rejection for submissions violating guidelines or receiving low scores. Double-blind stage. Striving for at least three reviews per submission. Initial recommendations: Conditionally accept as IEEE TVCG paper, Conditionally accept as conference paper, Recommend as a two-page poster, or Reject.
*   **Review Cycle II (Initial notification to Final decision):** Revision of conditionally accepted papers reviewed by the coordinator for final recommendation.

### Additional Guidelines

*   **Abstract Submission:** Abstract must be uploaded seven days prior to the paper submission deadline.
*   **Ethics and Responsibility:** All research experiments with human participants must follow institutional ethical guidelines and secure ethics committee approval. Approval details must be reported in the submission system.
*   **Participant Diversity:** Research with human participants should strive for participant diversity and report demographics. Submissions making general claims with imbalanced participant groups may be negatively impacted.
*   **Review Duties for Authors:** One author per submitted paper must register to review up to three papers through PCS.
*   **Presentation at the Conference:** All accepted submissions must be presented orally at the conference. In-person presentation is expected; online presentations are accommodated only in exceptional cases.
*   **Submission Language:** All submissions must be in English.
*   **Previous Publication and Plagiarism:** Submitted manuscripts must not have been previously published or simultaneously under consideration elsewhere. Builds upon prior work can be submitted with additional papers and an explanation letter (seen by primary reviewer). Plagiarism will be checked using IEEE Crosscheck and may lead to rejection.
*   **AI-generated Text:** Large-scale language models (LLMs) can only be used for grammar editing.
*   **Submission Anonymity:** IEEE VR uses a DOUBLE-BLIND review process. Submissions must not contain author identifying information. Citations to authors' previous work must be in the third person. Failure to adhere to the double-blind policy will result in desk rejection.
*   **Pre-dissemination:** Uploading manuscripts to online repositories before the review process does not constitute a reason for rejection but can compromise anonymity.
*   **Videos:** Videos must be submitted according to instructions, free of identifying information. Accepted videos for the video proceedings will require a revised version.

### Contacts

*   **Technical Papers Chairs:** Daisuke Iwai, Luciana Nedel, Tabitha Peck, Voicu Popescu.

summary: The 22nd International Symposium on Web and Wireless Geographical Information Systems (W2GIS 2025) will be held in Mexico City, Mexico, from September 8-9, 2025. The symposium focuses on recent advances and research challenges in GIScience, particularly those arising from the integration of artificial intelligence, big data, and social networks within GIS, with a special emphasis on addressing environmental problems and sustainable development goals in urban contexts.
callForPapers:
# W2GIS 2025: Call for Papers

The 22nd International Symposium on Web and Wireless Geographical Information Systems (W2GIS 2025) invites high-quality submissions of three types of contributions: full papers, work in progress papers, and showcase papers. The conference will take place in **Mexico City, Mexico, from September 8-9, 2025**.

## Focus and Topics

The integration of artificial intelligence, big data, and social networks within GIS presents new opportunities for urban planning, transportation, and sustainability. However, these advancements also bring significant research challenges. As the conference takes place for the first time in Mexico City and Central America, a key focus is to explore how GIScience, combined with these technologies, can address emerging environmental problems in urban contexts, particularly in relation to sustainable development goals.

Topics to be addressed include, but are not limited to:

*   Geospatial databases and spatio-temporal data management.
*   Mobile spatial interaction and movement analysis.
*   Spatial search, GeoWeb search engines and services.
*   Location-based social networks.
*   Spatial social networks.
*   On-line spatial data mining.
*   GeoSensor data acquisition, processing, management and analysis.
*   Smart environments, Internet of Things and ambient spatial intelligence.
*   Exploratory cartography and Web and wireless geo interfaces.
*   GIS visualization techniques for Web and mobile location-based applications.
*   Cyber-geography & augmented reality.
*   Map personalization and adaptation.
*   3D modelling of cityscapes for location-based services.
*   Ubiquitous and wireless GIS.
*   Security, privacy, and usability issues of Web and wireless environments.
*   Semantic geospatial Web and interoperability.
*   User studies and evaluations of online geoservices.
*   Indoor and outdoor wayfinding and navigation.
*   Crowdsourcing and volunteered geographic information.
*   Telematics, GIS and location-based applications.
*   LBS and transportation applications.
*   Wireless-based location-aware applications.
*   Integration of AI and LLMs.

## Submission Types

*   **Full papers:** To present scientific results (limited to 16 pages).
*   **Short papers:** To present ongoing work (limited to 10 pages).
*   **Industry papers:** For works with a larger focus on industrial impact and at least one author with an industrial affiliation (10 to 16 pages).
*   **Showcase papers:** For live presentations of research prototypes and products (limited to 4 pages).

## Important Dates

*   **Submission deadline:** 8 March 2025 (extended to 23 March 2025)
*   **Notification of acceptance:** 20 May 2025
*   **Camera-Ready copy due:** 5 June 2025 (extended to 8 June 2025)
*   **Author registration deadline:** 25 July 2025
*   **Early-bird registration:** 25 May 2025

## Submission Instructions

Authors are invited to submit full, original, unpublished research papers. Each paper must be written in English, submitted in PDF format, and formatted using the Springer camera-ready templates available at the Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science website.

All contributions must be uploaded through the submission site at [EasyChair](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=w2gis2025).

All papers must be original and not simultaneously submitted to another conference or journal.

All submissions will be refereed for quality, originality, and relevance by the Program Committee.

## Doctoral Symposium

W2GIS 2025 will also feature a Doctoral Symposium, providing a valuable platform for Ph.D students to receive feedback and guidance from well-known researchers and industry experts.

## Dissemination

All accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings in the **Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series, which is indexed on Clarivate Analytics’ Web of Science, Scopus, EI Engineering Index, Google Scholar, DBLP and other platforms.

The authors of selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version of their work for consideration in a dedicated Special Issue of the Cuadernos de Geografía: Revista Colombiana de Geografía journal (Q4 on Scopus).

## Awards and Grants

*   **Awards:** Two 500 € prizes will be awarded for the best paper and the best presentation.
*   **Grants:** W2GIS 2025 offers two grants for Ph.D and master students, covering the conference registration fees. Apply Here [Apply Here link not provided in source text, use a placeholder or omit if not available].

## Registration

All information is available on the [Registration page](/view/w2gis-2025/registration). Please register at [EventBrite](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/w2gis-2025-tickets-1397246585149?aff=oddtdtcreator).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - VISIGRAPP 2025

The purpose of VISIGRAPP is to bring together researchers and practitioners interested in both theoretical advances and applications of computer vision, computer graphics, human-computer interaction and information visualization.

VISIGRAPP 2025 will be held in conjunction with **MODELSWARD 2025** and **ROBOVIS 2025**. Registration to VISIGRAPP allows free access to the MODELSWARD and ROBOVIS conferences (as a non-speaker).

Although the conference is back to the normal mode (i.e., in-person), speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Julien Pettré**, Inria, France
*   **Daniel Archambault**, Newcastle University, United Kingdom
*   **Katherine J. Kuchenbecker**, Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems, Germany
*   **Diane Larlus**, Naver Labs Europe, France

## Program Co-chairs (for affiliated conferences)

### GRAPP (20th International Conference on Computer Graphics Theory and Applications)
*   Thomas Bashford-Rogers, University of Warwick, United Kingdom
*   Daniel Meneveaux, University of Poitiers, XLIM, France

### HUCAPP (9th International Conference on Human Computer Interaction Theory and Applications)
*   Mehdi Ammi, University of Paris 8, France
*   Mounia Ziat, Bentley University, United States

### IVAPP (16th International Conference on Information Visualization Theory and Applications)
*   Stefan Jänicke, Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, University of Southern Denmark, Denmark
*   Helen C. Purchase, Monash University, Australia

### VISAPP (20th International Conference on Computer Vision Theory and Applications)
*   Petia Radeva, Universitat de Barcelona, Spain
*   Antonino Furnari, University of Catania, Italy

## Tutorials

*   **On the Turning Away: Enhancing Stroke Survivors Rehabilitation with Virtual Reality**
    *   Instructors: Bernardo Marques, Beatriz Sousa Santos and Sérgio Oliveira
*   **Egocentric Vision: Exploring User-Centric Perspectives**
    *   Instructor: Francesco Ragusa

## Publications

All papers presented at the conference venue will be available at the **SCITEPRESS Digital Library**.

It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with **Springer** in a **CCIS Series book**.

A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the **Springer Nature Computer Science Journal**.

## Important Dates, Topics of Interest, and Submission Guidelines

Specific details regarding submission deadlines, topics of interest, and detailed submission guidelines are not provided in the input text.

# WMSCI 2025: Call for Papers

The 29th World Multi-Conference on Systemics, Cybernetics and Informatics (WMSCI 2025) will be held from **September 9-12, 2025**, in **Orlando, Florida, USA**, organized by IIIS.

## About the Conference

The purpose of WMSCI 2025 is to promote discussions and interactions between researchers and practitioners focused on disciplinary, interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary issues, ideas, concepts, theories, methodologies and applications. It aims to foster the exchange of concepts, prototypes, research ideas, and other results that could contribute to the academic arena and benefit business and the industrial community.

WMSCI 2025 is an international forum for scientists, engineers, researchers, consultants, theoreticians, and practitioners in the fields of Systemics, Cybernetics, and Informatics. It focuses on specific disciplinary research, as well as multi-, inter-, and trans-disciplinary studies and projects.

## Ways of Participation

Both **Face-to-Face Participation** and **Virtual Participation** are accepted. Both kinds of submissions will have the same reviewing process, and the accepted papers will be included in the same proceedings.

*   **Face-to-Face Participation:** For presenters attending the conference in person.
*   **Virtual Participation:** For presenters unable to attend the conference in person.

## Submission Options

Authors can choose from the following submission types:

### Face-to-Face Participation:

*   **Draft Paper:** (2000-5000 words)
*   **Extended Abstract:** (600-2000 words)
*   **Abstract:** (300-600 words)

### Virtual Participation:

*   **Draft Paper:** (2000-5000 words)
*   **Extended Abstract:** (600-2000 words)

*Note: Title, authors, and references are not included in the word count.*

## Submission Format and Authors' Kit

*   **Submissions Format:** [Read here](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/website/submissionformat.asp?vc=1)
*   **Authors' Kit:** [PDF](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/Contents/AK-WMSCI-2025.pdf) | [DOCX](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/Contents/AK-WMSCI-2025.docx)

## Reviewing Process

All submitted papers/abstracts will go through three reviewing processes: (1) double-blind (at least three reviewers), (2) non-blind, and (3) participative peer reviews. Final acceptance depends on the three kinds of reviews, but a paper must be recommended by non-blind reviewers AND blind reviewers to be accepted for presentation at the conference and included in the proceedings.

## Important Dates

### Current and FINAL Set of Deadlines:

*   **June 6th, 2025:** Submission of draft papers (2000-5000 words) and extended abstracts (600-2000 words).
*   **July 3rd, 2025:** Submission of draft papers (2000-5000 words) and extended abstracts (600-2000 words).
*   **July 9th, 2025:** Notifications of acceptance.
*   **August 7th, 2025:** Submission of camera-ready or final versions of the accepted papers.
*   **September 9th, 2025:** Conference Starts
*   **September 12th, 2025:** Conference Ends

*Note: Some invited sessions or special tracks may have a different timetable according to their organizers and/or chairs.*

## Publication

Authors of the best 25%-30% of the papers presented at the conference (including those virtually presented) will be invited to adapt their papers for publication in the **Journal of Systemics, Cybernetics and Informatics**.

## Registration

Registration of at least one author per paper and the payment of the respective conference fees are necessary for the paper to be included in the Proceedings and its presentation to be scheduled in the Conference Program.

*   [Registration Guide](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/registration/bor2-Guide.asp?vc=1)
*   [Online Registration](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/registration/bor2.asp?vc=1)

## Invited Sessions

Invited Sessions can be organized on a specific or general theme and may grow to Focus Symposia, workshops, satellite events, micro-conferences, or independent/associated spin-offs from WMSCI.

*   [Invited Session Submissions](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/Invitedsession/Registro.asp?vc=1)
*   [How to Organize an Invited Session](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/Invitedsession/ISOrganization.asp?vc=1)

## Contact Us

[Contact Us](https://www.iiis2025.org/wmsci/Website/contactus.asp?vc=1)

callForPapers:
# CSCE 2025: Call for Papers

The 2025 World Congress in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, & Applied Computing (CSCE'25) will be held from **July 21-24, 2025, in Las Vegas, USA**.

## Overview

CSCE'25 is a major annual gathering of researchers in computer science, computer engineering, data science, artificial intelligence, STEM, and applied computing, anticipating between 1,000 and 1,500 participants from about 75 countries. The congress includes 21 major tracks, comprising 112 technical, research, and panel sessions, along with keynote lectures and tutorials.

## Presentation Modes

This year's Congress will be held **in person (face-to-face)**; however, **online presentation options** will also be available for authors and speakers who are unable to attend physically. The vast majority of speakers are expected to attend in person.

## Publication

All accepted papers will be published by **Springer Nature** in the proceedings (Research Books) and indexed in major Science Citation Indexation databases, including Scopus, DBLP, EI Engineering Index, Compendex, Inspec, Springer Links, Google Scholar, CP Citation Index, CPCI (part of Clarivate Analytics' Web of Science), ACM Digital Library, IO-Port, MathSciNet, and Zentralblatt MATH.

## Submission Information

*   **Paper Submission Portal:** [https://american-cse.org/drafts/](https://american-cse.org/drafts/)
*   **Paper Categories:** Various categories are available.
*   **Important Dates:** Refer to the "Important Dates" section on the conference website.

## Topics of Interest

The congress covers a wide range of topics across its 21 major tracks. Specific topics of interest can be found within the detailed track information on the conference website, including:

*   ACC (Automation, Control and Cybernetics)
*   BIOCOMP (Biocomputing)
*   BIOENG (Bioengineering)
*   CSC (Cyber Security and Cryptology)
*   EEE (Embedded Systems, Distributed and Real-Time Systems)
*   ESCS (Engineering, Education, and Social Computing)
*   FCS (Foundations of Computer Science)
*   FECS (Future Energy and Chemical Sciences)
*   GCC (Global Computing and Communications)
*   HIMS (Healthcare Informatics and Medical Systems)
*   ICAI (Intelligent Agents and Systems)
*   ICDATA (Data Science)
*   ICEQT (Electrical and Quantum Technologies)
*   ICOMP (International Conference on Computational Methods and Algorithms)
*   ICWN (Wireless and Mobile Networks)
*   IKE (Intelligent Knowledge Engineering and Web Intelligence)
*   IPCV (Image Processing, Computer Vision, and Machine Vision)
*   MSV (Model, Simulation, and Visualization)
*   PDPTA (Parallel and Distributed Processing, and Applications)
*   SAM (Software, Architecture, and Maintenance)
*   SERP (Service and Cloud Computing)

## Past Distinguished Speakers

The congress has featured distinguished speakers such as:

*   Prof. David Patterson (University of California, Berkeley)
*   Prof. Ian Foster (University of Chicago)
*   Prof. Lotfi A. Zadeh (University of California, Berkeley)
*   Prof. H. J. Siegel (Colorado State University)
*   Prof. John Holland (University of Michigan)
*   Prof. Ruzena Bajcsy (University of California, Berkeley)
*   Prof. Firouz Naderi (NASA's JPL)
*   Prof. John R. Koza (Stanford University)
*   Prof. David Lorge Parnas (McMaster University, Canada)
*   Prof. John Gustafson (Ceranovo, Inc.)
*   Anousheh Ansari (Chairwoman, Prodea Systems)

## Contact

Contact information is available on the conference website.

# WETICE 2024: Call for Papers

The 32nd International Conference on Enabling Technologies: Infrastructure for Collaborative Enterprises (WETICE 2024) will be held in **Reggio Emilia, Italy**, from **June 26th to 28th, 2024**.

WETICE is the annual international conference on state-of-the-art research in enabling technologies for collaboration. Established thirty-two years ago, WETICE aims at promoting fruitful discussions on the latest technology developments, directions, problems, and requirements. The conference includes presentations, keynote sessions, and group discussions.

All papers are refereed by the members of the Program Committee. Proceedings will be submitted for inclusion in IEEE Xplore, Scopus, DBLP, and Google Scholar.

## Topics Include

*   Distributed and Collaborative Business Processes
*   Process Mining
*   Workflow Automation
*   Cloud Computing for Collaboration
*   Collaboration in Digital Strategies
*   Collaborative and Distributed Learning Platforms
*   Collaborative Supply Chain Management
*   Distributed Database Technologies
*   Data Analytics and Fraud Detection
*   Data for Collaborative Processes
*   Data Privacy, Anonymity, and Confidentiality
*   Data Visualization and Analytics
*   Consensus and Fault Tolerance Algorithms
*   Decentralized Autonomous Organization
*   Distributed Cryptographic Algorithms and Protocols
*   Distributed Trust Management
*   Formal Verification and Model Checking
*   Blockchain-based Applications and Services
*   Decentralized Application Development
*   Performance and Scalability Issues
*   Internet of Things for Collaboration
*   Architecture, Scalability, Governance, and Interoperability
*   Monitoring and Analysis
*   Service-Orientation in Systems Engineering
*   Intelligent Manufacturing Platforms
*   Logistics and Intralogistics
*   Smart Grid and Energy Systems

## Submission Guidelines

*   The submissions must be original and not published or submitted for publication elsewhere.
*   All papers should be submitted via the following URL: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/WETICE2024](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/WETICE2024)
*   Papers must be written in English and formatted according to the guidelines at the following link: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
*   The maximum length of the paper is **6 pages**, including figures and references.
*   Authors are required to include their names and affiliations in their papers.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline (extended):** May 8th, 2024
*   **Notification of acceptance:** May 29th, 2024
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** TBD
*   **Registration Deadline:** June 12th, 2024
*   **Conference:** June 26th-28th, 2024

callForPapers:
# APLAS 2025: Call for Papers

Welcome to the website of the **23rd Asian Symposium on Programming Languages and Systems (APLAS) 2025**.

APLAS 2025 will occur from **October 27 to 30, 2025**, in **Bengaluru, India**. This year’s conference is co-located with the 23rd edition of the International Symposium on Automated Technology for Verification and Analysis ([ATVA 2025](https://conf.researchr.org/home/atva-2025)). We are proud to announce **Prof. Dr. Peter Müller** as our plenary joint keynote for APLAS and ATVA 2025!

## Scope

We solicit submissions in the form of regular research papers describing original scientific research results, including system development and case studies. Among others, solicited topics include:

*   **Programming paradigms and styles:** functional, object-oriented, probabilistic, logic, constraint programming; extensible programming languages; programming languages for systems code; novel programming paradigms.
*   **Methods and tools to specify and reason about programs and languages:** programming techniques; meta-programming; domain-specific languages; proof assistants; type systems; dependent types; program logics, static and dynamic program analysis; language-based security; model checking; testing.
*   **Programming language foundations:** formal semantics; type theory; logical foundations; category theory; automata; effects; monads and comonads; recursion and corecursion; continuations and effect handlers; program verification; memory models; abstract interpretation.
*   **Methods and tools for implementation:** compilers; program transformations; rewriting systems; partial evaluation; virtual machines; refactoring; intermediate languages; run-time environments; garbage collection and memory management; tracing; profiling; build systems; program synthesis.
*   **Concurrency and distribution:** process algebras; concurrency theory; session types; parallel programming; service-oriented computing; distributed and mobile computing; actor-based languages; verification and testing of concurrent and distributed systems.
*   **Applications and emerging topics:** programming languages and PL methods in education, security, privacy, database systems, computational biology, signal processing, graphics, human-computer interaction, computer-aided design, artificial intelligence and machine learning; case studies in program analysis and verification.

## Submission Information

*   Submissions should not exceed **17 pages**, excluding bibliography, in the [Springer LNCS format](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines).
*   The accepted papers will be allowed one extra page to accommodate reviewers’ feedback.
*   Additional material intended for reviewers but not for publication in the final version (e.g., details of proofs) may be placed in a clearly marked appendix that is not included in the page limit. However, the paper must be understandable without the appendix. Reviewers are not obligated to review it.
*   Submitted papers must be unpublished and not submitted for publication elsewhere.
*   Papers must be written in English.
*   Accepted papers must be presented at the conference. For further details, please consult [Springer Nature Code of Conduct for Authors](https://www.springernature.com/gp/authors/book-authors-code-of-conduct).
*   Papers should be submitted via HotCRP: [https://aplas25.hotcrp.com/](https://aplas25.hotcrp.com/)

## Reviewing Process

APLAS uses a **light double-blind reviewing process**, with a rebuttal phase, to address factual errors and minor misunderstandings. Reviewers will not see author names until they submit a review. Therefore, the authors must adhere to the following rules:

*   Omit your names and institutions.
*   Refer to your prior work in the third person, just as you refer to prior work by others.
*   Omit the acknowledgments.

## Publication

*   The proceedings will be published as a volume in [Springer’s LNCS series](https://link.springer.com/conference/aplas).
*   Authors interested in making their contributions Open Access, please refer to [Springer’s webpage](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/open-access-publishing-in-computer-proceedings) for additional information, or contact the organizers.

## Best Paper Award

APLAS continues the tradition of the best paper award. The award will be announced on the website, and printed certificates will be issued to the authors at the conference.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Submission Deadline:** Saturday, 7 June 2025
*   **Author Response Period:** Monday 7 - Wednesday 9 July 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification:** Friday 18 July 2025
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** Sunday 31 August 2025

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

ARITH 2025 welcomes submissions of conference papers describing recent scientific advances related to computer arithmetic. Papers under review elsewhere are not acceptable for submission to ARITH 2025. By submitting a paper, authors implicitly confirm that they are solely submitting it to ARITH 2025. Submissions must be in English.

## Submission System

Submissions must be made through the EasyChair website: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=arith2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=arith2025).

## Paper Types and Lengths

*   **Full papers:** Should not exceed **8 pages** (no extra pages) for submission. For review purposes, full papers may be submitted with up to 20 pages, using 12pt font size, single column, and double spacing.
*   **Short and industry papers:** Should not exceed **4 pages** (no extra pages) for submission. For review purposes, short/industry papers may be submitted with up to 10 pages, using 12pt font size, single column, and double spacing.

## Formatting

Papers must adhere to the IEEE Computer Society Conference format (two columns).

For formatting instructions, please refer to: [http://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](http://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html)

## Review Process

The review process for ARITH 2025 is **double-blind**. Author names, affiliations, and grants must be **anonymized** in submitted papers, and self-references should be handled as third-party references. Papers not complying with this policy will be administratively rejected. While non-anonymous preprints or code repositories are not considered a violation of this policy, reviewers are discouraged from seeking them out. Authors should provide anonymized versions of any related artifacts where applicable.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission deadline**: December 13, 2024
*   **Paper submission deadline**: December 23, 2024
*   **Reviews completed and Authors notified**: February 14, 2025

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but are not restricted to:

*   Arithmetic foundations, systems and formats
    *   Theory of computer arithmetic such as integer, fixed/floating-point, interval, finite-field, etc.
    *   Novel arithmetic systems and application-specific number formats.
*   Implementation of arithmetic
    *   Novel architecture of arithmetic units on various technologies including traditional, FPGA, optical and quantum.
    *   High-performance, low-power and fault-tolerant designs and implementations
    *   Design tools and methodologies, including testing and formal verification
*   Algorithms and numerics
    *   Computer approximations of elementary and special functions
    *   Arithmetic algorithms and their analysis
    *   Design, compilation, optimization, validation, and verification of numerical software
*   Application-specific arithmetic
    *   Cryptography or security
    *   Artificial intelligence, machine learning and deep learning
    *   Signal processing, multimedia, and computer graphics

All topics that relate to intensive use of computer arithmetic are welcome as well.

## Students

ARITH is the premier conference for computer arithmetic. Students of all levels are urged to submit a paper and/or attend the conference if they are interested in this subject.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 38th International Conference on Computer Applications in Industry and Engineering (CAINE 2025) provides an international forum for the presentation and discussion of research on computer applications in industry and engineering.

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** October 20 – 21, 2025
*   **Location:** Holiday Inn Downtown Superdome, New Orleans, Louisiana, USA
*   **Sponsored by:** International Society for Computers and Their Applications (ISCA)
*   **In conjunction with:** 34th International Conference on Software Engineering and Data Engineering (SEDE 2025)

## Topics of Interest

The conference focuses on research related to **computer applications in industry and engineering**. Authors are invited to submit original research and discussion papers within this broad scope.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Papers will be accepted into **oral presentation sessions**.
*   The conference includes a **Keynote Speech**.
*   **Submission Portal:** [https://www.caine-conf.org/main/submission/](https://www.caine-conf.org/main/submission/)
*   **Final Paper Submission:** [https://www.caine-conf.org/main/final-paper-submission/](https://www.caine-conf.org/main/final-paper-submission/)
*   The Call for Papers (CFP) can be downloaded from a provided link, but the link currently encounters a fetch error and requires the URL to be on the same domain.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission:** February 21, 2025
*   **Notification:** March 24, 2025
*   **Registration:** April 05, 2025
*   **Camera Ready:** April 13, 2025

*Note: Deadlines may differ for special tracks. Please consult the conference home page for specific details.* 

## Publication

Proceedings will be published by **Springer Nature** in the **Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS)** series. Links to previous CAINE proceedings on SpringerLink are available for reference.

## Registration

Registration details can be found at: [https://www.caine-conf.org/main/registration/](https://www.caine-conf.org/main/registration/)

## Awards

CAINE 2025 will feature a **Best Paper Award**.

# Call for Papers: 16th International Conference on Broadband Communications, Networks, and Systems (Broadnets)

The **16th International Conference on Broadband Communications, Networks, and Systems (Broadnets)** will take place from **August 14-16, 2025**, in **Sunyani, Ghana**.

## Important Dates

*   **Full Paper Submission deadline:** April 15th, 2025
*   **Notification deadline:** May 10th, 2025
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** June 14th, 2025

*Note: Deadlines for the Poster Track and Late Track appear to be historical (July 2024/August 2024) and may not apply to the main 2025 submissions.* For specific track deadlines, please refer to the conference website.

## Scope and Topics

The conference focuses on cutting-edge research and technological advancements in next-generation communication networks, artificial intelligence-driven security mechanisms, and intelligent systems. It aims to provide a platform for researchers, industry professionals, and policymakers to explore innovative solutions in **5G/6G networks**, **IoT-enabled smart systems**, **speech and signal processing**, **cybersecurity**, and **edge computing**.

Key areas of interest include:

*   Network architectures
*   Distributed computing
*   Digital twin technologies
*   Vehicular communication
*   Trust and privacy mechanisms
*   AI-driven anomaly detection
*   Speech and signal processing techniques (especially in secure communications, speech enhancement, and audio analytics for real-time applications)
*   Cloud-to-things systems
*   Fog computing
*   AI-driven access control

## Publication

All registered papers will be submitted for publishing by **Springer** and made available through the **SpringerLink Digital Library**.

Proceedings will be submitted for inclusion in leading indexing services, such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Inspec, and Zentralblatt MATH.

Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version to:

*   **Springer Wireless Networks (WINET) Journal** [IF: 2.1 (2023)]
*   **EAI Endorsed Transactions on Mobile Communications and Applications** (Scopus, Ei-indexed, ESCI-WoS, Compendex) - with an additional fee.

Additional publication opportunities include:

*   EAI Transactions series (Open Access)
*   EAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series (indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Paper Submission:** Authors are invited to submit their papers through the designated submission system.
*   **Author's kit – Instructions and Templates:** Detailed instructions and templates will be provided.
*   **Contribution Types:** The conference accepts various contribution types, including full papers, poster papers, and late-track papers.

For more details on submission formats and requirements, please refer to the conference's official Call for Papers page.

# Call for Papers

## IEEE/ACM International Conference on Big Data Computing, Applications and Technologies (BDCAT 2025)

We are pleased to announce that the **12th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Big Data Computing, Applications and Technologies (BDCAT 2025)** will be held in **Nantes, France between 1st and 4th December, 2025**.

BDCAT is a premier annual conference series aiming to provide a platform for researchers from both academia and industry to present new discoveries in the broad area of big data computing and applications. BDCAT 2025 will be held in conjunction with the 18th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Utility and Cloud Computing (UCC 2025).

You can download the PDF version of the BDCAT 2025 Call for Papers [HERE](https://bdcat2025.gitlabpages.inria.fr/web/call/call-for-papers.pdf).

## Topics of Interest

Authors are invited to submit original, unpublished research manuscripts in all areas of Big Data computing, applications and technologies, as well as on related scaling data analysis. Topics of interest include (but are not limited to):

*   **Machine Learning and Data Mining**
    *   Data Science Models and Approaches
    *   Supervised, Unsupervised, Semi-supervised and Reinforcement Learning
    *   Neural Networks, Convolution Neural Networks and Recurrent Neural Networks
    *   Autoencoders, Transformer, Large Language Model
    *   Natural Language Understanding, Natural Language Processing
    *   Swarm Intelligence and Evolutionary Strategy
    *   Computational Efficient Model Training, Inference and Serving
    *   Distributed, Federated and Parallel Learning Algorithms
    *   Fairness, Interpretability and Explainability
*   **Data Processing and Infrastructures/Platforms**
    *   Data Acquisition, Integration, Cleaning and Best Practices
    *   Scalable Computing Models, Theories and Algorithms
    *   Mapreduce: Hadoop and Spark
    *   Privacy and Security over the Data Life Cycle
    *   Data Search and Information Retrieval Techniques
    *   Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) or ETL Pipelines
    *   In-Memory Systems and Platforms
    *   Performance Evaluation Reports
    *   Storage Systems (including file systems, NoSQL, and RDBMS)
    *   Resource Management Approaches
    *   Data Analytics on Edge Devices
    *   Fault Tolerance and Reliability
    *   Energy-Efficiency and Sustainability
    *   Data Archival and Preservation
    *   Testing, Debugging and Monitoring
    *   Specialized Hardware for Scaling
*   **Applications Domains**
    *   Internet of Things, Mobile Applications and Cyber-Physical Systems
    *   Healthcare and Life Science (e.g., Genome Processing)
    *   Physical Science and Engineering
    *   Business and Enterprise Applications
    *   Social Network Analysis
    *   Scientific Case Studies and Workflows
    *   Risk Analysis and Management
    *   Cloud-Edge Continuum
    *   Data Streaming and Batch Applications
*   **Data Trends and Challenges**
    *   Data Visualization and Analytics
    *   Visual Analytics Algorithms and Foundations
    *   Graph and Context Models for Visualization
    *   Analytics Reasoning and Sense-making
    *   Visual Representation and Interaction
    *   Data Transformation and Presentation

## Paper Submission

*   Submitted manuscripts must represent original and unpublished research that is not currently under review for any other conference or journal.
*   Manuscripts should be submitted in **PDF format** and may not exceed **ten (10) IEEE-formatted double-column pages**, including figures, tables, and references.
*   All manuscripts undergo a **double-blind peer-review process**.
*   At least one author per accepted paper must register for the conference for the paper to be published in the proceedings.
*   The conference proceedings will be published by the ACM and made available online via the **IEEE Xplore Digital Library and ACM Digital Library**.

## Important Dates

Time zone: Anywhere on Earth (AoE)

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** 5 September 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification:** 17 October 2025
*   **Camera Ready Papers Due:** Mid November 2025

## Venue

The conference will be held at the **University of Nantes, France**.

## Awards and Special Issues

*   A selection committee will acknowledge the **best paper** during the conference.
*   Authors of highly rated papers will be invited to submit an extended version to **special issues of prestigious journals**.

## Co-located Conference

BDCAT 2025 is co-located with the **18th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Utility and Cloud Computing (UCC 2025)**.

callForPapers:
# Call for Technical Papers

The IEEE-EMBS International Conference on Body Sensor Networks (BSN 2025) invites submissions for its annual conference, themed “Computational Medicine: Expanding Health through Sensing and AI.” The conference will be held in Los Angeles, California, USA, from November 3–5, 2025.

BSN 2025 is the premier conference on sensing systems for digital health, providing a cross-disciplinary, highly selective, single-track forum for cutting-edge research.

## Submission Types and Guidelines

*   **Regular Technical Papers:** 4-page limit (including references).
*   **Technical Abstracts:** 1-page limit (including references).
*   **Clinical Abstracts:** 1-page limit (including references).
*   **Demo Abstracts:** 1-page limit (including references).

All submissions are required to follow the **IEEE Conference template**. BSN adopts a **single-blind review process**, allowing authors to include their names and affiliations in the submission.

Excellent papers will be invited for extension and rapid review for publication in the **IEEE Open Journal of Engineering in Medicine and Biology**.

**Student Travel Awards** will be provided to selected students from worldwide institutions.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Novel digital health solutions (i.e., sensors and algorithms) for diagnosis, disease progress tracking, and self-management.
*   Sensors and systems for digital health, wellness, and athletics.
*   Conformable decoders: unintrusive, comfortable, self-powered sensors and systems.
*   Flexible, stretchable, and imperceptible electronics for sensors and systems.
*   Contact-less solutions for human sensing.
*   Power-optimization for implantable and wearable sensors and systems.
*   Wearable robotics system for digital healthcare.
*   Signal processing, machine learning, deep learning, and decision-support algorithms.
*   Adaptive, personalized intervention systems by closing the loop between technologies and humans.
*   Security, privacy, and trust in digital health technologies.
*   Optimization and personalization for digital health technologies and outcomes.
*   Human-centered design for digital healthcare to address real-world stakeholder needs.
*   Emerging topics such as Agentic AI and LLMs for computational health

## Important Dates

All deadlines are **11:59 pm AoE**:

1.  **Workshop Proposal Deadline:** June 15, 2025
2.  **Workshop Acceptance Notification:** June 29, 2025
3.  **Paper Submission Deadline:** July 11, 2025
4.  **Abstract, Clinical abstracts, and Demo Submission Deadline:** July 11, 2025
5.  **Paper Acceptance Notification:** August 1, 2025
6.  **Abstract Acceptance Notification:** August 1, 2025
7.  **Late Breaking Abstract Deadline:** August 10, 2025
8.  **Late Breaking Abstract Notification:** August 24, 2025
9.  **Camera-Ready Deadline:** September 1, 2025
10. **Conference Dates:** November 3-5, 2025

## Submission

Submit your 4-page technical paper here: [https://openreview.net/group?id=IEEE.org/EMBS/BSN/2025/Conference&referrer=%5BHomepage%5D(%2F)#tab-your-consoles](https://openreview.net/group?id=IEEE.org/EMBS/BSN/2025/Conference&referrer=%5BHomepage%5D(%2F)#tab-your-consoles)

## Awards

Awards will be presented for **Best Paper, Best Demo, and Best Clinical Abstract** recognizing excellent contributions.

## Workshops and Tutorials

Google will host a tutorial session on using their Foundation Models for Wearable Sensors and Time-Series Data. Details on associated workshops and other tutorials will be available on the workshop page.

callForPapers:
# CCC'25: Call for Papers

The Computational Complexity Conference (CCC) is an annual conference focused on the inherent difficulty of computational problems under resource constraints. CCC 2025 will be held in **Toronto, Canada**, from **August 5–8, 2025**.

## Scope

The conference seeks original research papers in all areas of computational complexity theory. Contributions from all topics with connections to or motivated by questions in complexity theory are welcome, with a special encouragement for submissions addressing complexity-theoretic issues in adjacent areas such as coding theory, cryptography, game theory, learning, logic, and privacy.

Possible topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Complexity classes
*   Reducibility and completeness
*   Circuit complexity
*   Communication complexity
*   Algebraic complexity
*   Proof complexity
*   Complexity in other concrete computational models
*   Interactive and probabilistic proof systems
*   Logic and descriptive complexity
*   Pseudorandomness and derandomization
*   Average case complexity
*   Quantum computation
*   Parametrized complexity
*   Fine-grained complexity
*   Complexity-theoretic aspects of: coding theory, cryptography, optimization (including inapproximability, continuous optimization), property testing, streaming and sublinear computation, distributed computation, game theory, machine learning, privacy.

## Submission

### Deadlines

*   **Submission Deadline:** Friday, February 7, 2025, 23:59 AoE
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Friday, May 2, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Due:** End of May, 2025

### Submission Server

Papers must be submitted electronically via the submission server: [https://ccc2025.hotcrp.com/](https://ccc2025.hotcrp.com/)

### Format

*   Submissions should start with a title page including the title and a 1-2 paragraph abstract.
*   The first 10 pages should clearly present the paper's merits, including importance, prior work, and key technical ideas. Supplementary material beyond the first 10 pages, abstract, and references is optional and will be read at the committee's discretion.
*   Submissions should include proofs of all central claims.
*   The submission should be in single-column format, use at least 11-point font, at least 1-inch margins, and at least single-spacing between lines.

## Review Process

*   The conference will employ a **lightweight double-blind reviewing process**.
*   Submissions should **not reveal the identity of the authors** in any way (names, affiliations, email addresses). This information will be uploaded separately on the submission site.
*   Authors are encouraged to post their papers to arXiv/ECCC/IACR etc.

## Additional Remarks

Authors may optionally send an email to the program committee (PC) chair at [ccc2025chair@gmail.com](mailto:ccc2025chair@gmail.com) with any additional remarks for the PC.

## Conflict of Interest

PC members and reviewers are expected to recuse themselves from evaluating submissions where a conflict of interest exists (e.g., thesis advisor, close collaborator).

## Simultaneous Submission Policy

Material previously published or scheduled for publication prior to September 2025 will not be considered. Simultaneous submission of the same material to another conference with published proceedings is not allowed.

## Confidentiality

All submissions will be treated as confidential.

## Publication

*   **Online Posting:** Authors are encouraged to post full versions of their submissions in accessible online repositories like the [Electronic Colloquium on Computational Complexity](http://eccc.hpi-web.de/eccc) or arXiv.
*   **Proceedings:** The conference proceedings will be published under a Creative Commons BY license in the Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs) series.

## Presentation

Authors of accepted papers are expected to present their work at the conference. Time allocations for presentations will be determined by the program committee (between 15 and 45 minutes).

## Awards

*   **EATCS Luca Trevisan award for the CCC best student paper:** For papers written solely by students.
*   **Best paper award:** For the best paper submitted to the conference.

## Conference Information

*   **Dates and Location:** August 5–8, 2025, Toronto, Canada.
*   **Travel Allowances:** Available for students and post-doctoral fellows.
*   **Visas:** Information regarding visa requirements for Canada can be found on the Canadian government's visa website. Contact the local arrangements committee for visa support letters.
*   **Code of Conduct:** CCC 2025 is committed to providing an environment free of discrimination and harassment, adhering to the SafeTOC initiative.

callForPapers:
# CIDR 2025: Call for Papers

The Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR) is a systems-oriented conference, complementary to mainstream database conferences, emphasizing the systems architecture perspective. CIDR 2025 will be held in **Amsterdam, The Netherlands, from January 19-22, 2025**.

## Overview

CIDR gathers researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to discuss innovative and visionary ideas in data management systems. It encourages contributions on novel approaches to data management systems, architecture, and usage, including cloud-based systems, data storage, networking, hardware acceleration, custom processors, memory hierarchies, processor interconnects, and ML/AI technologies for data processing. CIDR values innovation, experience-based insight, and vision.

## Contribution Types

CIDR 2025 invites two kinds of contributions:

*   **Papers:** (at most 6 pages) Including regular research papers and more visionary papers that promote interesting ideas and ongoing work.
*   **Demos:** (at most 6 pages) This can be a video or a description of the demo.

To encourage authors to submit only their best work, each person can be an author or co-author of **at most one submission** of any kind.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Format:** Papers should be submitted in PDF format.
*   **Length:** Papers must not exceed 6 pages, including all references and appendix.
*   **Template:** Submissions must be formatted using the double-column ACM sigconf style. LaTeX and Word templates are available.
*   **Submission Portal:** Submit electronically via CMT: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CIDR2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CIDR2025)
*   **Presentation:** At least one author of an accepted paper or demo is expected to attend the conference in person to present.

## Important Dates

(All deadlines are 11:59pm Pacific Time)

*   **Submission deadline:** August 2nd, 2024
*   **Author notification:** October 4th, 2024
*   **Conference Dates:** January 19-22, 2025

## Camera-Ready Guidelines

*   Follow the formatting instructions above.
*   Include the following copyright notice at the bottom left of the first page:
    > This paper is published under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC-BY 4.0) license. Authors reserve their rights to disseminate the work on their personal and corporate Web sites with the appropriate attribution, provided that you attribute the original work to the authors and CIDR 2025. 15th Annual Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR '25). January 19-22, 2025, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
*   Recommended LaTeX style file and Word template files include the copyright notice.

## Diversity and Inclusion

Authors are strongly urged to follow the D&I writing instructions when drafting paper submissions.

callForPapers:
# Computability in Europe 2025 (CiE 2025): Call for Papers

Computability in Europe (CiE) is an interdisciplinary series of international conferences organized by the Association Computability in Europe (ACiE). CiE brings together both basic and application-oriented research in computability-related areas of science.

The **CiE 2025** conference will be held in **Lisbon, Portugal, from July 14 to July 18, 2025**.

## Topics of Interest

The conference welcomes research contributions on computability-related fields of science, including:

*   Mathematics
*   Theoretical Computer Science
*   Logic
*   Quantum Computability
*   Cryptography
*   Information Theory
*   Computational Biology
*   Computational Linguistics
*   History and Philosophy of Computability
*   And many other related subjects.

## Deadlines and Important Dates

*   **Abstract Submission:** January 26, 2025 (AOE)
*   **Full Paper Submission:** February 2, 2025 (AOE)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** April 6, 2025
*   **Final Versions Due:** April 13, 2025
*   **Informal Presentations Submission:** April 22, 2025
*   **Early Registration:** Before May 6, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 14-18, 2025

## Participant Support

*   **Women in Computability:** As part of the program, support is offered for junior women researchers to join CiE 2025. See the details [here](https://sites.google.com/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/registration).
*   **Student Travel Support:** The Association for Symbolic Logic will support the travels of some students. More information can be found [here](/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/registration).

## Submission Information

Information regarding the submission process can be found on the [conference home page](/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/home).

callForPapers:
# IEEE CoG 2025: Call for Papers

The annual IEEE Conference on Games (IEEE CoG 2025) is a leading scientific research venue for game researchers and practitioners. Games offer a fantastic domain for computational creativity, game design, technology, education, social sciences, and artificial and computational intelligence. IEEE CoG 2025 will be held at the Técnico Innovation Center, Instituto Superior Técnico in Lisbon, Portugal, from **August 26th to 29th, 2025**.

## Submission Types

We invite the submission of:

*   **Full technical papers:** Should provide a technical or empirical contribution to scientific, technical, or engineering aspects of games. Limit: 8 pages (including references and appendices).
*   **Full vision papers:** Should describe a vision for the future of the Games field or some part of it, be based on extensive research, and include a comprehensive bibliography. Please note that literature reviews and opinion papers with speculations not grounded in research are immediately rejected. Limit: 8 pages (including references and appendices).

## Topics of Interest

We invite contributions related to all aspects of games and game development, including, but not limited to:

*   Accessibility and inclusivity in games (e.g., computer games, board games, LARPs)
*   AI for game development (automated playtesting, adaptation/personalization in games, etc.)
*   Esports and live-streaming
*   Extended reality (virtual reality, mixed reality, and augmented reality)
*   Game AI
*   Game analytics, game data science, and data visualization
*   Games as test-beds for algorithms
*   Game design (frameworks, game mechanics, etc.)
*   Game editors and authoring tools
*   Game technology (game engines, graphics, audio, animation, physics, controls, etc.)
*   Game user research (player/opponent modeling, player experience studies, psychology of play and player types, etc.)
*   Generative AI for games
*   Procedural content generation
*   Serious/applied games (for education, health, sustainability, etc.)
*   User interfaces in games

## Tracks

Authors should select the track that best matches their research. Descriptions for each track are listed below:

*   **1) AI and Game-playing:** Suitable for computational and artificial intelligence applications in digital and non-digital games, except for procedural content generation. Topics include general game-playing AI, mixed-initiative authoring tools, believable agents, and AI-assisted game design and testing.
    *   Track chairs: Diego-Perez Liebana (diego.perez@qmul.ac.uk) and Kyung-Joong Kim (kjkim@gist.ac.kr)
*   **2) Procedural Content Generation (PCG):** Focuses on advancing research on developing and evaluating algorithms that automatically create game design and content such as levels, maps, characters, stories, textures, and music. Theoretical papers are welcome.
    *   Track chairs: Antonios Liapis (an.liapis@gmail.com) and Ahmed Khalifa (ahmed.khalifa@um.edu.mt)
*   **3) Designing Games, Serious Games and Playful Experience:** Welcomes papers that make a designerly contribution to games, playful interaction, and other playable media. A broad range of submissions advancing practical or theoretical understanding of designing games, playful interactions, and player experience in various contexts are welcome.
    *   Track chairs: Casper Harteveld (c.harteveld@northeastern.edu)
*   **4) Game Technology:** Invites papers that improve the technical aspects of game design and development besides AI and robotics. Typical contributions include game engines, benchmarks, computer graphics techniques, animation, networking, and novel interaction technology (e.g., XR and alternative control). Papers about game competitions are also a good fit.
    *   Track chairs: Christopher Salge (C.Salge@herts.ac.uk) and Johannes Pfau (j.pfau@uu.nl)
*   **5) Game HCI, Player Experience, Game Analytics, e-sports:** Suitable for submissions that seek to understand people in the context of play. Example topics include player experience evaluation (player psychology, games user research, and game analytics), the study of player and developer communities, and understanding humans in the context of play.
    *   Track chairs: Alessandro Canossa (acan@kglakademi.dk) and Erica Kleinman (e.kleinman@northeastern.edu)
*   **6) Robots in Games:** (Implicitly covered under other tracks, or to be confirmed based on specific content not fully detailed here)

*Note: CoG is not a conference about game theory unless it is applied to playable games (video or board games).* 

## Important Dates

All times **Anytime on Earth (AoE)**:

*   **Call for Full Papers:** March 15, 2025 (Closed)
*   **Full papers acceptance notification:** May 16, 2025 (Closed)
*   **Full papers camera ready:** June 13, 2025
*   **Call for Auxiliary Papers:** May 30, 2025 (Open)
*   **Call for Doctoral Consortium:** May 30, 2025 (Open)
*   Call for Competitions: January 19, 2025 (Closed)
*   Call for Tutorials: January 19, 2025 (Closed)
*   Call for Workshops: January 19, 2025 (Closed)

## Submission Instructions

*   Papers and Auxiliary papers must be submitted through the Easychair conference submission system: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cog2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cog2025)
*   All paper submissions should follow the recommended IEEE conference author guidelines. MS Word and LaTeX templates can be found at: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
*   CoG will use a **double-blind review process**. Authors must omit their names and affiliations from their submissions and avoid obvious identifying statements. Submissions not abiding by anonymity requirements will be desk rejected.

## Camera-Ready Submission

Here are the steps to generate and submit your camera-ready paper:

1.  Create an account at IEEE PDF eXpress: [https://ieee-pdf-express.org/account/Login](https://ieee-pdf-express.org/account/Login) using the Conference ID: **64752X**.
2.  Upload your manuscript and generate your IEEE Xplore-Compatible PDF. Ensure it complies with IEEE guidelines: [https://ieee-pdf-express.org/External/UsingIEEEPDFeXpress](https://ieee-pdf-express.org/External/UsingIEEEPDFeXpress).
3.  Log in to EasyChair using your account and go to your proceedings author page.
4.  Upload your final IEEE Xplore-Compatible PDF.
5.  Complete the IEEE Copyright Agreement, which will be provided via email.

## Contact

*   Email: [cog2025@inesc-id.pt](mailto:cog2025@inesc-id.pt)

## Code of Conduct

IEEE CoG 2025 adheres to IEEE’s nondiscrimination policy and Code of Ethics, committing to a harassment-free, accessible, and pleasant conference experience for all participants. Participants can contact any member of the Organization in confidence or use IEEE’s Ethics Reporting Line.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - CoDIT 2025

The 11th International Conference on Control, Decision and Information Technologies (CoDIT 2025) will be held in a **hybrid format**, allowing both virtual and in-person participation, from **July 15-18, 2025**, at **Split, Croatia**.

## Welcome

CoDIT 2025 serves as a forum for technical exchange among scientists interested in Control, Automation, Robotics, Optimization, Decision, Cybernetics, Computer Science, and Information Technologies. It offers an exceptional platform for both academic and industrial communities to tackle new challenges, share solutions, and explore future research directions.

## Call for Contributed Papers

All papers must be written in English and should describe original work.

All registered and presented papers (Regular and Short-WiP) will be submitted for inclusion into **IEEE Xplore** as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.

### Regular Papers

*   The length of the paper is limited to a maximum of **6 pages** (in the standard IEEE conference double-column format).
*   Registered and presented regular papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.
*   Papers will be refereed through a **blind process** for technical merit and content.
*   To be eligible for publication in the Conference proceedings, an accepted paper must be presented at the Conference by one of the authors.
*   You can send your work as a regular paper or send it to one of the accepted special sessions.
*   Papers should be submitted before **April 30, 2025**.

### Short Papers (Work-in-Progress / WiP)

*   The length of WiP paper is limited to a maximum of **4 pages**.
*   At most **8 references** can be included.
*   WiP (short papers) contributors are expected to give a **short presentation** of their work (10 mn).

## Templates for Authors

The submitted papers should follow the usual IEEE paper format for conferences (two-columns, 10 point, Times New Roman).

Templates are available for:

*   [LaTeX](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/learn/creating-a-latex-document) (Example, actual link would be provided by conference)
*   [MS Word](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/learn/creating-a-latex-document) (Example, actual link would be provided by conference)

## Call for Special Sessions

*   The goal of special sessions (5-6 papers) and special tracks (at least two sessions) is to provide focused discussions on new topics or innovative applications.
*   Each prospective session/track organizer must submit a proposal, including the title of the session, a short description, and the organizer's name.
*   Proposals should be submitted before **January 17, 2025**.
*   To submit your proposal, please fill in the form inside the following MS Word file, convert it as PDF, and upload the generated PDF to the PaperCept Conference Management System at: [https://controls.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl](https://controls.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl) (click on the CoDIT 2024 link “Submit a special session to CoDIT 2025” and follow the steps).

## Key Dates

*   **Submission site opening:** November 07, 2024
*   **Special session Proposal:** January 17, 2025
*   **Papers submission deadline:** April 30, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** April 27, 2025 (for papers submitted by April 7) / May 10, 2025 (for papers submitted after April 7).
*   **Final version due:** May 27, 2025
*   **Registration deadline:** May 27, 2025

## Publications & Special Issues

Along with the publication of the proceedings in IEEE Xplore, the best-presented papers at CoDIT 2025 will have the opportunity to be extended and published in prestigious special issues:

*   International Journal of Dynamics and Control (Impact Factor: 2.2)
*   Transactions of the Institute of Measurement and Control (Impact Factor: 1.7)
*   Computational Optimization and Applications (Impact Factor: 1.6)

## Registration

Registration for CoDIT 2025 should be made online by CREDIT CARD at: [Registration Link](https://controls-registration.paperhost.net/codit25/)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IADIS International Conference Applied Computing (IADIS AC) 2025

The IADIS International Conference Applied Computing (IADIS AC) 2025 aims to address the main issues of concern within the applied computing area and related fields, covering essentially technical aspects. Innovative contributions that don’t fit into the defined areas will also be considered.

## Areas of Interest

All areas related to Applied Computing are of interest, including:

### Application Fields

*   eCommerce and ePayment
*   eLearning
*   eHealth and eSports
*   IT services
*   Mobile computing
*   Knowledge management and distribution

### Fundamental Concepts and Engineering

*   Algorithms
*   Data bases and data mining
*   Information Systems
*   Information sourcing and aggregation
*   Programming languages and concepts
*   Security and Privacy

### Usability

*   Automation of Services
*   Human-centred Computing
*   Multimedia and Visualization
*   Modalities of User Interfacing
*   Personalization and empathic systems
*   Virtual Reality

### Performance

*   Distributed and parallel systems
*   Cloud Computing
*   Evaluation and Assessment
*   Intelligent systems
*   Large-scale applications
*   Local and distributed storage

### Communication

*   IoT
*   Industry 4.0
*   Mobile Systems and Networks
*   Protocols, Standards and Mark-up Languages
*   Sensor Networks
*   WWW Applications and Technologies

### Hardware scope

*   Embedded Computing
*   Environment-friendly Constructions
*   Mobile Aspects
*   Realization of IoT nodes
*   Security concepts and devices
*   Wideband Information streaming

## Contribution Types

*   **Full Papers:** Max 8 pages (5,000 words), for accomplished research results.
*   **Short Papers:** Max 4 pages (2,500 words), for work in progress or fresh developments.
*   **Reflection Papers:** Max 2 pages (1500 words), for literature reviews, trend analysis, or discussion of issues.
*   **Posters / Demonstrations:** Max 1 page (625 words), with the poster or demonstration to be exposed.
*   **Tutorials:** Proposal of max 250 words.
*   **Panels:** Proposal of max 250 words.
*   **Invited Talks:** Abstract included in proceedings.
*   **Doctoral Consortium:** Max 2,500 words (4 pages), for PhD students.
*   **Corporate Showcases & Exhibitions:** For company presentations and displays.

## Review Process

This is a **blind peer-reviewed conference**.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline (2nd CFP):** 25 July 2025
*   **Notification to Authors (2nd CFP):** 1 September 2025
*   **Final Camera-Ready Submission and Early Registration (1st CFP):** Until 18 July 2025
*   **Late Registration (1st CFP):** After 18 July 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** 1 – 3 November 2025

## Submission

Submit your paper here: [https://conf-system.org/confman_ac2025/author_new.asp](https://conf-system.org/confman_ac2025/author_new.asp)

## Publication and Indexing

*   Proceedings will be published in the form of a book and digital copy with ISBN.
*   Conference proceedings will be submitted (pending approval) to indexing services, including Crossref, and each published paper will be allocated a DOI.
*   Extended versions of the best papers will be selected for publication in the IADIS Journal on Computer Science and Information Systems (ISSN: 1646-3692), indexed by Emerging Sources Citation Index by Thomson Reuters.

## Contact

*   Email: [secretariat@computing-conf.org](mailto:secretariat@computing-conf.org)
*   Phone: +351 969 833 989

callForPapers:
# ICAISC 2025: Call for Papers

The 24th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Soft Computing (ICAISC 2025) will be held in **Zakopane, Poland**, from **June 22-26, 2025**, at the **Bachleda Kasprowy Zakopane Hotel**.

The conference will be held in a **hybrid mode**: online and on-site. Authors of accepted papers will have the choice to present their papers online or on-site.

All accepted papers, irrespective of the presentation mode, will be included in the **LNAI conference proceedings** published by Springer.

## About ICAISC 2025

The conference provides an excellent opportunity for scientists and engineers to present and discuss the latest scientific results and methods. It will include keynote addresses, contributed papers, and numerous lectures and tutorials.

## Scope

Contributions covering all theoretical developments and practical applications in artificial intelligence and soft computing techniques are invited. Key technical areas include, but are not limited to:

*   AI and adversarial attacks
*   Agent-based systems
*   Ant colony optimization
*   Approximate reasoning
*   Artificial immune systems
*   Artificial Intelligence in modelling and simulation
*   Artificial Intelligence in scheduling and optimization
*   Artificial life
*   Bioinformatics and computational biology
*   Brain-machine interfaces
*   Cognitive systems and applications
*   Collective intelligence
*   Computer vision
*   Data mining
*   Differential Evolution
*   Evolutionary data mining
*   Evolutionary design
*   Evolutionary scheduling
*   Expert systems
*   Explainable AI
*   Fuzzy Computing with Words
*   Fuzzy control and intelligent systems
*   Fuzzy decision making and decision support systems
*   Fuzzy logic and fuzzy set theory
*   Fuzzy optimization and design
*   Fuzzy pattern recognition
*   Fuzzy systems for robotics
*   Game theory
*   Generative artificial intelligence
*   Hardware Implementations
*   Intelligent database systems
*   Knowledge engineering
*   Large language models
*   Machine learning
*   Modeling and identification
*   Molecular and quantum computing
*   Multi-agent systems
*   Natural language processing
*   Neural Network Theory and Architectures
*   Particle swarm optimization
*   Robotics and related fields
*   Robust and secure machine learning algorithms
*   Rough sets and rough data analysis
*   Speech understanding
*   Supervised and Unsupervised Learning
*   Type-2 fuzzy logic
*   Various Applications
*   Web intelligence
*   Human–computer interaction

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Language:** English.
*   **Originality:** Only original, unpublished papers are invited.
*   **Submission Format:** Electronic version of papers via the conference web page.
*   **Paper Structure:** Common scientific structure (abstract, state of the art, intention, methodology, results, references).
*   **Anonymity:** Prepare **anonymized versions** of the paper for submission. Avoid information that may identify authors in acknowledgements, links, or references. Refer to your previous work as if it were by someone else. Use "Anonymous ICAISC 2025 submission" in place of author names.
*   **Review Process:** Papers will undergo **double-blind reviewing** by an international committee.
*   **Acceptance Criteria:** Based on scientific merit and relevance to conference topics.
*   **Final Submission:** Accepted papers must be submitted in **Latex format only**. Authors will be allowed to make corrections based on reviewer suggestions.
*   **Copyright Form:** A completed and signed Consent-to-Publish form is required from the corresponding author. The form is available on the Springer website.
*   **Attendance:** Accepted papers **must be presented** by the author(s) personally to be published.
*   **Submission System:** [https://icaiscsystem.icaisc.eu/](https://icaiscsystem.icaisc.eu/)
*   **Springer Guidelines:** Authors should consult Springer’s [authors’ guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines) and use their proceedings templates (LaTeX or MS Word). LaTeX templates are also available in Overleaf.
*   **Paper Length:** Initial submissions should preferably be **12 pages**.

## Contribution Types

*   **Regular papers:** Preferably 12 pages, presented on-site as posters (max A0 size) or remotely via Zoom (10 min presentation + 3-5 min Q&A).

## Important Dates

*   **Submission of papers:** The deadline for submission has now passed.
*   **Notification of acceptance:** From **February 1, 2025**.
*   **Submission of camera-ready papers:** **April 10, 2025**.
*   **Conference date:** **June 22-26, 2025**.

## Day of Business & Science

On **Tuesday, June 24**, a special full-day event will bring together science, business, government, and innovation through AI. It will feature keynote speeches, discussions on science-industry cooperation, government actions in AI, and startup/investment panels.

## Previous Conferences & Proceedings

Proceedings of ICAISC 2024 (LNCS 15164, 15165, 15166) are available online. Conference participants receive free access to ICAISC 2024 proceedings via [https://icaiscsystem.icaisc.eu/](https://icaiscsystem.icaisc.eu/).

## Warning

Be aware of fake conferences organized by WASET (World Academy of Science, Engineering, and Technology) which may lack academic rigor and credibility.
